title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: If you"ve seen The Goodfellas or Casino , then you"ll know the story of The Wolf of Wall Street .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: This is another tale of a criminal whose ambitions sweep him away into a debauched world of dirty money , out - of - control substance abuse , endless lies , a troubled family life , and a downward spiral of corruption that inevitably leads to his own undoing .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: Only thing is , this is less about the gangsters and mafia ,

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: and more about white - collar crime .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: The guys wear suits , work in proper offices , and everything they do is just business ; funnily enough , this whole movie still plays out like a kind of gangster film .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: Based on the memoirs of Jordan Belfort - the real - life stock broker who made millions by selling shoddy stocks to average joes - the film showcases one seriously messed - up slimeball of a man .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: If his scheme sounds familiar , it"s because it"s been the inspiration behind the 2000 film Boiler Room ,

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: and this film covers much of the same concepts , albeit with better structure .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: The film maintains a close and intimate focus on the man as he rises to power , suckers thousands into his schemes , and then lives a life of extreme excess .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: And it is extreme : the whole film becomes laden with drugs , sex , superficial luxuries , material things , and characters who want nothing more than to take

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: and consume everything .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: The sheer corruption becomes palpable on - screen ,

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: and I couldn"t help but to shake my head at numerous scenes when I saw just how far these wolfish characters have gone in their unrestrained partying and debauchery .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: I have no clue as to how closely this film adapts the real - life events ,

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: but at times it"s almost hard to believe that things could have gone this far .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: And yet , the excesses serve to underscore key themes and criticisms on the American dream ; the pursuit of money and success , through any means , remains the main drive of the characters and the movie ,

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: and it leads to a fairly hard - hitting downfall .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: This film features good - looking photography and editing .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: Acting is great : Leonardo DiCaprio is practically perfect as the titular character , and the rest of the cast pulls their weight really well ( including Jonah Hill , who seems to fit into his character"s archetype very comfortably ) .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: Writing is really sharp and good ; the film is full of great lines and great speeches .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: There are some great - looking sets , props , and costumes on display in this film .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: Music has a varied mix of songs ,

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: and they"re all used really well for their intended effect .

review: but TWOWS is like a gangster film masked by the thin veil of upper - class corporate swindling .

title: Wolf of Wall Street review
review: It is a film that candidly shows the crimes and excesses in full , before proving that , even for the super - rich , crime still doesn"t pay . Recommended ! 4 .

review: but if he tries hard enough and stays the course in dissipation and exploitation , he can become a King like Jordan Belfort , with a fawning , obsequious following .

title: A masterful depiction of human piggishness
review: And what"s wrong with that ? What"s wrong with living the good life , by whatever means necessary , if you have the talent and only care about yourself ? Human baseness and predation are honored in the film through Belfort"s graphic gluttonous sex and extraordinary drug use , constantly extolled as giving the edge one needs to dominate and manipulate .

title: A masterful depiction of human piggishness
review: That , with unapologetic predation , are critical parts of the road map to the good life in the Scorsese model .

title: A masterful depiction of human piggishness
review: And with that , Scorsese proves a master in describing a modern day Inferno ( like Dante"s ) with the new paradigm that being bad is not so bad after all if you win in the end .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: " The business of America is business " screams an old cliché

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: but like so many clichés it"s based on reality .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: Is there much difference between a gangster and a stockbroker ? It"s the sign of a very poor mobster who can"t make a profit for his firm and it"s the same with the stock market .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: Thankfully capitalism is legal and every other socio - economic alternative has been a disaster for humanity

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: but one can"t help equating the stock exchange with being the same as gangsterism , supply and demand without any moral or humanitarian mores and one wonders how American auteur Martin Scorsese might bring a story of Wall Street to screen ? If there"s a problem with Scorsese he sometimes remakes the same type of film as in THE KING OF COMEDY and BRINGING OUT THE DEAD are remakes of TAXI DRIVER .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: Likewise GOODFELLAS was remade as CASINO .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: One can"t help thinking the temptation to make a story featuring an amoral capitalist could quite easily end up becoming a gangster film set in the world of high finance .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: " All my life I wanted to be a white collar criminal " In effect this is how the film works to a large degree

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: but Scorsese is on top of his game so having such a large similarity on a narrative and visual level with GOODFELLAS and CASINO doesn"t matter because for a movie lasting three hours it just flies by .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: Once again Scorsese uses the directorial technique of intensified continuity which is film critic speak for in your face direction .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: All the Scorsese hallmarks are here , breaking down the figurative fourth wall , garish and glossy cinematography , constant camera movement , pumping intrusive music etc etc .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: It"s all here and you"ve seen it all before but it"s so well done that none of this matters and remains totally compelling as once again the master director brings us Shakespearean tragedy in its most American and cinematic form To be fair to Jordan Belfort he didn"t torture or kill anybody and his methods of gaining economic profit only differs from the rest of the finance sector in that they"re illegal .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: Actually in amongst the excess of drugs , sex and foul language the storytelling doesn"t make a very good job in telling the audience the difference between legal and illegal stockbroking

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: but we"re asked to take on board that Belfort isn"t that bad because he"s played by DiCaprio .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: Fair enough and he does a good job as a shallow and greedy boy who seduces stupid greedy people in handing over their cash .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: The rest of the cast also go along with the loud colourful style of the movie

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: but was I puzzled by the one scene cameo by Mathew McConaughey in a pivotal role and kept expecting his character to make a reappearance at some point in the film which doesn"t happen . .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: It"ll be very ironic if as I expect McConaughey beats DiCaprio to the Oscar this year .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: A British audience might also find the casting of Joanna Lumley distracting in much the same way as Ray Winstone in THE DEPARTED ,

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: but the cinema audience I watched this with spent much of the running time laughing at the grotesque blackly comical scenes as they played out on screen .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: Mission accomplished Marty , although one can"t help thinking an inclusion of a scene where Belfort passes a card warning a colleague about something is trying a little bit too hard to paint Belfort in a better light than he deserves .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: I mean it"s not like anyone would be queuing up to listen to his lecture seminars after seeing this film is it now ? This is one of the better films from the long , prolific resume of Martin Scorsese , possibly his best since GOODFELLAS but one that will probably be very under rewarded at the prestigious award ceremonies due to one of the strongest film line ups seen in many years .

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: It also won"t convert anyone in to being a new found Scorsese fan

title: Goodfellas Meets Wall Street Meets Biting Black Comedy
review: but for those of us who"s enjoyed his familiar language of cinema to tell a story about the American dream turning in to a nightmare it"s proof once again that he"s Hollywood"s greatest living director .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: The title of my review says it all .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: The Wolf of Wall Street was literally the WORST movie I have seen in my entire life .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: My opinion might not be quite so negative if the movie hadn"t dragged its disorganized , rambling plot on for THREE WHOLE HOURS .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: At about the one hour mark I was already checking the clock out of boredom and disinterest ,

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: and continued to do so throughout the rest of the movie .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: I appreciate good film - making ,

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: and I appreciate that Martin Scorsese is widely recognized as a film genius , but I think this one was an artistic flop .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: The movie starts off entertaining ,

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: but it never really feels like the film takes off .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: Instead , I felt as if the film was rambling , always promising to find the point where the action gets good ,

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: but never quite getting there .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: The pacing is slower than molasses ,

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: and the dialogue inundated with largely meaningless conversations consisting mainly of expletives .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: While the movie focuses on Jordan Belfort"s ( DiCaprio ) addictions to money , sex , and drugs , we never see Belfort hit rock bottom as we would usually expect of such a movie .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: Nor does the movie glorify his addictions , so the audience is left merely absorbing the gamut of his largely taboo experience without any meaning or particular point to it .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: The nudity in this film , too , is needlessly gratuitous and seemingly serves no purpose other than to continuously drive the point to the audience that Belfort is an uncommonly selfish ass who enjoys the sexual underbelly of the underworld -- a point which could have been made just as effectively with about half the nudity and sexual scenes .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: Throughout the film we see none of the characters grow , nor do we see their actions have any other consequence besides generating more money , aside from Belfort"s divorce and imprisonment at the end of the film , which seem to carry absolutely no weight .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: The characters are flat and shallow -- not the kind of people you would want to spend three hours with .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: DiCaprio"s performance as Belfort was strong and believable , although the character was so thoroughly unlikable that it was difficult to enjoy his performance .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: Jonah Hill also gave a solid performance ,

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: but again , the character was too unlikable for me to care .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: Scorsese also used little visual and narrative tricks ( such as slowing the film down to focus on a ticking clock flying through the air , or having DiCaprio narrate Belfort"s thoughts ) to break up the flow of the story that , had they been used more consistently , more frequently , or in conjunction with any sort of meaning , would have had a positive stylistic impact on the film , but their usage was sporadic , giving the film a disjointed and uneven feeling .

title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen...
review: I will be sorely disappointed if the academy nominates this film for best picture , as it felt more like an unedited rough draft that was prematurely loosed on theater - goers rather than a carefully constructed , polished piece of cinema .

title: Howler Wolf
review: Motivational Speakers have gotten a bad reputation throughout the years ,

title: Howler Wolf
review: and perhaps rightly so .

title: Howler Wolf
review: They can talk up a storm yet there"s not much behind the curtain ... The same can be said of Leonardo DiCaprio"s energetic performance in THE WOLF OF WALL STREET , providing intense pep - rally speeches without any real games to follow : In fact the narration by DiCaprio"s con artist stockbroker Jordan Belfort gives just about everything away .

title: Howler Wolf
review: Imagine if , during the first minute of GOODFELLAS , Ray Liotta described the mafia as a bunch of worthless , lowlife , backstabbing killers : What"s left to learn

title: Howler Wolf
review: and experience ? Based on a true story centering on unapologetic greed and making gross amounts of money , director Martin Scorsese provides so much flash there"s very little substance , despite several attempts for a worthwhile baseline ... When Belfort starts his career as a low - end stockbroker , he almost suffers a necessary hunger before getting a quick bellyful of other people"s money .

title: Howler Wolf
review: Instead , right off the bat , his boss ( Matthew McConaughey ) unveils the nefarious sleight - of - hand before it"s even played out .

title: Howler Wolf
review: And later on , as Belfort"s team of shady brokers join his own Wall Street corporation , with the exception of sidekick Donnie Azoff , played by A - list sidekick Jonah Hill , no one not even Belfort"s gorgeous trophy wife amounts to anything beyond wallpaper .

title: Howler Wolf
review: One scene works the best : when a straight - laced FBI agent meets with Belfort on his yacht , there"s a beginning , middle and end to a somewhat intriguing conversation .

title: Howler Wolf
review: Here we finally learn what our antihero"s up against .

title: Howler Wolf
review: Perhaps an example of an " honest stockbroker , " one not targeted by the feds , would make us learn more about what makes Belfort particularly crooked .

title: Howler Wolf
review: Besides an immense rockstar appetite for women and drugs , we never get past the man"s perpetual debauchery .

title: Howler Wolf
review: This bloated and overlong howler of a WOLF could very well contend with SHOWGIRLS if an otherwise talented movie star , along with his iconic director / collaborator , weren"t on board ... When Belfort and Donnie take too many Quaaludes there"s a surreal twenty minutes that seemed like part of another movie perhaps LESS THAN ZERO if written by a sixth grader Which is nothing compared to a storm - riding yacht sequence that should have ended like Leo"s other ship movie , sparing us an extra half - hour ... Bringing us back to the Motivational Speaker concept : If DiCaprio"s best moments involve convincing a group of born cheaters they"d be better off rich and dishonest , he"s merely preaching to the choir .

title: Howler Wolf
review: The rest of us might need a reason to trust this jovially narcissistic , intentionally likable shyster before buying three long hours of his crap .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: SPOILER ALERT Based on the autobiography of convicted fraudster Jordan Belfort , The Wolf of Wall Street is as much a scam as Belfort himself .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: While the former swindles investors out of their money , the latter cheats the viewers of their time .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: There are numerous reasons why this film is an utter failure .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: Firstly , there is no depth to the characters and character development is non - existent .

review: They start of as superficial , one dimensional caricatures and end as such .

review: Secondly , there is no context .

review: We aren"t afforded the opportunity to understand where the madness began .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: We are never shown the victims and the effects of the perpetrators " fraud .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: Thirdly , there is no plot .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: This film is simply three hours of persistent , droning debauchery .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: In fact , it almost appears that Scorsese"s aim was just to exhibit endless variation of depravity , with no plot and no context to justify it .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: And that"s my main gripe : the film is just three hours of gratuitous obscenity , with a redundant plot , no sense of direction and absolutely no purpose .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: We wait for the film to " take off "

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: but it never really does .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: It , quite simply becomes a gluttonous and disturbingly self - indulgent seminal celebration of human piggishness , rot and squalor .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: Which brings me to my final point : the film is an unapologetic celebration of human baseness and predation .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: We are left to absorb the gamut of tedious depravity and obscenity without any particular meaning or point to it ; besides perhaps crass titillation .

title: As much a scam as Belfort himself
review: With its rave reviews , box office success and Oscar nominations , I think it"s fitting to refer to The Wolf of Wall Street as the Emperor ; with no clothes .

title: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET (Martin Scorsese, 2013) ***
review: Considering its many affiliations with American HUSTLE ( noted in that film"s review ) , it is interesting to watch how in the former , the F. B. I. Emerged as foolhardy in their undeniably well - meaning approach – while here they are treated more or less as the heroes of the day when their operation proves a resounding success ! Anyway , much has been said of this latest Martin Scorsese / Leonardo Di Caprio collaboration – especially in how it treads the line of tastelessness for much of its 3 hour duration ( with some of the admittedly over - the - top sex"n"drugs antics seeming to belong more in a grindhouse or even " Euro - Cult " movie from the 1970s ! ) .

title: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET (Martin Scorsese, 2013) ***
review: Still , I feel this backlash ( especially for the way such serious offenses as depicted in the film are treated in blackly comic terms ) was itself extreme : just note how much attention has been given to the dwarf - throwing gag ( the pros and cons of such a wild scheme are amusingly delineated just like any other business - related item ! )

title: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET (Martin Scorsese, 2013) ***
review: but , seeing how it occurs during the very opening scene , one would expect the viewer to have totally worked it out of his system by the time the picture"s end credits start rolling ! Indeed , to Scorsese"s credit , if the Jordan Belfort gang"s scamming of both poor and rich people was dealt with so thoroughly – or , should I say , the rewards they reaped from it – these characters " fall from grace is at least as detailed and spectacular ; so , in that respect , it comes off as a balanced evaluation of a particular lifestyle which , like it or not , existsand to which gullible people themselves contribute in a misguided attempt to increase their own bank account without having to work for it ! As for Di Caprio , his performance is indeed among the year"s best and one of his own towering achievements –

title: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET (Martin Scorsese, 2013) ***
review: but , personally , I feel he was even better in THE AVIATOR ( 2004 ) and SHUTTER ISLAND ( 2010 ; for which he was not even Oscar - nominated ! ) , both also for Scorsese .

title: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET (Martin Scorsese, 2013) ***
review: The film under review is up for just five Academy Awards , which rather shuts it out from winning any of the top categories – unless the AMPAS voters prefer the star to Matthew McConaughey in DALLAS BUYERS CLUB ( another initially reprehensible real - life character dealing in illegal substances

title: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET (Martin Scorsese, 2013) ***
review: but , in his case , for the common good rather than self - gratification ) , which I sincerely doubt ! ; incidentally , McConaughey himself turns up here early on as the anti - hero"s mentor and whose ritualistic hum to get him functioning on a daily basis is even worked into a song by the actor and the film"s music director Robbie Robertson ( ex - member of The Band and a Scorsese regular ) ! Jonah Hill as the protagonist"s sidekick is also shortlisted in the Supporting Actor category

title: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET (Martin Scorsese, 2013) ***
review: but , while his contribution is highly entertaining , there is little depth to the part ( even less so where their other colleagues are concerned , who somehow seem stuck in the lower rungs of the firm despite its obvious flourish ! ) .

title: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET (Martin Scorsese, 2013) ***
review: Di Caprio"s role – being based on the book written by Belfort himself – is clearly much more rounded , then , especially since his intermittent narration is adamant that money and power ( even more so when acquired at a young age and unlawfully ) too often lead one on a self - destructive pathand the fact that he was able to rise again after " doing time " is a testament to his talent for survival , if nothing else ! To go back to its ties with American HUSTLE , the F. B. I. Sequences necessarily recall those of Scorsese"s earlier and superior GOODFELLAS ( 1990 ) – which suggests that its best ( and funniest ) moments tend to involve the after - effects of the copious intake of drugs , notably DiCaprio getting tongue - tied during a vital telephone call and his " spastic " attempts to reach his luxurious car and drive back home .

title: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET (Martin Scorsese, 2013) ***
review: For the record , film director Rob Reiner appears as Di Caprio"s colourful dad and Jean Dujardin is a Swiss Bank manager ( to where the countless millions are literally transferred out of the federal authorities " reach ) .

title: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET (Martin Scorsese, 2013) ***
review: On a personal note , I should say that I was expecting to hate this going in but I have had to eat my words and admit that it was an enjoyable if ( no pun intended ) taxing ride ... Which , as soon as it was over , made me run to the medicine cabinet

title: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET (Martin Scorsese, 2013) ***
review: and pop a headache pill myself !

title: Wolf in a $2,000 suit
review: Based on Jordan Belfort"s book , this is a very entertaining movie - although probably not for those who lost their money .

title: Wolf in a $2,000 suit
review: The film follows Belfort ( Leonardo DiCaprio ) from newbie stockbroker to head of Stratton Oakmont , the largest " Over The Counter " stockbroking firm in the US .

title: Wolf in a $2,000 suit

title: Misogynistic, Ableist, Racist, and apologist.
review: and the movie opens with a " midget - throwing " contest ) .

title: Misogynistic, Ableist, Racist, and apologist.
review: Even though the heroes of this story ( as there was no possible way to interpret them as villains except for conscious disgust with the writers ) are eventually caught , it is far overshadowed by the hours of cocaine - snorting whoring villain protagonists and the high life they appear to be leading .

title: Misogynistic, Ableist, Racist, and apologist.
review: While I understand that movies with scantily - clad sex objects ( as the women are reduced to for the purpose of this film ) tend to rate highly at the box office ( and apparently on IMDb ) , this film claims to take from real life .

title: Misogynistic, Ableist, Racist, and apologist.

title: Excessive Excess
review: " The Wolf of Wall Street " is about the rise and fall of one Jordan Belfort , a fast - talking con man selling penny stocks to unsuspecting clients to earn that whopping 50 % commission , until he built up a financial empire with simply too much money than they know what to do with .

title: Excessive Excess
review: Jordan and his cohorts , led by the loud and obnoxious Donnie Azoff , lead a life of unbridled debauchery , until the arms of the law finally catch up with them .

title: Excessive Excess
review: While this film seemed like it was celebrating the crime Belfort was perpetrating , director Martin Scorsese told it in a very frenetic and entertaining way .

title: Excessive Excess
review: The structure of the film was odd though , as the first two hours plus was about the wild lifestyle Belfort had in the lap of luxury ,

title: Excessive Excess
review: but only the last 40 minutes or so was about his inevitable fall and retribution .

title: Excessive Excess
review: Leonardo DiCaprio summons again his inimitable charm and charisma we saw before in " Catch Me If You Can " to higher stakes criminal activity as Belfort .

title: Excessive Excess
review: Leonardo amped up his millionaire characters in " The Aviator " and " The Great Gatsby " , giving everything he had for this role and his burning passion that oozes through the screen .

title: Excessive Excess
review: He has this hilarious sequence when he had a catatonic fit after taking a strong drug , never knew Leo was capable of such physical comedy .

title: Excessive Excess
review: Jonah Hill playing Belfort"s reckless partner Donnie with rabid perversity , like " This Is The End " goes to New York high society .

title: Excessive Excess
review: He has excellent chemistry with DiCaprio .

title: Excessive Excess
review: The classy , beautiful and sexy Margot Robbie plays Naomi , the hot socialite who swept Belfort off his feet .

title: Excessive Excess
review: In smaller but still notable roles were Matthew McConaughey with a very short stint as Belfort"s first Wall Street mentor , Rob Reiner as Belfort"s prudent father , Jean Dujardin as Belfort"s European contact and Kyle Chandler as the FBI agent who wanted to bring Belfort down at all costs .

title: Excessive Excess
review: After the first one and half hours of the over - the - top excessively obscene lifestyle Jordan and pals live , you will feel that all of this depiction of debauchery is kind of getting too repetitive and long for comfort .

title: Excessive Excess
review: There will be scenes of sexual orgies of all kinds to the point of misogyny .

title: Excessive Excess
review: There will be multiple scenes of almost everybody taking drugs and all the wild effects .

title: Excessive Excess
review: Your ears will feel numbed with all the foul language that was integrated in seemingly every one of their sentences .

title: Excessive Excess
review: However , the pedigree of the people behind this film , Scorsese and DiCaprio , the brilliant cinematography and opulent production design , all remind us that this is still an A - list project , not some raunchy blue movie drowning in kilos of cocaine and naked prostitutes .

title: Excessive Excess
review: I just think the first two hours felt like they could have been shortened without significantly affecting the plot .

title: Zusammenfassung
review: BESCHREIBUNG Stock market multimillionaire at 26 , federal convict at 36 , he partied like a rock star , lived like a king , and barely survived his rise and fall as an American entrepreneurial icon .

title: Zusammenfassung
review: NOW AN AWARD - WINNING MOTION PICTURE DIRECTED BY MARTIN SCORSESE , STARRING LEONARDO DICAPRIO , MATTHEW MCCONAUGHEY AND JONAH HILL .

review: " What separates Jordan"s story from others like it , is the brutal honesty .

title: Zusammenfassung
review: By night he spent it as fast as he could , on drugs , sex , and international globe - trotting .

title: Zusammenfassung
review: From the binge that sunk a 170 - foot motor yacht , crashed a Gulfstream jet ,

title: Zusammenfassung
review: and ran up a $ 700 , 000 hotel tab , to the wife and kids who waited for him for at home , and the fast - talking , hard - partying young stockbrokers who called him king and did his bidding , here , in his own inimitable words , is the story of the ill - fated genius they called ... THE WOLF OF WALL STREET In the 1990s Jordan Belfort , former kingpin of the notorious investment firm Stratton Oakmont , became one of the most infamous names in American finance : a brilliant , conniving stock - chopper who led his merry mob on a wild ride out of the canyons of Wall Street and into a massive office on Long Island .

title: Zusammenfassung
review: In this astounding and hilarious tell - all autobiography , Belfort narrates a story of greed , power , and excess no one could invent - the story of an ordinary guy who went from hustling Italian ices at sixteen to making hundreds of millions .

title: Zusammenfassung
review: Until it all came crashing down .

title: Boring fellas
review: To many , " Goodfellas " is Martin Scorcese"s finest film .

title: Boring fellas
review: It"s certainly well - constructed and entertaining , but it"s arguably less nuanced and elusive than his earlier works .

title: Boring fellas
review: It"s also better than anything he"s made since .

title: Boring fellas
review: I liked " Casino " ,

title: Boring fellas
review: but it was essentially the same movie in different clothes .

title: Boring fellas
review: And although he has made different ( although generally inferior ) movies since then , " The Wolf of Wall Street " is the same movie for a third time .

title: Boring fellas
review: But it"s not a patch on it"s two predecessors .

title: Boring fellas
review: For one thing , at least Robert De Nero could act .

title: Boring fellas
review: Leonardo DiCaprio , who has replaced De Nero as Scorcese"s go - to lead actor , can not ,

title: Boring fellas
review: and chews the scenery throughout most of this film .

title: Boring fellas
review: Secondly , like most people , you"ve probably wondered how the financial services industry manages to capture such a large proportion of our national outputs for itself .

title: Boring fellas
review: This film won"t tell you .

title: Boring fellas
review: At least , it hints at some of the causes - pumping and dumping penny stocks , breaking the law and the use of a sales force highly motivated by greed .

title: Boring fellas
review: Yet there isn"t a real explanation of how Jordan Belfort made his fortune from nowhere , nor indeed for the general significance of the role that Wall Street plays in all our lives .

title: Boring fellas
review: At times , DiCaprio starts to explain things directly to camera ,

title: Boring fellas
review: but he rarely completes his expositions , brushing it off as boring details .

title: Boring fellas
review: Thirdly , as played by DiCaprio , Belfort comes across as a uniquely unlikable ( and unrepentant ) man .

title: Boring fellas
review: Fourthly , the whole rags - to - riches - to - rags again tale seems at times dangerously close to suggesting that a big house , a fast car , a blonde wife and a steady supply of hookers and drugs really are the keys to happiness - the only tragedy is that the life had to end .

title: Boring fellas
review: Finally , everything in the film seems over - the - top : not just DiCaprio"s acting ,

title: Boring fellas
review: but the language , the drug - taking , the nudity , even the dumb - ass special effects when the characters get stuck in a storm while at sea .

title: Boring fellas
review: This is not a movie that makes its points subtly .

title: Boring fellas
review: It"s loud and long ; and not a patch on the quixotic " King of Comedy " , the elegiac " Raging Bull " , the dark and fantastical " Taxi Driver " ,

title: Boring fellas
review: and the other works that made Scorcese"s reputation back when he still knew how to direct a film .

title: 2001's Blow by way of 2000's Boiler Room
review: It"s basically an uncannily blow - by - blow retelling of Blow , 2001"s biopic of George Jung ( a similarly " right place at the right time " true figure who changed everything in a massive business sector ) , merely replacing cocaine with stocks , cartels with brokerage firms , the DEA with the FBI , and Johnny Depp with Leonardo DiCaprio .

title: 2001's Blow by way of 2000's Boiler Room
review: Everything else is exactly the same , from the loser , unversed friends becoming ever slicker , to the fast success to the crazy excess , to the pretty wife , the huge , beautiful mansion and non - stop party lifestyle , to the later disastrous business decisions and the inevitable downfall and prison time , right down to the very young progeny ( also a daughter ) trapped in a situation she can not yet understand , fought over by both parents .

title: 2001's Blow by way of 2000's Boiler Room

title: 2001's Blow by way of 2000's Boiler Room
review: and Too Big to Fail ( 2011 ) for the casual , irresponsible attitude to big financial moves with huge repercussions for many people ( both the latter films are about the 2007- 2008 credit crisis ) , plus a fair bit of another Depp film , Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas ( 1998 ) for some of the the drug madness , though Fear was a much more fun and interesting film .

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: Martin Scorsese"s new film THE WOLF OF WALL STREET makes Gordon Gekko , famous for his " Greed is Good " speech in Oliver Stone"s 1987 movie WALL STREET , look housebroken

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: and tame by comparison .

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: This wild and offensive cinematic experience is overly long , with a kinetic performance by Leonardo DiCaprio portraying the real life , shameless Jordan Belfort ( who wrote the book from which this movie was made , ) an individual who reminded me of an evangelical preacher - stirring up his congregation of hungry , amoral brokers to bilk working class people - seducing them to invest in fraudulent penny stock transactions .

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: The rapid ascension to personal enrichment is made to seem smooth and simple .

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: While many people in the audience laughed at Jordan and his team"s gaming of the " suckers " , I wore a dour expression during the three hours of what some experienced as exhilarating entertainment .

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: I despised Scorsese"s celebration of the perks of debauchery .

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: Though some critics might see this film as a sharp indictment of the culture of Wall Street , I found the opposite to be true ; there was absolutely no penetration of the surface capitalist veneer of grasping wealth at the expense of others .

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: On the contrary , this movie plunges into the dank , muddy swamps of excrement and attempts to beguile us with the empty putrid spoils that are found there .

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: Jonah Hill is proving to be a good actor playing Jordan"s co - conspirator , Donnie Azoff - introducing him to the world of getting " high " , giving him the " gift " of hallucinatory release , ecstasy and eventual addiction .

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: Also Matthew McConaughey in a very short cameo role , almost steals the show as Belfort " s early " mentor " in the business of exploiting corporate acquisitiveness .

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: It was also good to see Rob Reiner as Jordan"s father , the one sane person in a room of " animals " all unfettering their " ids " in unison .

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: We witness the hackneyed culture of " the good life , " lots of drugs , ( quaaludes and cocaine , ) constant screwing – women"s bodies were all of the typical fantasy mold - existing to satisfy the " boys " in both classic and extravagant positions .

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: Despite the illusion of " extreme " dissipation , the unfeeling and repetitive acts of dissolution became tiresome ,

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: and that was one of my major problems with THE WOLF OF WALL STREET .

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: Jordan Belfort is a cardboard , onanistic testosterone driven , self - indulgent man who can motivate others with the passion of his own greed ,

title: Celebration of debauchery
review: but there is no sense of an actual person behind the beautiful clothes and cars that he surrounds himself with , and so frankly I don"t give a damn about him or his ilk .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: Dear Mr. Scorsese , I have seen every movie you have done , dating back to your Mean Streets

review: and Who"s That Knocking at My Door ,

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: and I am very sorry to say that The Wolf of Wall Street is your worst .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: Unfortunately The Wolf is a bore for the following reasons : 1 ) You have made a movie that is a De Caprio vehicle , instead of Scorsese movie .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: ( Unlike your other films ) .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: 2 ) You have put your focus on a story that is unfortunately not only not new ,

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: but in fact too familiar and been said before .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: 3 ) The length of the film for this particular topic is a problem .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: 4 ) The most interesting aspects of this film is showcasing of the excess and the sex .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: And I wish you didn"t cut that out as much as the other mundane parts .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: 5 ) Why treat the audience as dummies .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: Why assume that we can"t handle something as relatively routine as an IPO (

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: and I am not in finance ) and cut off De Caprio"s explanation of such in his narration .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: 6 ) Why not show us what De Caprio"s character actually did wrong .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: 7 ) I am not sure what it says about us that we prefer to watch movies about Italian gangsters vs Wall Street types .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: 8) This movie would have worked better as a 2 - hour wild ride with more of the excesses showcased than a 3 - hour vague promo for the main character .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: 9 ) I understand that while editing this film you tried to narrow it down to under 3 hours ,

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: but doing so , you have made compromises about what we consider Scorsese touch vs what you think the audience wants to see .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: 10 ) Maybe , this is a case where studio interference would have helped .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: Knowing full well that the movie was independently financed

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: and hence granting the director a rare opportunity to release the version without a green light from the bosses .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: 11 ) Where is the Scorsese touch in this film ? Where is the wow factor ? Why would a director of your stellar reputation and vision release a film that doesn"t project your signature touches .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: 12 ) I understand that for this film you have chosen not to showcase the camera .

review: I get it , that the subject matter may not have required ( for example ) Robert Richardson"s amazing lighting techniques ,

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: 13 ) We are used to watching Scorsese movies about degenerate characters , nothing new there ,

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: but you always mix that with awe - inspiring visual narrative .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: None of that exists in The Wolf .

title: Note to Mr. Scorsese (not enough sex)
review: 14 ) Where is Ms. Schoonmaker"s now iconic editing chops in this film ? Why is it so mundane ? 15 ) If you would have kept more of the sex ,

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: It"s comforting to imagine that everything Martin Scorsese touches turns to gold , but it"s not true .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: The same rules of thoroughness that apply to every other filmmaker also apply to Scorsese .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: If he rushes through a compressed editing schedule to meet an Oscar - friendly release date – as he did on The Wolf of Wall Street – his work suffers .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: Scorsese"s latest clocks in at 180 minutes , not because its characters or narrative demand that kind of exhaustive treatment ,

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: but because Scorsese didn"t have time to find a more focused , impactful shape for the film .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: Exploring the personal and professional corruption of notorious stockbroker Jordan Belfort , The Wolf of Wall Street has several memorable sequences ,

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: but it plays like a clumsy , repetitive work - in - progress .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: Praise has already been heaped upon Leonardo DiCaprio and Jonah Hill for their charismatic performances ,

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: but it"s important to note that this is wacky comic acting more concerned with eliciting shock and amusement than any deeper human truth .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: This miscalculation of emphasis also infects the storytelling in a more general sense .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: Scorsese and screenwriter Terence Winter focus nearly all of their attention on the excesses – sex , drugs , greed – that drive these characters , rarely placing them in a context that might reveal complicating texture or shading .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: It"s perfectly logical to portray these characters as one - note imbeciles with an absence of inner life , but this also makes for stifling , unsatisfying drama .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: The Wolf of Wall Street never finds its bearings ,

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: but it becomes more tolerable in its second half when Belfort finally encounters some resistance ( in the form of FBI agent Patrick Denham , played by Kyle Chandler )

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: and sees his warped life of excess start to unravel .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: But even then , the film is dragged down by its reliance on Belfort"s moronic perspective – the film is derived from his self - mythologizing memoir – which gives an Animal House frivolity to his constant misbehaviour , a smokescreen that distracts from the devastation of his professional crimes .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: Simply recycling sensibilities from Goodfellas and The Departed may seem like a logical strategy ,

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: but there"s a crucial difference this time around .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: Whereas gangsters generally do harm to other gangsters , Belfort"s victims are relatively innocent , draining this film"s lawlessness of charm and fascination .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: Scorsese"s ability to find humanity in reprehensible characters has always been one of his greatest strengths ,

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: but he doesn"t even attempt to humanize the characters in The Wolf of Wall Street .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: This wilful oversight results in one of the director"s most disposable , nihilistic films , a half - hearted effort that abandons the complexities of his own world view in favour of Belfort"s clueless primitivism .

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: This might have made for a uniquely compelling Todd Phillips ( The Hangover ) movie ,

title: Not Marty's best work, more flash than substance
review: but in the hands of Scorsese , this mildly entertaining diversion feels hopelessly erratic and insubstantial .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: The Wolf of Wall Street is a loud , flashy , and unfathomably vulgar movie populated by a wide variety of repulsive and narcissistic characters .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: In the hands of a lesser director , it could have easily ended up being unpleasant and unwatchable .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: However , thanks to acclaimed director Martin Scorsese"s clever satirical touch and a witty script that surprises at every turn , The Wolf of Wall Street is a wild and uninhibited thrill - ride of a movie that"s hard to forget .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: The movie tells the true story of Jordan Belfort ( Leonardo DiCaprio ) , a man who went from struggling to pay his bills to being one of the most wealthy but immoral and corrupt stockbrokers in the country .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: As he leads an increasingly reckless and dishonest life , Belfort quickly transforms from a law - abiding citizen to an uncaring white - collar criminal .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: Leonardo DiCaprio may have finally found his Oscar - winning role playing Jordan Belfort .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: Although his character is far too selfish to be likable , DiCaprio"s spirited performance makes Jordan endlessly fascinating in his depravity .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: Jonah Hill gives an equally impressive performance as Donnie , Jordan"s best friend and the co - founder of his firm .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: Hill"s loud - mouthed and often inconsiderate behavior as Donnie makes for some of the funniest scenes in the movie .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: Although many of the scenes are far from light - hearted , The Wolf of Wall Street is ultimately a comedy .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: The characters " wildly reckless and irresponsible actions provide most of the humor .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: One particularly funny and memorable scene involves Jordan trying in vain to reach his car and drive home while under the influence of drugs he had taken .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: Unable to stand up and walk to the car , Jordan is forced to slide and drag his way across the floor , all the while yelling incoherent slurred sentences .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: Running in at 165 minutes , The Wolf of Wall Street is not a short movie by any means .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: Although it"s always enthralling , there are a few scenes that could have easily been cut to shorten the running time .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: One series of scenes that wasn"t necessary involves Jordan Belfort getting into a dispute with a butler over $ 50 , 000 in cash that went missing .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: The scenes are entertaining enough ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: but they have no relevance to the story as a whole and aren"t essential to the movie .

review: The Wolf of Wall Street is not the sort of movie one would expect a 71 year - old man to direct .

review: Director Martin Scorsese is far from an ordinary 71 year - old man though ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street is among Scorsese's best
review: and with The Wolf of Wall Street he has crafted his most lively , compelling , and outrageous movie in years .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: I confess I had some curiosity and some expectations when I went to see this movie .

title: Journey to the center of immorality

review: So I wasn"t surprised with the fuss around the movie

review: but , when I saw it , I was very disappointed .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: The film is based on an autobiographical book written by Jordan Belfort , a stockbroker who quickly enriched , through financial maneuvers of high risk and zero legality .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: The book describes not only the business but the life of luxury , drugs and sex that he took , and the way he eventually paid for it .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: The film , as far as we understand , is quite faithful to the book"s account ,

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: and the book also makes an apparently true story .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: The film resembles " Goodfellas " in many ways ,

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: but with great differences in which the gangster movie gets the better of it .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: The main problem of this film lies in three essential points : The first point is the apparent glorification of the fraud and Belfort"s dissolute lifestyle .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: The message passed by the film is " crime pays " .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: It spends more than an hour telling us , in detail , the outrages of Belfort and his team of bastards without any need , shocking some public , who leave the cinema with the feeling that the film passes an ethically wrong message , and society does not need to receive it because it receives enough bad influences .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: The second essential point is the absence of a counterpoint to the scenes of excesses shown .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: Okay , Belfort is a swine , drug addict and corrupt who has gotten rich too fast and too easy .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: So ? Where is the counterpoint to that ? He committed crimes ,

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: but what are the effects of his crimes ? Who lost out on Belfort"s crimes ? How can audiences truly realize the size of his mistakes ? The public never gets these answers because the film gets too lost in the details of Belfort"s scandals .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: The movie makes people think that Belfort never harmed anyone ,

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: and that he was just crazy , or smart .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: The third negative point is the construction of the characters .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: They are black - and - white , without the psychological complexity and refinement that we find in " Goodfellas " , for example .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: There"s no such thing here .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: The characters are summed up as junkies , sex offenders , eccentrics , some bored cops and little else .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: DiCaprio was well enough in his role ,

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: but being such an abject role , it"s impossible to like

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: and enjoy his performance .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: I think Scorcese thought this film as a comedy ,

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: but the truth is that it is not funny .

title: Journey to the center of immorality

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: So , it was a bad idea .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: This film would have been excellent if it had been conceived as a drama

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: and had behind it some moral balance .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: That was not the case .

title: Journey to the center of immorality
review: It is a mad journey through senseless immorality , without notion and without any pretext than easy laughter ,

title: Journey to the center of immorality

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: Entertaining , fast - paced , funny and morally ambiguous -- in a lot of ways , very typical Scorcese , and as usual , it"s tough to dislike despite generally despicable characters .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: When I first heard about this movie , I was surprised the director had chosen to take on the story , because Wall Street greed seems like one of the easiest things to hate these days , full of real - life " despicable characters " and shady behavior .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: That this movie was based on truth is almost beside the point : nobody likes guys like Leonardo DiCaprio"s Jordan Belfort .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: In fact , most people hate guys like this .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: Of course , Jordan Belfort is a real person ,

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: and the larger - than - life escapades of drugs , hookers , big money stock trading , and ( many ) more drugs make for easy eye candy in Scorsese"s hands .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: He"s done it before -- Wolf of Wall Street resembles nothing so much as the director"s 1990 masterpiece Goodfellas , from the charismatic protagonist who worked his way up from nothing to obtaining huge power , the backdrop of glorified crime , the FBI investigations , the gluttonous vices , to the faithful wife who finally has enough , and the soundtrack full of classic rock , blues and punk .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: Some of these things are tried and true Scorcese hallmarks , while others do admittedly feel a bit retreaded .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: There are two main differences between Wolf and Goodfellas : the first is that despite a breakneck pace ( featuring more varieties of coke snorting and pill - popping than I actually knew existed ) , the film is too long .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: There is a lot of good ( and truly funny ) dialogue in the movie ,

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: but a couple of scenes simply seem to go on too long , slowing the movie down without adding much depth to the story .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: Wolf is three hours long , and had it been edited into a Goodfellas - esque two hours or so , it might have stood along side the earlier film as kind of a sub - masterpiece in a genre that Scorcese pretty much owns .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: The other difference is that unlike Henry Hill , you never get the feeling that Jordan Belfort learned any real lesson .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: He eventually loses everything : his wife , his house , his company , money and friends ( one of which is the monstrously and comically greedy Donnie Azoff , played by Jonah Hill ) --

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: and at the end , though taken down a peg as far as monetary success is concerned , doesn"t seem particularly emotionally different than when he started .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: He"s a gifted ( albeit slimy and terminally selfish ) salesperson ,

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: and that"s probably all he could ever be .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: All this said , Wolf is very entertaining .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: There are lots of funny moments ,

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: and plenty more scenes that make your pulse race , if only out of suspense of when someone"s going to have a heart attack from doing so many drugs .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: It does arguably glorify the lifestyle of these traders ,

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: but at the same time , it"s hard to come out of it thinking you"d ever want to be a part of that world .

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: Scorcese , perhaps better than any filmmaker in history , again demonstrates how success / failure and good / evil are nothing more than sides of a coin ,

title: Fast, loud and morally ambiguous: the Scorcese way
review: and one"s reaction to Jordan Belfort and the other wolves on Wall Street could very well be down to where one stands at the end of the trading day .

title: The film is a graphic riot of sex orgies and drug-enhanced mayhem - But what's the point?
review: and boasts a stellar cast including the ever improving Leonardo De Caprio who played a blinder in last year"s Django Unchained .

title: The film is a graphic riot of sex orgies and drug-enhanced mayhem - But what's the point?
review: As you might expect from Scorsese , " Wolf " is certainly a visual feast and much of it is quite entertaining to watch .

title: The film is a graphic riot of sex orgies and drug-enhanced mayhem - But what's the point?
review: It is in a different class to American Hustle ,

title: The film is a graphic riot of sex orgies and drug-enhanced mayhem - But what's the point?
review: but like " Hustle " , it suffers from a lack of " audience empathy " for the lead character .

title: The film is a graphic riot of sex orgies and drug-enhanced mayhem - But what's the point?
review: There are endless films which have portrayed utterly unpleasant characters in leading roles and the trick of a good movie - maker is to know how to make us " feel " for these " bad " people – who might even be rapists or killers – as then we can understand , if not entirely excuse or forgive their transgressions .

title: The film is a graphic riot of sex orgies and drug-enhanced mayhem - But what's the point?
review: Sometimes we will see such villains get their comeuppance , which satisfies our sense of right and wrong ,

title: The film is a graphic riot of sex orgies and drug-enhanced mayhem - But what's the point?
review: and occasionally the characters themselves become remorseful and change their previously evil ways .

title: The film is a graphic riot of sex orgies and drug-enhanced mayhem - But what's the point?
review: In some instances , " baddies " continue their evil ways ,

title: The film is a graphic riot of sex orgies and drug-enhanced mayhem - But what's the point?
review: but we are shown that even in the worst of people , there is something that we , the audience , can understand , that will encourage us to understand their horrific behaviour and to gain a modicum of our sympathy .

title: What we allow
review: Okay , let"s try from the start to escape the whole debate raging about this and find our way back to the crux of the thing .

title: What we allow
review: This should be a way of life , swim through swathes of unnecessary noise so we can gleam the fact that cuts through and illuminates .

title: What we allow
review: We have not figured life and death after all , it shouldn"t be so easy to say anything about this man one way or the other .

title: What we allow
review: To show this , we need to find a human moment in the film , pluck it from the fabric and pose to ourselves the question .

title: What we allow
review: For me it"s this : at one point the protagonist , a Wall Street scam artist , has been invited up to the apartment of a sexy blonde and contemplates sleeping with her or going back to his wife and rich , comfortable life , when she steps out naked .

title: What we allow
review: No one has to know , it is there for the taking .

title: What we allow
review: What do you do ? This is the whole thing right there .

title: What we allow
review: What if you could pick up a phone

title: What we allow
review: and make boatloads of money as easily as he could sleep with that girl ,

title: What we allow
review: and you never have to know , no one has to know , where they have been torn form ? That"s not to say there can be no answer , we just can"t pretend it"s an easy one that one way or the other wouldn"t keep us up at night .

title: What we allow
review: The film is this sale made to us .

title: What we allow
review: It has to be convincing , every sale does .

title: What we allow
review: It has to lure us with the appeal , all that partying .

title: What we allow
review: We see that it"s easy when you don"t have to know , when the knowing is at an abstract distance ,

title: What we allow
review: but the good life can be enjoyed today .

title: What we allow
review: We would like it to be this way perhaps .

title: What we allow
review: The film ends with the man making this sale to an audience eager to learn the trick .

title: What we allow
review: It falls on us to see that it"s a scam .

title: What we allow
review: This is not because eventually he pays dearly for it with all he had , because even in the end he has it pretty easy .

title: What we allow
review: The real Belfort spent an obscenely lenient 22 months in prison

title: What we allow
review: and is out now giving pep talks on strategy .

title: What we allow
review: This shows that we have built a system as fundamentally ignorant as the man himself : common burglary without prior record gets you 2 - 4 years for stealing pennies to Belfort"s dollars , because in Belfort"s case it is a subtler manipulation at that abstract distance .

title: What we allow
review: It"s a scam because it trades all that ferocious spending of time and energy

title: What we allow
review: and gives no real happiness back ,

title: What we allow
review: and it can only be deeply apparent as such when we have to swim to that realization against the current of self who is entertained by the partying .

title: What we allow
review: No mistake , Scorsese gambled here more than say , Goodfellas .

title: What we allow
review: He lost , because the choice of topic demands most of the artistry goes on this side of the telephone and the overkill of meaningless partying sticks much more than the glimpse of his daughter"s face as she watches him stoned out of his mind .

title: What we allow
review: It is all of course adapted from a book by Belfort himself on that life , the unreliability is signaled early with the car switching colors to the narrator"s whim .

title: What we allow
review: There"s one masterful moment I will carry with me though , because it casts light on a more ambiguous human nature ,

title: What we allow
review: and this is the crux of the thing .

review: How can I become the person that will make me and others happy ? Money isn"t the answer of course , we see that it merely substitutes the anxiety of not having with a different set .

title: What we allow
review: But it can not have anything to do with simply sticking to principle either , any more than expounding on gravity can make you a good skier .

review: The moment is when Belfort and his friend are both stoned in his place to near incapacity , his friend is choking to death

title: What we allow
review: and a Popeye cartoon is playing on TV .

title: What we allow
review: It"s all there so clearly , cutting through right and wrong .

title: What we allow
review: What happens there ? An image that pops up and surrounds that incapacitated self , drawing him out of his stupor to do something for someone else .

title: What we allow
review: It couldn"t work if the urge wasn"t there ,

review: and if the image did not inspire that self to become a person worthy of the story . This is not poetry

title: What we allow
review: but how the mind works , we are the thoughts we allow .

review: This is to see the desire for the girl or money palpably rise in front of us , instead of at a distance .

title: What we allow

title: What we allow
review: but now we"re on to something .

title: Excessus Mentis: A Defence of Scorsese's The Wolf of Wall Street.
review: Martin Scorsese"s latest offering The Wolf of Wall Street has divided audiences into two camps : those who praise the work as a masterpiece of cinematic verve , and those who say it glorifies white - collar crime along with the film"s antihero , real life penny stock criminal , Jordan Belfort .

title: Excessus Mentis: A Defence of Scorsese's The Wolf of Wall Street.
review: While not quite the magnum opus some call it , I think The Wolf of Wall Street is an inspired parable and cinematic opera about greed , excess , and the perversion of the American dream .

title: Excessus Mentis: A Defence of Scorsese's The Wolf of Wall Street.
review: Hollywood , like the stock market , is big business , netting profits in the billions every year .

title: Excessus Mentis: A Defence of Scorsese's The Wolf of Wall Street.
review: In many ways , Hollywood is emblematic of the American dream ; certainly the cinema is a place where we exchange money to watch our dreams , fantasies , and even nightmares unfold on a big screen in a dimly lit room .

title: Excessus Mentis: A Defence of Scorsese's The Wolf of Wall Street.
review: Scorsese , who often challenges Hollywood sensibility , continues to be one of American cinema"s great dream makers and storytellers , gifting the world films like Mean Streets ( 1973 ) , Taxi Driver ( 1976 ) , Raging Bull ( 1980 ) , Goodfellas ( 1990 ) ,

title: Excessus Mentis: A Defence of Scorsese's The Wolf of Wall Street.
review: and The Departed ( 2006 ) .

title: Excessus Mentis: A Defence of Scorsese's The Wolf of Wall Street.
review: The Wolf of Wall Street continues Scorsese"s fixation with crime , identity , and machismo , as well as his Roman Catholic concerns around guilt and redemption .

title: Excessus Mentis: A Defence of Scorsese's The Wolf of Wall Street.
review: However , unlike Scorsese"s other gangster films there is hardly any graphic violence in Wolf , although there remains , perhaps more than any of his films , his liberal usage of profanity .

title: Excessus Mentis: A Defence of Scorsese's The Wolf of Wall Street.
review: It could be argued , and probably should , that Belfort"s obsession with controlling women"s bodies , as well as his betrayal of his victim"s trust , is violence .

title: Excessus Mentis: A Defence of Scorsese's The Wolf of Wall Street.
review: The narrative techniques and do - it - yourself rise to power in Wolf parallels Goodfellas ,

title: Excessus Mentis: A Defence of Scorsese's The Wolf of Wall Street.
review: but instead of mob bloodshed and revenge , Scorsese focuses his lens on robber baron , capitalistic sociopath , and real life penny stock criminal / self - made multi- millionaire , Jordan Belfort .

title: Excessus Mentis: A Defence of Scorsese's The Wolf of Wall Street.
review: For me , the film was a little like travelling through Dante"s fourth circle of Hell ( greed / avarice ) for three hours , although I do admit that I laughed a fair bit , which is sort of the point of the grotesque parody .

title: Excessus Mentis: A Defence of Scorsese's The Wolf of Wall Street.

title: Welcome back, Marty!; the master in taking debauchery as comfort food for his legion of fans
review: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET ( 2013 ) * * * 1/2 Leonardo DiCaprio , Jonah Hill , Magot Robbi , Matthew McConaughey , Kyle Chandler , Rob Reiner , Jon Berenthal , Jean Dujardin , Joanna Lumley , Cristin Milioti , PJ Pyrne , Ketteh Choi , Brian Sacca , Henry Zebrowski , Ethan Suplee , Jake Hoffman , Mackenzie Meehan , Shea Whigham , Ted Griffin , Fran Lebowitz , Grobert Clohessy ( Cameo unbilled : Spike Jonze ) Martin Scorsese continues to outdo himself ( in all the right ways and perhaps a bit too much ) with his outsized adaptation of Jordan Belfort"s book ( brilliantly and perhaps belatedly by Terence Winter ) about his days as a hot - shot scheming stockbroker ( played to fierce nearly scene - chewing ferocity by DiCaprio at his blinding charismatic best ) who coerces a ragtag team of schnooks into one blazing trail of junk bonds , coke - fueled trip to hell

title: Welcome back, Marty!; the master in taking debauchery as comfort food for his legion of fans
review: and back in the 1990s with corruption , good ol " fashion screwing ( of all types ) and financial chicanery making Gordon Gekko look like Pat Boone in ambitious skullduggery .

title: Welcome back, Marty!; the master in taking debauchery as comfort food for his legion of fans
review: Stellar support includes Hill as a cross - between Gene Wilder on acid and Joe Pesci on " ludes -as DiCaprio"s right - hand man(ic ) ; heartbreakingly gorgeous Robbi as the glam trophy wife of sorts who seems too good to be true ; and a laugh - out - loud turn by McConaughey as an early mentor in hookers and blow(hard ) entrepreneurial go - for - broke mania .

title: Welcome back, Marty!; the master in taking debauchery as comfort food for his legion of fans
review: Playing by his previous masterpieces " GoodFellas " and " Casino " Marty goes - thru - the - paces of his grab bag ( i. E. Breaking the " 4th wall " talking to the audience ; golden soundtrack of FM hits of the eras ; an anti - hero to root for and see the mea culpa final act in crash - and - burn ) yet don"t " begrudge a master in taking debauchery as comfort food for his legion of fans ; a return to form of sorts - Welcome back , Marty !
