title: Excessive but Lacking
review: The Wolf of Wall Street is undoubtedly one of the funniest films ever made by director Martin Scorsese .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Unfortunately , it is not one of his best .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Clocking in at a whopping 180 minutes , Wolf is too much of everything : sex , drugs , profanity , laughs , dialogue , improvisation , narration .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: If you"ve been following the development and release of Scorsese"s latest , chances are you know all about the four - to - five hour , NC-17- rated cut that had to be trimmed down hastily for a Christmas day release .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: While legendary editor and Scorsese collaborator Thelma Schoonmaker"s editing is certainly not lacking in imagination , she and Scorsese let scenes run on entirely too long , cutting back and forth between actors who are clearly making it all up as they go along .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Most of the time , the actors appear to be having a great time with the freedom they"ve been given by their director .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Leonardo DiCaprio , in particular , gives an absolutely fearless performance ,

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: and he is clearly enjoying himself .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: If only the audience had such a luxury .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: For its first hour or so , Wolf acclimates its viewers to its brisk pacing

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: and no - holds barred storytelling .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: For the next hour and a half , however , the story falls victim to a " rinse - and repeat " method of constantly regurgitating its themes , scenes , and dialogue , until the inevitable ending provides some relief from its relentless pace .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Wolf tells the story of Jordan Belfort , a Wall Street con artist who dreams of being a rich broker like Henry Hill dreamed of being a gangster in Scorsese"s Goodfellas ( more on the similarities between these two films later ) .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: After losing a promising job in the recession of the late 1980"s Jordan learns the tricks ( literally ) of the trade at a small operation selling penny stocks .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Whereas larger , more regulated stocks yield a much smaller commission , " penny stocks " provide a 50 % commission for their brokers , who in turn sell an inferior product to gullible investors .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Jordan"s bright idea is to sell these cheap stocks in huge quantities to much wealthier clients , reaping a huge take for his new front - of - a - firm , Stratton Oakmont .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Needless to say , the plan works for a while ,

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: and Belfort and his partners , including Donnie Azoff ( played by a joyously weird Jonah Hill ) become unfathomably rich .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: The remainder of the film is basically a visual orgy of gratuitous (

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: and I mean " I - can"t - believe - they - got - away- with - this ) sex and drugs , set against the backdrop of an FBI investigation into Belfort"s dubious business practices .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Perhaps the biggest issue I had with the film is just how gratuitous the edgy material was .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Let us compare to a movie like Goodfellas , for instance .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: That film shows multiple murders , often with characters meeting their demise by gunshots to the head .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: It also features copious amounts of cocaine consumption , along with about as many f - bombs as you"ll ever hear .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: However , one could make the argument that for the sake of the story , all of these elements are necessary in their fullness .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: When Henry Hill dabbles in unauthorized cocaine and arms dealing , especially after his best friend gets bumped off , the stakes become raised : one has the very clear understanding that in this world , one wrong move can result in death .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: The Wolf of Wall Street , on the other hand , shows relatively little in the way of consequences .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: For all the laws broken , all the drugs and hookers used up by the male characters , the biggest threat facing the supposed protagonists is possible jail time .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: A film that mimics the structure and feel of Goodfellas would do well to up the ante a bit ,

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: but Wolf falls woefully short in this regard .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: This is not to say that there are no consequences .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Belfort"s unraveling is spectacular , particularly in a late scene in which he tries to leave his mansion with his young daughter in tow .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: But after two and a half hours of debauchery , a small portion of comeuppance seems like a lack of balance — or poetic justice .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: This lack of justice is exactly Scorsese"s point : for the vastly wealthy , there are often no tangible or justified consequences .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Scorsese does a great job of not condemning or judging his characters — he simply shows them as they are , rather objectively ,

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: and they condemn themselves with their frat - boy antics .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: However , the director"s overlong dive into a world of excess at times seems a somewhat unhealthy fascination .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: The debate over The Wolf of Wall Street is currently raging online .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Variety is now running two pieces debating whether the film glorifies its characters " depravity .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Some say this is Wolf"s genius — an ambiguous presentation of both the temptations of sin and the obvious consequences of those who give in to it .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Others would argue that people are giving Scorsese too much credit for what is ultimately an uneven tale with no dramatic drive .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: I count myself among the latter .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: There"s a classic sequence toward the end of Goodfellas in which Henry lives in a constant state of paranoia — first as the result of his drug use and later because he has agreed to rat out all of his friends to join the Witness Protection Program .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: These scenes are key for the arc of the story — both to illustrate the dangerous stakes

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: and to drive the narrative toward its conclusion .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: The Wolf of Wall Street should have had such a sequence .

title: Excessive but Lacking
review: Instead , we were given just another scene with cocaine and sex .

title: Certainly NOT all bark and no bite
review: In other words , it"s a crazy , wild ride .

title: Exploration of excess
review: You could be forgiven for experiencing a little deja vu when watching THE WOLF OF WALL STREET , Martin Scorsese"s true - life tale of an innocent stockbroker who rose through the ranks to become one of the most notorious figures of the 1980s , a man whose name was synonymous with excess and devious money - making .

title: Exploration of excess
review: In essence this film could be described as WALL STREET with added sleaze , or SCARFACE with a Wall Street backdrop .

title: Exploration of excess
review: The familiarity of the story , and the chronological approach it takes to telling it , is very familiar to anybody who knows Scorsese"s gangster classics such as GOODFELLAS or even CASINO .

title: Exploration of excess
review: The whole rise - and - fall thing feels extremely predictable me , so much so that Scorsese doesn"t really have much to say here .

title: Exploration of excess
review: Instead , he goes all - out in his depiction of 1980s excess , filling his film with profanity ( nearly 600 uses of the " f " word ) , explicit sexuality , drug - taking , and general bad behaviour .

title: Exploration of excess
review: As with the rest of Scorsese"s films , the end result is entirely watchable , if superficial in this instance .

title: Exploration of excess
review: Leonardo DiCaprio gives a typically good performance as this film"s protagonist , successfully convincing us of his transformation into a jaded , drug addicted figure .

title: Exploration of excess
review: Jonah Hill is his second - in - command , although I found his performance one - note

title: Exploration of excess
review: and he was trying too hard to be funny throughout .

title: Exploration of excess
review: The best performers , like Jon Bernthal , have smaller parts although they do stand out in them .

title: Exploration of excess
review: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET is certainly well - shot and entertaining enough ,

title: Exploration of excess
review: and there are some stand - out sequences , like the bit where DiCaprio is unable to walk .

title: Exploration of excess
review: In the end , though , it feels very slight , a comedy with a lot of laughs and general outrageousness , but nothing we haven"t seen done before , and done better .

title: We've seen the this story before, but it's lost it's emotion
review: Martin Scorsese has always been the Jewel of New Hollywood , he hasn"t burned out like Coppola & Cimino , or softened his image by making giant block busters and family films like Spielberg and Lucas .

title: We've seen the this story before, but it's lost it's emotion
review: Even his 2011 film Hugo , while a departure from his normal dark crime films still contained his trademark love of all things cinema .

title: We've seen the this story before, but it's lost it's emotion
review: So how did his new film " The Wolf of Wall Street " ad to his legacy ? Well quite frankly we"ve seen this story before , actually we"ve seen it twice before in his crime masterpiece Goodfellas ,

title: We've seen the this story before, but it's lost it's emotion
review: and his chilling biopic ( and possible greatest film ) Raging Bull .

title: We've seen the this story before, but it's lost it's emotion
review: The story of a young hot headed male ( Jordan Belfort , Henry Hill , Jake LaMotta ) who starts humble while sinking deeper in their respective world ( the corruption of Wall Street , the Italian - American Mafia , or Boxing title fights ) is a world Scorsese can tell about growing up in the Machismo rich culture of Italian - American New York .

title: We've seen the this story before, but it's lost it's emotion
review: But while each re - telling has seen Scorsese improve his technique and the art of the camera , each successive film has become more sterile .

title: We've seen the this story before, but it's lost it's emotion
review: Viewing Raging Bull to this day still is a cinematic art piece that shows the negative consequences of the brutal male psyche , and then in Goodfellas , while Henry Hill follows the same path his character is not one to be sympathized much with ,

title: We've seen the this story before, but it's lost it's emotion
review: and then finally Jordan Belfort , a character that is as smug and unlikable , but is un - noticed when placed in a film with even more unlikeable characters ( looking right at Jonah Hill ) .

title: We've seen the this story before, but it's lost it's emotion

" The fact that this movie received so many accolades , award nominations , and even wins , makes me truly despise how pathetic of a turn our society has made .

title: The master is back.
review: Bacchus , Roman god of wine and debauchery , is alive and well

title: The master is back.
review: and has been brought to raunchy life by Leonardo DiCaprio in Martin Scorsese"s latest film " The Wolf of Wall Street " .

title: The master is back.
review: His human incarnation is Jordan Belfort , a fast - talking financial kingpin whose balls - to - the - wall lifestyle of sex and drugs and rolling in dough would make Gordon Gekko take a step back

title: The master is back.
review: and reassess his lifestyle .

title: The master is back.
review: And for what seems to be the first time , Scorsese"s decade - long collaboration with DiCaprio has finally paid off .

title: The master is back.
review: Because " The Wolf of Wall Street " , written by " Sopranos " scribe Terence Winter , is a far cry from the polished but lifeless films that Scorsese , master that he is , has been pumping out of late .

title: The master is back.
review: It is perhaps his most energetic film since " Gangs of New York " , his cleanest ( in craftsmanship , though certainly not in content ) since " Goodfellas " .

title: The master is back.
review: Instead of wise - guys and low - rent mobsters , " Wolf " is about the sharks that swam in the seas of the 1 % , ripping into their prey with gusto while coming at them with smiles .

title: The master is back.
review: Set in the " 80s and " 90s , Scorsese depicts a glitz - and - chintz world ripe for the taking for any ambitious youth who wanted to make a name for himself .

title: The master is back.
review: Enter Belfort , a fresh - faced twenty- something who starts on the bottom rung at one of the many firms in Lower Manhattan .

title: The master is back.
review: He quickly becomes the acolyte of the head honcho ( Matthew McConaughey , who in only a few short scenes manages to give one of the performances of the year ) ,

title: The master is back.
review: and in doing so learns the tricks of the trade , which involve indulging in any and all sins of the flesh .

title: The master is back.
review: But when the market goes belly - up , Belfort ( not wanting to go out on his ass like all the other Wall Street schmucks ) realizes that he can take advantage of " penny - stocks " that no one cares about , pitching them to anyone gullible enough to buy them .

title: The master is back.
review: Soon , Belfort founds his own firm , Stratton Oakmont , with a merry band of miscreants , including his right - hand man Donnie Azoff ( Jonah Hill ) .

title: The master is back.
review: Soon , Stratton Oakmont becomes a major , major player in the stock world , luring huge clients in with the hopes of paying out big - time .

title: The master is back.
review: Except all that Belfort , Azoff and the others care about is their own gain ,

title: The master is back.
review: and the more they make , the more they want .

title: The master is back.
review: And of course , absolutely none of what Stratton does is legal , so obviously the feds ( represented by a dogged Kyle Chandler ) seek to rain on Belfort"s parade .

title: The master is back.
review: But before that , the parade roars in full orgiastic force .

title: The master is back.
review: Scorsese"s film is an epic , three hours of every kind of cardinal sin short of murder , with characters both repulsive and entrancing , in a hysterically funny and painfully horrific saga of depravity as only Scorsese can bring .

title: The master is back.
review: Thelma Schoonmaker"s editing never once makes the film feel its length ,

title: The master is back.
review: and Winter"s script is jam - packed with colorful moments and almost surreal hedonism .

title: The master is back.
review: There are so many drug - fueled sequences that anyone who goes in sober will come out with a contact high .

title: The master is back.
review: Perhaps the most impressive thing about the film is that , at long last , DiCaprio has learned to loosen up .

title: The master is back.
review: " Wolf " allows him to finally sink his teeth in a full - on comic role ,

title: The master is back.
review: and he makes it work impeccably .

title: The master is back.
review: His energy crackles with every single actor ,

title: The master is back.
review: and he even shows an adeptness at physical comedy ( there"s a scene involving a " luded - up Jordan trying to roll himself down stairs that might be the funniest moment of the year ) .

title: The master is back.
review: But the rest of the cast is equally up to the task to match him .

title: The master is back.
review: Jonah Hill is in rarest form here , giving an excellent performance

title: The master is back.
review: and displaying grand chemistry with DiCaprio .

title: The master is back.
review: There are guys like Rob Reiner , Jon Bernthal , even Spike Jonze in a small role that are absolutely wondrous to watch .

title: The master is back.
review: And I do have to give special shout - outs to Jean Dujardin and Joanna Lumley , both of whom stole the show in playing characters that end up as part of Belfort"s scheme to hoard his riches .

title: The master is back.
review: ( If " Wolf""s cast has an Achilles heel , it"s Margot Robbie as Belfort"s bride , who I feel tries so hard to be on Lorraine Bracco"s level but comes off as a second - rate Sharon Stone .

title: The master is back.
review: ) Even as the film draws to its close , there"s not a single moment where " Wolf of Wall Street " wants to relinquish its hold on us .

title: The master is back.
review: We"re in it for the long haul , as Belfort"s protégés must have been .

title: The master is back.
review: And for Scorsese and Schoonmaker , hardly spring chickens , to revive the decadence of the gods in all of its party - hearty glory is something to behold .

title: The master is back.
review: " Wolf of Wall Street " had me flying high ,

title: The master is back.
review: and I"m still waiting to come down from it

title: Money Doesn't Talk it Swears
review: A stylish , exhilarating film to experience ( although hardly - despite the incredible " quaaludes " sequence - three hours worth ) .

title: Money Doesn't Talk it Swears
review: Nor is it the first to be called " The Wolf of Wall Street " .

title: Money Doesn't Talk it Swears
review: That distinction belongs to a long - lost early talkie starring George Bancroft that opened a few months before the original Wall Street crash of 1929 .

title: Money Doesn't Talk it Swears
review: And the new " Wolf of Wall Street " amply demonstrates that the United States of America has learned absolutely nothing in the intervening ninety years .

title: Money Doesn't Talk it Swears
review: DiCaprio acknowledges at one point that the life that he and his cronies lead is unsustainable in the Real World , "

title: Money Doesn't Talk it Swears
review: but who wants to live there ? " This is of course an option denied the colossal army of poor working stiffs ( many of them women ) with their feet planted firmly on the ground working long hours for peanuts working as waiters , domestic staff and nurses ; as well as manufacturing the sharp suits and industrial - strength quantities of drugs consumed by the leads " sailing a boat fit for a Bond villain " .

title: Money Doesn't Talk it Swears
review: This army remains as invisible throughout most of this film as the consumption by the masters they spend their lives servicing and cleaning up after is conspicuous ; which graphically demonstrates the harmfulness of giving the predominantly white male parasites who populate this movie " more money than you know what to do with " .

title: Money Doesn't Talk it Swears
review: Billionaire conservatives meanwhile continue to sanctimoniously demand where the money to create adequate universal health cover in the richest nation on Earth would come from .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: The fifth collaboration between Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio , The Wolf of Wall Street tells the true story of the rise and fall of Jordan Belfort ( DiCaprio ) , a New York stockbroker who made it big in the wake of the financial crisis of the late " 80s by shady and frequently illegal means .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: More interesting is what he does with his new found fortune : what follows is a heady tale of excess and debauchery based on Belfort"s own memoirs .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: Despite the more recent financial turmoil , or perhaps because of it , the image of the " 80s stockbroker has resurfaced for a new generation .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: Belfort"s story strays into the early " 90s ,

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: but the general aesthetic of the era has the same nostalgic feel , and the messages seem to be the same .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: Even if we openly loathe bankers , there"s a voyeuristic fascination in watching their decadent lifestyle – or what we imagine such a lifestyle to be like : high stress , fast living , dubious morality and plenty of drugs and sex to boot .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: The Wolf of Wall Street gives its audience a welcome window into this world .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: The story begins when Jordan arrives in the city as a bright eyed , newly qualified broker ; having already achieved his youthful dream of working on Wall Street .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: After an initially unwelcome brief induction into a life of cocaine and lunchtime cocktails by his new boss Mark Hanna ( Matthew McConaughey ) the rug is pulled out from under his feet ,

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: and he soon swaps blue chips for penny stocks , trading shares worth a fraction of a dollar from a Long Island brokerage on a strip mall .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: Upon realising that these unlisted stocks can fetch a much higher commission than blue chips , he decides to go into business with a bunch of unscrupulous buddies who know a thing or two about sales , using their silver tongues to make millions by trading them on a massive scale , all the while trying to stay one step ahead of the law .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: For in truth he is committing outright stock fraud – the details of which are fairly complicated ; even Belfort himself chooses not to bore us with the details with his tongue in cheek narration .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: The stellar cast is rounded out by players including Jonah Hill , as Belfort"s toothy associate Donnie , Rob Reiner as his complicit accountant father Max Belfort , and Jon Favreau as lawyer Manny Riskin .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: The movie treads a thin line between satire and glorification ,

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: but Jordan is undoubtedly the hero of the piece , and the FBI agents on his trail the antagonists he must outwit .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: As an audience , we are invited to his party ,

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: and we witness nothing of the effects that Belfort"s deceptions have had on those who were duped into buying his shares – bearing in mind these " customers " are average people parting with their savings , not huge companies dealing in huge sums of money .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: This disconnection effectively puts us in Belfort"s shoes : much as they must have appeared to him , they are mere voices on the end of a phone .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: But Jordan is not portrayed as completely heartless .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: No matter how large his company grows , swelled with a never - ending number of skilled and promising applicants , his loyal gang of hometown reprobates are never left behind ,

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: and maintain high - ranking positions until the end .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: Even when arrested , and forced to wear a wire by the FBI , he attempts to warn Donnie , rather than let him incriminate himself .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: Gratuitous drug use and sexual content aside , the film"s vulgarity can perhaps be summed up by its smashing of the record for the most uses of the f - word in a mainstream non - documentary film , at the rate of around three a minute .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: The only film scoring higher is a documentary devoted to the word .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: Much of the decadence is played for laughs , or at least as a showcase of extravagance ,

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: but coupled with the basic shock value of the actions themselves .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: One memorable sequence sees Belfort snorting cocaine to counteract the effects of a powerful sedative , paralleled with the Popeye cartoon playing on the television in the background .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: The film does little to condemn Belfort – although his lifestyle unravels ,

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: and he is ultimately incarcerated , any true comeuppance is minimal .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: This is a reflection of the truth : Belfort"s sentence was just four years , of which he served less than two , which , if the film is to be believed , were in a comfortable minimum security environment for white collar offenders .

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: These days , he still makes a handsome living as a motivational speaker lecturing on sales technique ,

title: Leo strikes back with his latest Scorsese collaboration.
review: and of course , anyone who gets their autobiography made into a Scorsese picture starring Leonardo DiCaprio must have lucked out in the long run .

title: Sex, Drugs, and Money
review: The Wolf of Wall Street is a film that depicts the rise and fall of Jordan Belfort who , through greed and corruption , established and led his own brokerage firm to success in the early 1990"s .

title: Sex, Drugs, and Money
review: After losing his job at an established financial firm on Black Monday , Belfort fills a position dealing penny stocks in Long Island and subsequently partners with his new friend , Donnie Azoff , to found Stratton Oakmont .

title: Sex, Drugs, and Money
review: Belfort"s aggressiveness in the market earned him the nickname , Wolf of Wall Street .

title: Sex, Drugs, and Money
review: Jordan and his team lived high - profile lifestyle full of parties , sex , and drugs ( primarily cocaine and Quaaludes ) .

title: Sex, Drugs, and Money
review: Eventually Stratton Oakmont becomes a very well known firm

title: Sex, Drugs, and Money
review: and facilitates the IPO for Steve Madden , which instantly earned Jordan $ 20million dollars .

title: Sex, Drugs, and Money
review: Jordan decides to hide his money in an offshore account in Switzerland under his aunt - in - laws name .

title: Sex, Drugs, and Money
review: The FBI begins heavy investigations into Stratton Oakmont ,

title: Sex, Drugs, and Money
review: and after ducking and dodging them for a couple years eventually one of his associates gets arrested , spills the beans about the operation ,

title: Sex, Drugs, and Money
review: and Jordan is sentenced to prison for 36 months .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: Since he"s explored this theme so many times now , can Scorsese still deliver ? Let"s find out ! The plot follows Jordan Belfort , a rich , highly successful stockbroker who starts out working a low - level job at an established Wall Street firm where he quickly becomes attracted to the world of stocks but loses his job due to Black Monday .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: Then , he starts his OWN brokerage firm titled " Stratton - Oakmont " with his new friend , Donnie Azerto and from then on , the company skyrockets to the top by doing pump and dump scams and they live in a world full of sex and drugs while the FBI is hot on their trail .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End

review: but this movie is so over - the - top , it"s hilarious .

review: Every character in this movie is portrayed in an over - the - top fashion , they all do things you don"t expect any normal human being to do .

review: They have sex in the office in front of everyone , they get their dicks sucked in public ,

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: and they do more drugs than you could ever dream of in your wildest imaginations .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: This makes for a very funny and entertaining film because as you watch it , you can"t help

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: but laugh at how absurd it is but also fantasize about living the life these guys are living in .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: But while this is a comedy film , it also has a lot of heavy drama in it .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: This movie has a bit of a bipolar tone to it , one minute you might be laughing hysterically ,

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: and the next minute you might drop your jaw from being incredibly shocked at what you just saw .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: For example , there"s a scene where Jordan gets so overwhelmed by the huge amounts of Quaaludes he took , he falls right down to the floor

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: and can"t walk and there"s a lot of physical comedy in this scene as Jordan tries to make it down a set of stairs

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: and we"re laughing and enjoying ourselves for a while

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: but then , all of a sudden , we see Jordan"s baby daughter walk into the room , seeing her dad all high on Quaaludes and to quote RedLetterMedia , it feels like a punch to the gut and that"s what the whole movie felt like to me .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: One minute there"s laugh - out - loud comedy , next minute , there"s heavy , intense drama that might get hard to watch .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: I"d have a problem with this if it felt very schmultzy and heavy - handed but Scorsese depicts it very raw

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: and brutal so it feels natural and we don"t find the shift of tone too jarring to watch .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: While Jordan Belfort is definitely a douchebag , DiCaprio surprisingly makes his character very likable for a lot of the film .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: He has this magnetic charm and confidence to him that makes the audience like and root for him even when he"s doing terrible things

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: and there"s moments where we see essences of humanity to him such as when he gives his employee five times the money she needed to support her kids which are really important to make his character be at least SOMEWHAT sympathetic but at the same time , he never loses the douchebag attitude that makes you WANT to hate him , but you don"t because deep down , we all sort of want to do the things he does throughout the film .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: Everyone else in the cast was strong too

review: but the only real standouts were Jonah Hill as Donnie Azerto and Margot Robbie as Jordan"s wife , Naomi .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: In this film , I didn"t see Jonah Hill at all , I saw Donnie Azerto , THAT"S how good he was .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: And this has GOT to be the breakthrough for Margot Robbie , who seems very real and natural as someone who tries to TOLERATE her husband"s wild behavior ,

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: but ultimately gives up as she realizes throughout what kind of man he is .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: The editing in this film is incredibly frenetic and energetic .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: There"s a lot of slow - mo , freeze - frames , jump cuts , and there"s a lot of moments where they"ll make you think nothing went wrong for our protagonist , next thing you know , they cut BACK to show what REALLY happened and this really helps get you into the mind of Jordan Belfort as he"s constantly on drugs and not always aware of what"s going on .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: But despite how good those things were , there are some problems with the film .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: I"ve noticed that the script has a habit of spoon- feeding everything to the audience .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: Now , I understand that not everyone understands how Wall Street works so we need to explain it in a simple way for them to understand but I don"t like how there"s so many scenes where the visuals speak perfectly for itself but yet , they still have to narrate it for us .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: Come on Scorsese , we"re not that stupid .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: I also felt that outside of Jordan , Donnie , Naomi , and Jordan"s dad , Max Belfort , the rest of the characters just sort of came

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: and went without us knowing them a whole lot .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: I wished we could"ve spent more time to know them a little better .

title: A Funny, Energetic Ride That Will Keep You Glued to the Seats till the Very End
review: But overall , this is a funny , energetic film that will keep your eyes glued to the screen by either making you laugh your balls off or by making you gasp at what"s happening to our characters .

title: Best Scorsese-DiCaprio Film To Date
review: A downright hilarious , unabashedly entertaining & riotously fun ride that presents both Martin Scorsese & Leonardo DiCaprio in prime form , The Wolf of Wall Street is a masterly directed , sharply scripted & expertly acted biopic that chronicles the remarkable journey of Jordan Belfort from his rise to a wealthy stockbroker living the high life to his fall involving crime , corruption & federal government .

title: Best Scorsese-DiCaprio Film To Date
review: Stylishly directed by Scorsese in what"s his 5th collaboration with DiCaprio , this is arguably his best film to date and certainly the most enjoyable of them all .

title: Best Scorsese-DiCaprio Film To Date
review: A tale of debauchery that"s consistently high on money , parties , sex & drugs , the picture is gripping from the get go

title: Best Scorsese-DiCaprio Film To Date
review: and sustains its manic energy & irreverent humour for most of its runtime

title: Best Scorsese-DiCaprio Film To Date
review: but what keeps it alive is the auteur"s assured craftsmanship .

title: Best Scorsese-DiCaprio Film To Date
review: Further uplifting the viewing experience is the excellent production design , sharp camerawork , neat editing , breakneck pace , fab costumes , dynamic score & stellar performances .

title: Best Scorsese-DiCaprio Film To Date
review: Leading from the front is DiCaprio who utilises every bit of his on - screen charisma & acting prowess to deliver his career - best work .

title: Best Scorsese-DiCaprio Film To Date
review: Jonah Hill is a revelation too , playing Belfort"s sidekick with elan .

title: Best Scorsese-DiCaprio Film To Date
review: And they are well supported by the rest of the cast .

title: Best Scorsese-DiCaprio Film To Date
review: Overall , The Wolf of Wall Street is an endlessly funny & deliberately unrestrained exercise in excess that promises 3 hours of non - stop extravaganza and finds both the master & his protégé delivering on all fronts .

title: Best Scorsese-DiCaprio Film To Date
review: An infectious & intoxicating film that"s high & hyper from its opening moments yet continues to snort more white powder every 5 mins , The Wolf of Wall Street is one of the finest films of its year , one of the best examples of its kind , and certainly the most memorable one from Scorsese & DiCaprio so far .

title: The Party's Over
review: Jordan Belfort is a dangerous man .

title: The Party's Over
review: The kind of dangerous that allows for simultaneous smooth - talking and first - class hustling .

title: The Party's Over
review: In Martin Scorsese"s 22nd feature film , the audience is invited to 180 minutes of uninterrupted lewd extravagance – all told from the perspective of its narrator – Belfort himself .

title: The Party's Over
review: In The Wolf of Wall Street , we see Scorsese return to familiar styling .

title: The Party's Over
review: Reaching back into the vault , Marty combines the narration dominance of Goodfellas and Casino , with the dark humor of The King of Comedy and After Hours .

title: The Party's Over
review: The melding of these two elements present the perfect foundation for a group of Wall Street brokers hellbent on watching the world burn one mouthful of Quaaludes at a time .

title: The Party's Over
review: Belfort is typical in how we think about corruption and excess , particularly in the sense of a Wall Street executive .

title: The Party's Over
review: We see Belfort ( Leonardo Dicaprio ) rise from the ranks of a low - rung smile and dial broker eager to impress his boss and clients , to a master of riches as the leader of his own wolf - pack , starring most - notably Jonah Hill .

title: The Party's Over
review: As the flies on the wall to this never - ending orgy of a life ( so they think ) , we get a taste of the mindset at work here with midget tossing , naked marching bands in the office , and a steady stream of recycled prostitutes .

title: The Party's Over
review: For these purveyors of deceit , this is only the tip of the iceberg in their ocean of absurdity .

title: The Party's Over
review: It"s easy to peg this film as simply another anecdote to the evils of Wall Street ,

title: The Party's Over
review: but such a reading would be a mistake to what"s going on under the surface .

title: The Party's Over
review: Sure , we have Belfort telling us his first - hand account of a life of debauchery ( sex , drugs , manipulation , lying , stealing , cheating , and oh yeah , more sex and drugs ) .

title: The Party's Over
review: The thing is , we don"t need Wall Street to tell that story .

title: The Party's Over
review: Wall Street is the backdrop for something facing us all : how does one deal with temptation ? How many of us would love to live in the fast - lane like the movers and shakers of Stratton Oakmont ? How many of us would do questionable things to get there ? Jordan Belfort is an unreliable narrator ( the self - impressed narration where he changes the color of the car ) .

title: The Party's Over
review: Through this , we"re given an honest look into the psyche of always wanting more .

title: The Party's Over
review: In his version of events , no one can deny their temptations .

title: The Party's Over
review: The only course forward for these people is more drug benders and offshore bank accounts .

title: The Party's Over
review: Only more money and partying will quench that insatiable thirst for glut .

title: The Party's Over
review: In Wolf , they"re all gaming their clients in the stock market with worthless penny stocks ,

title: The Party's Over
review: but they could just as easily be in real estate , banking , insurance etc .

title: The Party's Over
review: It doesn"t matter , because we"re dealing with a fundamentally human problem .

title: The Party's Over
review: Belfort is unflinching in telling the world his ineptitude in conscious .

title: The Party's Over
review: The picture painted is one of unflattering negligence , including many moments that make him look pathetic .

title: The Party's Over
review: The list of violence , indulgence , and corruption is almost as long as the list of people left in the wake of his storm .

title: The Party's Over
review: His wife is tossed aside for the eye candy of his future trophy wife ( Margot Robbie ) .

title: The Party's Over
review: He builds an empire through breaking every rule in the book , while peeling the naïve bystanders off the bottom of his 1 , 000 dollar pair of shoes .

title: The Party's Over
review: He puts others in danger through his overabundance of drug and alcohol use , including driving while having almost no control of his limbs .

title: The Party's Over
review: Belfort eventually hits rock bottom when he punches his wife in the stomach after the threat of his daughter being taken away .

title: The Party's Over
review: He then puts the child in the passenger seat of his car , only to recklessly back it into a post in the driveway .

title: The Party's Over
review: At the end , Belfort cuts a deal with the feds

title: The Party's Over
review: and serves some prison time as a country club prisoner .

title: The Party's Over
review: Ultimately , what makes this film so special gets back to that floating question : how does one deal with temptation ? In The Wolf of Wall Street , no one is actually innocent .

title: The Party's Over
review: Not even the people getting duped on the phone by Belfort himself .

title: The Party's Over
review: To see the real victims is to look in the mirror .

title: The Party's Over
review: The point of this film isn"t Wall Street ; it"s about the negative aspects in which society maneuvers .

title: The Party's Over
review: There"s a soul - searching effect to see where we fit on that spectrum , how we come to grips with our own inner cravings .

title: The Party's Over
review: This isn"t a case of glorification like so many have pointed out .

title: The Party's Over
review: This is a case of a savvy director putting all the cards on the table .

title: The Party's Over
review: Scorsese is letting us decide how we feel about a society we"ve helped mold ; a society that lends itself to this behavior .

title: The Party's Over
review: In three hours of laughs , gasps , and head - shaking , we receive a film that doesn"t hold our hands by telling us what to think , rather a human story that demands self - inspection .

title: The Party's Over
review: The last images are of a poignant scene in which Belfort is now a motivational speaker at a seminar .

title: The Party's Over
review: As he walks to the front row , he tells a few gentlemen to " sell me this pen ! " They stumble along with untrained pitches , as the rest of the audience looks on with wide - eyed stares hungry to learn the secrets of the universe .

title: The Party's Over
review: In this moment , the cycle continues . The joke is on us .

review: If you"ve seen one Martin Scorsese film , you"ve seen them all .

review: Perhaps this statement only when applied to Scorsese can be construed as a compliment .

title: An obscene, excessive and over-indulgent romp

title: An obscene, excessive and over-indulgent romp
review: The heart and soul of the film is Leonardo DiCaprio , adeptly playing the protagonist Jordan Belfort to whom ambition is the air he breathes , no excess excessive enough and playing the game alone is reward enough - at any cost .

title: Excess to the extreme.
review: In a lot of ways , The Wolf of Wall Street feels like something of a follow - up to two of his most beloved and acclaimed movies , Casino and Goodfellas even though the movie takes place in its own universe and Jordan Belfort is a professional convict who does more harm with a pen than a gun in the film .

title: Excess to the extreme.
review: Despite that , all three movies survive as Martin"s own disembowelment of the cynicism of the American Dream and much like Goodfellas , The Wolf of Wall Street grants the viewer entry into a symbolically glittering world .

title: Excess to the extreme.

title: The Wolf of WS's Biggest Excess is the Film Length
review: The excesses in the rise and fall of Jordan Belfort , the true story of the wealthy stockbroker told in Martin Scorsese"s The Wolf of Wall Street , is an essential element of this movie .

title: The Wolf of WS's Biggest Excess is the Film Length
review: However , the biggest sin of the filmmaker is that he stretches out of the debauchery , greed and decadence over a three - hour film that is ineffectively countered with only an infinitesimal amount of moral and rational content .

title: The Wolf of WS's Biggest Excess is the Film Length
review: The acting of Leonardo DiCaprio is not in question here ; nor , for that matter , are the performances of his supporting cast , most notably Jonah Hill and Margot Robbie , who play his business partner and second wife , respectively .

title: The Wolf of WS's Biggest Excess is the Film Length
review: Strong performances abound by those three actors and others as well in this cinematic effort .

title: The Wolf of WS's Biggest Excess is the Film Length
review: In the case of DiCaprio , one could argue that this could be one of the top movie portrayals of his career .

title: The Wolf of WS's Biggest Excess is the Film Length
review: However , save for the very brief moralistic beginning of the Belfort character , the other 98 percent of the movie leaves you with a protagonist that offers nothing for viewers to root for , unless you are a fervent worshiper at the altars of Gordon Gekko ( see Oliver"s Stones " 1987 Wall Street ) , Hustler"s Larry Flynt and the Allied Brotherhood of Drug Dealers Incorporated .

title: The Wolf of WS's Biggest Excess is the Film Length
review: Yet , this is apparently the true - life story of Belfort .

title: The Wolf of WS's Biggest Excess is the Film Length
review: Thus with respect to his rise to making millions of dollars , all the drugs , sex and abject degenerate behavior that went with it , along with his eventual fall from the illicit pinnacle he built up for himself and his company , it is what it is .

title: The Wolf of WS's Biggest Excess is the Film Length
review: However , when the audience is required to endure the long drawn out corruption and comeuppance without giving it any reason to care about the outcome of the arrogant central character , it makes for an unsatisfying cinema experience .

title: The Wolf of WS's Biggest Excess is the Film Length
review: Just a little bit of redeeming character ( even if invented ) , such as that afforded to cocaine magnate Tony Montana ( Al Pacino ) in the 1983 Scarface , along with about 30 - 60 minutes of editing cuts would have made The Wolf of Wall Street a more enjoyable movie experience .

title: What's missing in what should have been a masterpiece

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: Spoiler Alert The Wolf of Wall Street is another excellent production put together by Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: The film is well directed , telling the story of Jordan Belfort , a real life stock broker who got involved in drugs and questionable trading strategies during the 1980"s and 1990"s .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: I believe this film is one of Leonardo DiCaprio"s best performances of his career .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: The Wolf of Wall Street was released at the end of 2013 , directed by Martin Scorsese from the Warner Brothers studio .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: The film was rather long totaling 180 minutes , with an R rating .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: The cast consists of a number of recognized actors and actresses .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: The main characters consist of Leonardo DiCaprio who plays Jordan Belfort , Jonah Hill who plays Donnie Azoff ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and Margot Robbie who plays Naomi Lapaglia , Mr. Belfort"s second wife .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: A few other big names with smaller roles in the film are Matthew McConaughey , Kyle Chandler , and Rob Reiner .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: The movie is based on a true story of Jordan Belfort , which follows his life when he starts working on Wall Street , becomes a wealthy stock broker , and finally is shut down by the federal government .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: After Jordan Belfort loses his job on Wall Street after only a few weeks , he teams up with Donny Azoff

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and they started their own brokerage firm , called Stratford - Oakmont .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: The company started with a small staff

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and quickly grew in excess of 250 employees while Jordan trained his core group to trade penny stocks to uninformed investors , a process known as pump and dump .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: After Stratford - Oakmont was established , the company started filing initial public offerings .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: Some of the company"s strategies and techniques come into question as their profits are through the roof .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: I was really drawn to this movie , as I"m a big Martin Scorsese fan and a bigger Leonardo DiCaprio fan .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: In addition to the director and big name actors I was familiar with the story of Jordan Belfort .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: However I never realized the lifestyle he lived during the 90"s .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: He was comfortable selling individuals junk stocks , which he knew would not make them any money

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and taking that money to live a lavish life .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: Another movie with a similar theme is Boiler Room , a Ben Younger film which shows a similar main character , a youngster who works as a broker and makes some not legitimate moves in order to gain personal wealth .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: The motif of each of these films circles around greed .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: I would certainly recommend this film , it"s well directed with a star studded cast of actors .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: There are some extremely funny parts of the film and some serious moments , which make you think about greed and morale .

title: Awesome performances, but not for the prudish
review: The old student adage - " better a bottom in front of me than a frontal lobotomy " - was never truer than in Martin Scorsese"s new film " The Wolf of Wall Street " .

title: Awesome performances, but not for the prudish
review: The film tells the bizarrely true story of Jordan Belfort ( based off his autobiography ): a rags to enormous riches story of the ugly side of stock - brokerage .

title: Awesome performances, but not for the prudish
review: Starting off young , naive but ambitious in a " standard " Wall Street company , Belfort ( Leonardo di Caprio ) is taken under the wing of wild - duck maverick Mark Hanna ( Matthew McConaughey ) , who teaches him some of the ropes as well as introducing him to some distinctly bad habits .

title: Awesome performances, but not for the prudish
review: Following redundancy on Black Monday , and picking up sidekick Donnie Azoff ( Jonah Hill ) on the way , Belfort focuses on selling dodgy penny stocks to blue chip customers , with astonishing success .

title: Awesome performances, but not for the prudish
review: His success draws him to the attention of an investigating FBI agent ( Kyle Chandler ) who gives him and his team hell in trying to convict him of wrongdoing .

title: Awesome performances, but not for the prudish
review: Around this general plot line drives the alcohol and drug - imbued love life of Belfort : a steady stream of absurdly beautiful women normally wearing nothing more than a smile , led ( notably ) by Australian beauty Margot Robbie ( About Time ) .

title: Awesome performances, but not for the prudish
review: This is definitely not a film for the prudish .

title: Awesome performances, but not for the prudish
review: The nudity and sex is ( if you"ll excuse the pun ) definitely in your face .

title: Awesome performances, but not for the prudish
review: The drug taking is extreme and prolific : the very first scene of the film shows Belfort " doing crack"Â … ( this is in fact a killer joke , copyright my son George Mann ) .

title: Awesome performances, but not for the prudish
review: And there is limited albeit distressing violence ( of the marital abuse variety ) .

title: Awesome performances, but not for the prudish
review: All in all , this is not the film to take your favourite maiden aunt to see on a Sunday afternoon .

title: Awesome performances, but not for the prudish
review: But if you can stomach all of this ( or , perhaps more appropriately , snort cocaine off the stomach of all of this ) then this is a gripping story with fantastic performances throughout .

review: The now largely forgotten Somerset Maugham – the most popular writer in the English language for much of the first half of the Twentieth Century - often faced similar criticism .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: Maugham"s response never wavered .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: It was not his job as an author , he would state , to set the world to rights .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: He based his characters on people that he knew .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: He wrote of , and embellished , their faults and shortcomings .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: It was for his readers to make their own judgements

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: and determine what was right , and what was wrong .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: Director Martin Scorsese and scriptwriter Terence Winter seem to have adopted a similar line .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: They have simply told their version as they saw it : the story of a man corrupted by greed whose habit was fed by those who were only too keen to invest greedily in schemes where they thought they could make a quick , easy buck .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: It is ironic that many of those who now complain Belfort is portrayed too sympathetically were those investors prepared to do anything to get money apart from work for it .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: If Scorsese"s film has a moral lesson , it is that people should not be seduced by the thought of soft profit .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: I suspect also , that Scorsese is of the opinion that nothing much has changed since the balloon went up with the GFC , that the fault lines remain in place for history to repeat itself .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: Wasn"t it Sir Winston Churchill who stated that the only thing history ever teaches us , is that nobody ever learns from it .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: So I would recommend you go and see The Wolf of Wall Street and make your own judgement as to its morality – don"t rely on others to make that judgement call for you .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: It is a great piece of film - making which runs solidly for three hours during which the pace never slackens or dulls .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: It fascinates for its whole duration .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: Direction , script and cinematography are all spot on

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: and the acting complements it well .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: Leonardo Dicaprio is always at his best when playing larger than life characters

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: and here is no exception .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: His charisma oozes from every pore and is essential to his characterisation – what conman was ever successful by being dour and self - deprecating ? His skillful piece of acrobatic acting as he opened his car door with his foot when out of his mind on Quaaludes was laugh out loud funny .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: The rest of the cast also rise to the occasion

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: and there is a wonderful comic cameo from Joanna Lumley , as Belfont"s aunt by marriage , whose major scene with Dicaprio is great fun , very much a highlight .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: Special mention also to Australian actor Margot Robbie as Belfont"s second wife who holds her own opposite Dicaprio and never lets her accent slip .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: Two criticisms – one more serious than the other .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: The debauchery and female nudity were overdone .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: The solitary scene of a musical band of bare torsoed men seemed to be a contrivance

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: and inserted simply to deflect such criticism .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: Much of the female nudity seemed only there for male titillation .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: And a minor criticism of the otherwise excellent Jonah Hill , as Belfont"s sidekick Donnie Azoff .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: Azoff was clearly a near chain - smoker .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: Yet Jonah Hill never looked comfortable holding a cigarette

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: and was obviously faking the inhalation .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: Smokers ( and ex - smokers ) easily pick up on this

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: and it"s a distraction .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: Odd that the many , many scenes of coke snorting looked wholly realistic .

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: I have my doubts as to whether The Wolf of Wall Street has the gravitas to become a classic ,

title: Morality? You Be the Judge
review: but it is a highly enjoyable romp giving a good snapshot of the " greed is good " culture which remains with us and is surely lurking , ready to bite with even greater effect next time round .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: After a flight into " general audience " land with the excellent " Hugo " , Martin Scorsese collaborates for a fifth time with the ever more dependable Leo DiCaprio , playing his second real life figure for the legendary film maker .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: Jordan Belfort came from nothing and built a Wall Steet empire like a true Gordon Gekko by , essentially , screwing over any sucker he could .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: The man did time , paid his dues , wrote a confessional , cautionary tale , and now performs sales seminars .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: None of this is spoiler ; assuming you are at all interested in the topic , this should be unsurprising knowledge .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: It is also par for the course with this sort of Scorsese movie ; you"ve seen the " rise and fall " riff from him a few times before now , right ? For the actor , everything he touches turns to gold right now ; here he gives what is probably his most energetic performance , often invoking a young Jack Nicholson .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: Certainly an extraordinary , extended sequence involving the results of a narcotics overdose is due to be considered classic in no time ! For Scorsese , the obvious touchstone here is " Goodfellas " ; the style of building momentum and " bad guy " narration is back ,

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: but again , the gangster epic remains the superior film .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: For both men as a team , " The Aviator " is their obvious high point .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: That said , there is much to be admired here : The excellent look of the film , the superb performances from Jonah Hill and Matthew McConaughey , the latter of whom only has about ten minutes screen time

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: but leaves a huge impression ; the fantastic use of music , again reminding us of Scorsese"s ability to compose excellent montages , which drive us forward without much plot , and a masterful ability to turn the tone of the film on a dime , if only for a moment .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: This latter point results in unexpected laughs and gasps of disbelief ; a sense of comedy arises from what is frequently a simultaneously rather obscene and absurd set of circumstances and behaviour , which leave you feeling quite horrified and/or disgusted .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: On the downside , there is no excuse for its length and , toward the end , an upset rhythm .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: Up to a point we are completely on board ,

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: but as the film enters its third hour

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: and is only then truly exploring the repercussions of Jordan"s actions , along with his humiliation , we become painfully aware that with some more intelligent and brutal editing , there was probably a good forty - five minutes of the previous couple of hours that could have been easily expunged , leaving room for more of the final act

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: and bringing it in at an easy 135 minutes .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: Perhaps we should turn to Leo as producer here

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: and ask , " Why didn"t you say no to a three hour cut of this ? " " The Wolf ... " asks for a lot of investment in a set of characters it is pretty tough to care much for ,

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: and with ultimately little reward .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: The film is an impressive effort ,

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: and undoubtedly Scorsese"s most ballsy film for some time ,

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: but it is also disappointing ; looking at his career , we all know that this should have been a five star film ! The sense that this master of cinema could have done a bit better is not easily ignored .

title: Scorsese gets ballsy again
review: Nevertheless , there is enough here to make it worth your while when it leaves the cinema .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: The constant theme of Martin Scorsese"s best work are the temptations of the flesh , never more aptly seen than though the prism of real - life subjects .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: He"s explored this through Jake LaMotta , Howard Hughes , Henry Hill and Jesus Christ ,

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: but in his new film The Wolf of Wall Street , Jordan Belfort may have the most savage appetite of them all .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: Here , Scorsese turns his camera to the greed and avarice of the stock market boom of the late 80s that he sees in almost the same way as his great film Goodfellas , with a kid from the middle class who finds a short - route to riches and unapologetically enjoys the anything - goes lifestyle .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: He wants anything and everything and gets it , no matter what .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: Then , as Scorsese"s subjects always do , must suffer for it .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: Jordan races through life as fast as he can , acquiring anything and everything he can get his hands on .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: Anything ? How about his own yacht with a helipad ? Of course , you"ll need a helicopter to go along with it .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: Like Goodfellas , which followed the personal real - life story of an outsider into the world of New York gangsters , The Wolf of Wall Street follows the rise and fall of Jordan Belfort , who narrates his own story with the energy of a runaway bullet train .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: At 22 , he is a nice kid from the middle class who gets a job with a legendary Wall Street firm L. J. Rothchild under the tutelage of Mark Hanna ( Matthew McConaughey ) a wiry drug - addict who not only trains the kid ,

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: but lets him in on the secrets of quick success .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: " The name of the game , " he tells Jordan , " is moving the money from the client"s pocket to your pocket .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: " This is a mantra that Jordan takes to heart , even if the client doesn"t make a dime .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: Then , only weeks after getting the job , Rothchild hits a brick wall on October 19th , 1987 – Black Monday – forcing the grand old lady to close its doors after 90 years .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: Without a job , he starts from the bottom at the only firm that will hire him – a meager penny - stock firm that works out of an auto parts garage .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: Jordan makes himself a superstar by proving how easy it is to scam the client to make money fast .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: He takes over the business , building it from penny stocks to Blue Chips to IPOs born on the backs of screwing their clients .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: He finds a small patch of money hungry brokers ready to follow his lead .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: Most visible is a pudgy Jewish kid named Donnie ( Jonah Hill ) who is a glutinous yin to Jordan"s yang , an otherwise nice Jewish kid who throws off that moniker by dressing as WASP - like as he can .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: In no time Jordan has turned the tiny boiler room brokerage firm into Stratton Oakmont , an operation built on crooked investments from which flows money , money , money leading to mountains of drugs , rooms full of naked women , and every expensive toy under the sun .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: He feels guilty about nothing , taking Gordon Gekko"s mantra of " Greed is Good "

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: and making it into a religious sacrament .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: Jordan is a modern - day Caligula , a Roman Emperor who makes no apologies for his gross avarice , his drug addiction , his sex addiction or any other morally reprehensible machination that allowed him to get it .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: In no time at all he has be biggest house , the biggest boat , the best sports car , the fastest plane , and mounds and mounds of drugs .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: He even trades in his supportive wife ( " How I Met Your Mother""s Cristin Milioti ) for a gorgeous blonde trophy wife ( Naomi Robbie ) .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: In our minds , possibly not to Jordan , there always hands the dread that the party will come to an end . We feel that ,

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: but the movie always sees Jordan skirt disaster , especially late in the film when he desperately needs to get to Switzerland and takes his own boat instead of a plane .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: The plane explodes in mid - air

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: and Jordan comes to believe that he may be invincible .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: We feel that too , even when a boy scout FBI agent ( Kyle Chandler ) start snooping around Jordan"s books .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: The scene at sea , incidentally , is a not - so - thinly veiled call - back to DiCaprio"s role in Titanic when his boat is caught in a violent storm

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: and it looks like The King of the World won"t make it out of this one either .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: The rhythm is familiar to anyone who has seen Scorsese"s films before , what is amazing is that it"s always infectious .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: What Jordan and Donnie are doing is morally reprehensible ,

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: but there is something attractive about their behavior that makes us privately hope that they won"t get caught .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: In our own way we like these guys ,

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: and that may come from our familiarity with their other films .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: DiCaprio , in particular , gives his best performance , throwing away his good - guy image as a man who lives by appetite alone .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: There are notes here that DiCaprio has never been able to display .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: He isn"t afraid to look like a jerk .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: Here he is able to display his talent for slapstick in a scene in which Jordan ingests a 15 year - old Quaalude that sends his body into a fit very close to cerebral palsy .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: That"s no good when he desperately needs to get to his car to stop Donnie from making a fatal mistake .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: What is surprising is that this scene is played for laughs

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: and it works ! The energy is charged by the pacing and by DiCaprio"s narration .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: This is a raunchy , messy , exciting film about one guy who desires everything and gets it .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: If it seems a bit too long , that"s only because it is playing to the theme of wretched excess .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: The end of the film sends Jordan on a toboggan slide that seems somewhat inevitable , causing his reign as king of the world to end with a whimper instead of a bang .

title: Scorsese follows the pursuit of carnal appitites . . .
review: Does he learn a lesson from all his sins ? What do you think ? * * * * ( of four )

title: Elite balance
review: To work in a world financial center and at a high price , you must be energetic , understand the overall situation and manage every detail .

title: Elite balance
review: The money you handle every day ranges from millions of dollars to more than hundreds of millions of dollars .

title: Elite balance
review: You must also be proficient in various trends , various model predictions , various legal regulations ... Such high - intensity and high - pressure work requires everyone to devote themselves to it .

title: Elite balance
review: When working , everyone must lower their emotional level

title: Elite balance
review: and carefully study every detail .

title: Elite balance
review: However , the body and spirit are always in a state of hyperactivity ,

title: Elite balance
review: but the mood is low .

title: Elite balance
review: Therefore , every elite must learn to balance and do things that can easily release stress : flying a plane , drinking alcohol , looking for prostitutes , taking medicine , and throwing money .

review: Of course , maybe not everyone will do everything to promote the release of dopamine .

title: Elite balance
review: Many people will set up a self - discipline plan for themselves ,

review: and can"t stick to it for a few days , even if they can get the expected benefits from those things , such as getting positive feedback such as better results .

title: Elite balance
review: However , the average person can"t hold on for long .

review: Because the road to self - discipline and the end point have to be happy to be long , no one can avoid the simple road of dopamine .

review: Your desire is very strong , you want to get a lot of money , get a high reputation , get a lot of power .

review: At the same time , you are energetic and clear - minded .

title: Elite balance

review: Congratulations , depression will visit you sooner or later .

title: Money is the Ultimate Drug
review: TWWS is based on the true story of Jordan Belfort , played by Leonardo DiCaprio a broker who made a fortune selling penny stocks , which are stocks sold for companies so far down on the corporate food chain that they can not get listed on the stock market .

title: Money is the Ultimate Drug
review: These stocks are appealing to a man who is as addicted to money as Belfort is , as they bring the prize of a fifty percent commission , though it comes at the expense of people who maybe can not afford it as much as the more well - heeled whales of Wall Street .

title: Money is the Ultimate Drug
review: Along with his right hand man , Donnie played by Jonah Hill , Belfort makes a killing

title: Money is the Ultimate Drug
review: and lives the life of debauchery that his wealth affords him , which includes drugs , boats , houses , cars , and of course , women .

title: Money is the Ultimate Drug
review: His long rise and subsequent downfall at the hands of a dogged federal investigator , played by Kyle Chandler form the narrative arc of the film , which is fairly profanity laced and full of sex and rampant drug use .

review: The performances from Leo and Jonah are excellent ,

review: and it is good to see Dicaprio finally in a movie where he actually escapes a sinking ship .

title: Money is the Ultimate Drug
review: Belfort is an addict .
