title: Powerhouse Movie from De Caprio and Scorsese !!!!!
review: Martin Scorsese has always had an obsession with Robert De Niro initially as they have done 8 movies together

title: Powerhouse Movie from De Caprio and Scorsese !!!!!
review: and now the same continues with Leonardo Di Caprio , with the recent outing The Wolf of Wall Street being the fifth collaboration of Scorsese and Di Caprio .

title: Powerhouse Movie from De Caprio and Scorsese !!!!!
review: Scorsese"s movies always have adapted the Narrative Style Screenplay maximum rather the Linear Screenplay where either the Protagonist or any other character associated to the story begins the narration .

title: Powerhouse Movie from De Caprio and Scorsese !!!!!
review: Raging Bull ( 1980 ) , GoodFellas ( 1990 ) , Casino ( 1995 ) and The Wolf of Wall Street ( 2013 ) come under the Narrative Style Screenplay category .

title: Powerhouse Movie from De Caprio and Scorsese !!!!!
review: To begin with , The Wolf of Wall Street ( 2013 ) is based on the true life incidents of Jordan Belfort , a New York stockbroker who comes to Wall Street in aim of making it big with money and finally ends traveling in path of greed and lust while creating his own stock broking company using all fraudulent methods to make quick money .

title: Powerhouse Movie from De Caprio and Scorsese !!!!!
review: This movie narrates his story of rise , downfall and salvation for his crimes .

title: Powerhouse Movie from De Caprio and Scorsese !!!!!
review: The biggest USP of this movie is its protagonist Leonardo Di Caprio who has not only acted ,

title: Powerhouse Movie from De Caprio and Scorsese !!!!!
review: but lived the character of Jordan Bel fort in the movie and has completely shouldered the movie with his charismatic and riveting performance .

title: Powerhouse Movie from De Caprio and Scorsese !!!!!
review: His character is portrayed with sheer finesse from the scene where Jordan begins the narration of this story to the last scene where he begins his reformation .

title: Powerhouse Movie from De Caprio and Scorsese !!!!!
review: The scenes where Jordan first tricks a customer to invest for a fake company , the way he trains his new recruits on how to defraud the customers into investing to rob of their money and notably the complete scene sequence where the highly drugged Jordan reaches to his come from the country club to avoid getting caught by the police have been stunningly enacted by De Caprio , making this his career best performance .

title: Powerhouse Movie from De Caprio and Scorsese !!!!!

title: Excess vs. Access
review: The Wolf of Wall Street is funny , coming from the much respected Martin Scorsese , a director I appreciate more and more as I get older it comes as a bit of a surprise .

title: Excess vs. Access
review: It"s never meant to be taken too seriously , so if you"re in the mood for something heavy and dark in subject matter and mixed with equal parts laughs humour , I have 3 hours for you to spend at the cinema .

title: Excess vs. Access
review: It doesn"t really deserve any Oscar consideration ( not that it matters ) ,

title: Excess vs. Access
review: but it is a very well made film that will continue to exist , so you might as well sit down and enjoy it before it gets shoved in your face by the end of awards season .

title: Excess vs. Access
review: Leonardo DiCaprio gives a wonderfully physical performance that is a lot more over the top than anything he"s done before , you still never forget you"re watching DiCaprio , as is with Jonah Hill ,

title: Excess vs. Access
review: but because their off- screen chemistry comes together on - screen there are no complaints in the acting category , though a nice bit of observation .

title: Excess vs. Access
review: In playing Jordan Belfort in his 24 - 36 year old period , it feels like the first time the baby - faced actor is playing too young .

title: Excess vs. Access
review: The Hollywood golden boy is finally showing physical signs of having grown up .

title: Excess vs. Access
review: This isn"t something I"d dock the movie for , rather I see it as a positive indicator for DiCaprio"s career arc .

title: Excess vs. Access
review: The only major complaint I would have about the film overall is that in being 3 hours of self - indulgence , and Scorsese and company being very aware of the themes of excess running throughout Jordan Belfort"s life , the film almost doesn"t feel worth the time the audience spends involved .

title: Excess vs. Access
review: It"s a filmmaking paradox , which means it achieves it own means sometimes at the audiences " expense .

title: Excess vs. Access
review: This in turn is a major crime , that like the whole of the film and point of it , doesn"t prove to be a major consequence . Rating : B/ +2

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: In 1987 , Jordan Belfort ( Leonardo DiCaprio ) procures a job as a Wall Street stockbroker for L. F. Rothschild , employed under Mark Hanna ( Matthew McConaughey ) , who quickly entices him with the sex and drugs - fueled stockbroker culture and teaches him that a stockbroker"s only job is to make money for himself .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: Jordan soon finds his career terminated following Black Monday ,

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: and takes a job at a boiler room brokerage firm on Long Island that specializes in penny stocks .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: Thanks to his aggressive pitching style and the high commissions , Jordan makes a small fortune .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: Jordan befriends his apartment neighbor Donnie Azoff ( Jonah Hill ) ,

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: and the two found their own company .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: They recruit several of Jordan"s friends , whom Jordan trains in the art of the " hard sell " .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: The basic method of the firm is a pump and dump scam .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: To cloak this , Jordan gives the firm the respectable name of " Stratton Oakmont " .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: After an exposé in Forbes , hundreds of ambitious young financiers flock to his company .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: Jordan becomes immensely successful , and slides into a decadent lifestyle of prostitutes and drugs .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: He has an affair with a woman named Naomi Lapaglia ( Margot Robbie ) .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: When his wife Teresa ( Cristin Milioti ) finds out , they divorce

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: and he marries Naomi , soon having a daughter , Skylar .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: Meanwhile , the U. S. Securities and Exchange Commission and the FBI begin investigating Stratton Oakmont .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: Jordan illegally makes $ 22 million in three hours upon securing the IPO of Steve Madden .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: This brings him and his firm to the attention of the FBI , mainly agent Patrick Denham ( Kyle Chandler ) .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: To hide his illegitimate money , Jordan opens a Swiss bank account with corrupt banker Jean - Jacques Saurel ( Jean Dujardin ) in the name of Naomi"s aunt Emma ( Joanna Lumley ) , who is a British national and thus outside the reach of American authorities .

title: Entertaining black comedy
review: He uses the wife and in- laws of his friend Brad Bodnick ( Jon Bernthal ) , who have European passports , to smuggle the cash into Switzerland .

title: DId I miss the 90s?
review: In the latest collaboration between Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio ( still with no love from the Academy ) , we get a glimpse into the world of high finance , high living , greed , decadence and corruption in the Wall Street of the 1980s .

title: DId I miss the 90s?
review: With Mr. Scorsese"s usual excellent direction and Mr. DiCaprio"s charisma , the 3 hour movie never pauses for a moment or allows the viewer to become bored .

title: DId I miss the 90s?
review: The plot is straight - forward without any surprises

title: DId I miss the 90s?
review: yet remains interesting on the sheer power of the director and the star .

title: DId I miss the 90s?
review: Jordan Belfort ( DiCaprio ) starts as a straight - laced , young Wall Street broker eager for the things only money can buy .

title: DId I miss the 90s?
review: But after being laid off following Black Monday , Belfort learns about the world of finance removed from the glitzy world of Wall Street .

title: DId I miss the 90s?
review: Learning to take advantage of his salesmanship skills and the ignorance of the general populace ( as well as the undermanned regulatory agencies ) , Belfort amasses a huge fortune illegally which he spends visibly

title: DId I miss the 90s?
review: and without restraint on drugs and women .

title: DId I miss the 90s?
review: When finally cornered by the FBI on his illegal activities , Belfort first chooses to fight before finally facing the reality that all is lost .

title: DId I miss the 90s?
review: The movie fully earns its R Rating for the record - setting number of F - bombs , as well as rampant drug use and graphic scenes throughout .

review: but soon the authorities become aware of his illegal activities .

review: but if you can look past its lack of taste , it"s a relentless , ruthlessly effective and devilishly demented black comedy which is less a movie , more a machine gun helicopter blasting its way through every tasteful movie studio around .

review: Disregarding a short running time , a restraint on unnecessary scenes and examinations of the consequences maybe wasn"t the best idea ,

review: and there"s not an arbitrary shot to be found .

review: In terms of scripting , despite having over 500 uses of the F word it never feels gratuitous ,

title: A flawed but marvelous explosion of incredible insanity

review: It dips after the halfway point before finding its feet again ,

review: Even so , this is one of 2013"s finest

title: A comedy of the highest order
review: It"s safe to assume that you haven"t seen anything like The Wolf of Wall Street before , Martin Scorsese"s epic adaptation of Jordan Belfort"s true life tale that you could literally call Wall Street on Crack .

title: A comedy of the highest order
review: That we haven"t seen anything like this before is a sure tell sign that what Scorsese and his leading man Leonardo DiCaprio have created is a black comedy unlike any other , a movie that brims with cracking dialogue and therefore acts as a stunning tale of greed , lust , drugs and excess .

title: A comedy of the highest order
review: Directing a script written by key Boardwalk Empire collaborator Terrence Winter , WOWS sees Scorsese on a level we have arguably never seen him on before .

title: A comedy of the highest order

title: A comedy of the highest order

title: The heart of brightness
review: Trust and integrity : These are the values a TV commercial proclaims with which The Wolf of Wall Street opens , presenting a brokerage firm as a hard - working , serious , honest service provider for those who want to invest their money in an efficient and successful way .

title: The heart of brightness
review: Once the commercial ends , we get a glimpse into the company as it is : the scene opens to a raucous office hosting an orgiastic party complete with dwarf tossing , sex , alcohol and more than enough drugs to last a lifetime .

title: The heart of brightness
review: Based on the true story of fraudulent stock broker Jordan Belfort , the film dives deeply into the heart of what is wrong with an economy that has embraced greed as a key component of the way it works .

title: The heart of brightness
review: Where J. C. Chandon"s Margin Call was a cool analysis of the workings of a system that is based on no substance whatsoever and Oliver Stone"s second incarnation of Wall Street is a thriller depicting the workings of personal greed , Martin Scorsese presents the economy of greed as an orgiastic and never - ending feast that devours everything else , in which money is the drug of drugs and is equivalent with success , sex , life .

title: The heart of brightness
review: A parallel world following its own rules and totally disconnected with the outside world it so drastically affects .

title: The heart of brightness
review: As in his classic gangster tales , Scorsese chooses the inside perspective .

title: The heart of brightness
review: And so we watch Belfort ( Leonardo DiCaprio in an earth- shattering performance ) as he rises from small Wall street apprentice , mentored by a slick and yet charming veteran broker ( perfect cliché and compelling personality : Matthew McConaughey ) , to the master of stock fraud , committed entirely to his firm"s – and his own – prosperity , which he achieves mostly by duping investors into deals that can only have one winner : Belfort and his posse .

title: The heart of brightness
review: The film"s most disturbing aspect is how it commits itself to following the special logic on which this world is turning .

title: The heart of brightness
review: Drawn into the vortex of success and admiring the brilliant strategy Belfort follows , the viewer only gradually understands that there is world outside , full of defrauded clients who lose their mortgages , their children"s college money , their homes , their livelihoods , They never appear ,

title: The heart of brightness
review: yet the longer the film continues , the more their presents is felt , the more they weigh on the glamorous world of eternal success .

title: The heart of brightness
review: A world that Scorsese paints in the brightest colors : The Wolf of Wall Street is an orgiastic film portraying an orgiastic universe in which money is everything .

title: The heart of brightness
review: Whether it is wild partying , boundless sex , limitless drug use or the everyday work at the office : this is a life on speed , fast - paced , constantly seeking out extreme , a permanent high which can not afford a coming down .

title: The heart of brightness
review: All is one , whether the brokers frantically call their " clients " , whether they have a totally out of control orgy on a plane , discuss " dwarf tossing " in the most cynical way imaginable or turn the serious business of how to get their money abroad into a sex - filled extravaganza : sex , money , " love " , drugs are all part of the same permanent rush that allows for no other reality than the one they have created themselves .

title: The heart of brightness
review: Apart from DiCaprio who delivers the performance of his life , Jonah Hill impresses as Belfort"s even more out of control sidekick , a virtuoso of everything extreme .

title: The heart of brightness
review: There are no morals in this world

title: The heart of brightness
review: and there can not be any , only one easy answer : money is everything .

title: The heart of brightness
review: Scorsese spares no details , the film is graphic

title: The heart of brightness
review: and at the same time way over the top .

title: The heart of brightness
review: The story - telling as well as the visuals occasionally have a comic book touch .

title: The heart of brightness
review: Realism isn"t Scorsese"s goal , what he tries to achieve is to convey how it must feel to live inside this bubble .

title: The heart of brightness
review: This includes the danger of making it feel desirable : a trap Scorsese skillfully plays with and avoids .

title: The heart of brightness
review: The more the spiral spins , the more grotesque this world becomes , the more that initial fascination is replaced with unease and ultimately disgust .

title: The heart of brightness
review: The turning point is a long scene in which DiCaprio and Hill , looking for the ultimate high , descend into a hell of crawling , mumbling and completely spinning out of any remnants of self - control , a long scene lasting several minutes that will enter film history as the most uncompromising as well as imaginative and equally comical as well as devastating depiction of a drug - induced state of mind ever .

title: The heart of brightness
review: From here , it"s downhill

title: The heart of brightness
review: but Scorsese is smart enough not to gives us a happy or even moral ending .

title: The heart of brightness
review: Despite going to jail for a few years , his Belfort is on top of the world again as a highly successful author and motivational speakers , once again pulling his old tricks .

title: The heart of brightness
review: The film ends with Belfort"s apparent nemesis , FBI agent Denham ( Kyle Chandler ) riding a New York City subway train , a dreary and totally unglamorous scene with no sense of triumph or satisfaction .

title: The heart of brightness
review: The order has been restored , the gamblers rule

title: The heart of brightness
review: and justice is little more than a drop in the ocean , with no effect or long - term consequence .

title: The heart of brightness
review: The Wolf of Wall Street is a crazily funny comedy that ends on a quiet and bitter note , a wildly colorful yet deeply honest film that beneath the craze and behind the parallel universe it depicts conceals a stark reality that presents itself even more strongly in its absence .

review: Very likely being an avid follower of Martin Scorsese"s works and even more likely to be particularly fanatical about his most accessible and recent films , you were right in expecting a total reflection of the GoodFellas / Casino formula and style --- machine gun cutting , swooping camera , characters bursting through the fourth wall like wrecking balls , monster production scope and a soundtrack like a jukebox on speed , all to get us high on our complicity in the excessive debauchery of the characters and their fast - paced lifestyle ---

review: Money here is not just the root of all evil .

title: Quaalude Overdoses and Midget-Throwing: A Martin Scorsese Picture
review: It"s the total disintegration of any and all traces of decency , at the throbbing heart of which is DiCaprio"s character , Jordan Belfort , a real - life stock trader so outrageously shameless and blind to his routine corruption that he virtually appears to be sympathetic , even chivalrous .

title: Quaalude Overdoses and Midget-Throwing: A Martin Scorsese Picture
review: Belfort couldn"t care less whether his clients made money , so long as his share was complete .

review: And like the oligarchs running the country now , his forte was defrauding the the struggling working man who he jockeyed into investing in third - rate penny stocks .

review: Even his sweet first wife is feeling enough to wonder why he marks people who can"t afford to be conned .

review: Her civility gets in his way and she"s promptly usurped by a blonde lingerie model .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: The story Martin Scorsese tells in The Wolf of Wall Street is classic Americana : a social climber , Jordan Belfort , strikes it rich by taking H. L. Mencken"s advice , " Nobody ever went broke underestimating the intelligence of the American people .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: " Belfort gets rich by selling penny stocks to people who don"t know any better , then gets ever richer by selling them to people who should know better ,

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: but as they say on Wall Street , " You can"t make money investing in what you should .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: " And making money is the name of the game and it"s the only game ion town .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: Here"s to you , unscrupulous scumbags ! Wolf is all about excess .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: Cocaine by the pound snorted , quaaludes by the carton popped , prostitutes by the score banged , Cristal by the case spilled , money in the millions squandered , and scenes of indescribable decadence are all part of the Scorsese palate in creating Wolf .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: And it"s almost three hours long .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: Shortly after it was released , the daughter of one of the con men depicted in the movie wrote an open letter to Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio , telling them what scum they are for making a movie that praises the lifestyle of people who have destroyed lives with no more thought than killing a bug .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: She tells them that she is officially turning over to them the shame she has felt for years at being this guy"s daughter .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: Actually Scorsese and his writer , Terence Winter , just depict - and not necessarily praise - the lives of these lowlifes ;

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: but showing lowlifes getting extremely rich while defrauding people

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: and living the life of the rich and fatuous is as close to praise as you can get in this country .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: Who"s the hero ? The problem of portraying evil without making it look appealing dates back to the the birth of western literature .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: No less a writer than John Milton struggled with the problem in his magnum opus , Paradise Lost .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: All the critics agree that the most interesting character in Milton"s tale of good versus evil is , well , evil , as personified by the mother of all evildoers , the devil himself , Lucifer .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: Everybody prefers Mr. Hyde to Dr. Jekyll .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: The history of the movies is studded with blockbuster hits about bad guys whose lives are full of violence , greed , addiction , and that fourth horseman of modern depravity , casual sex .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: The problem is that from Valentino"s Sheik - he kidnaps the woman he wants - to Jordan Belfort , movies make heroes of the bad guys they portray .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: And no matter how hard a filmmaker tries to show us how bad a guy is , audiences love them .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: Take The Godfather .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: Francis Ford Coppola shows the transformation of Michael Corleone from a WWII hero who wants nothing to do with the family business of crime and punishment to the most ruthless mafia don in America .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: I saw the movie shortly after it came out at the long - gone Fox movie palace on 16th and Market in Philadelphia .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: The culminating scene in the movie is a now - classic montage : Michael acts as the godfather to his nephew ( whose father he soon will have garroted ) , renouncing the devil .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS
review: This scene is cut together with scenes where Michael"s henchmen murder his rivals .

title: RATHER SING WITH THE SINNERS

review: but man the guy really can act ! Matthew McConaughey , while not in the movie much , makes a memorable appearance earlier on in the film .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: All of the other actors do a really good job ,

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: and that largely has to do with the script by Terrence Winter ( " Sopranos " ) .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: This is easily the best written movie of 2013 ,

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: and while one could certainly detract it for its 500 + f - bombs , it has some of the best and most memorable lines to come out of a movie this year .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: And of course we can"t forget to give Martin Scorsese his due .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: We all know he"s a talented director .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: He"s made classics , and this could easily become of his classics .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: This could easily fit in with something like Goodfellas and Casino ,

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: and is very similar in content and in style .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: It fits perfectly with all of his filmography .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: I also have to give props to the editing and the visual effects team .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: The editing and cinematography looks incredible , as it always is with Scorsese and how he puts his movies together .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: But I was really surprised when I found out how much of this movie was actually CGI .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: There are a lot of locations and sections that we see in the movie that are completely computer - generated ,

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: and you don"t even realize it .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: So props to the team in charge of that .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: In the end , The Wolf Of Wall Street may be graphic , sometimes almost to a fault ,

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: but ultimately does a great job at depicting this real life event as well being another welcome addition to the Scorsese catalog .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: My only complaint is that it may have run a little too long at times ,

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: but there"s nothing in here that needs to be taken out in order to make a much better film , and it"s already fantastic the way it is .

title: Human Depravity In Its Most Delightful Form
review: So if you like Scorsese and don"t mind a lot of sex , drugs , and swearing , pick this one up .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: The greatest thing about this addictive , chaotic , machismo piece of beefcake movie magic , would have to be Scorsese"s ability to slow down where it hurts ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: and show big moments in really long scenes .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: The life of Jordan Belfort is portrayed as a mélange of orgies , parties , business dealings , extortion , pure crime , and unabashed and unapologetic decadence .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Even from the start of the film Belfort is unapologetic , which may be the true theme of the entire film .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Though he feels neglectful of his family , irresponsible in his business dealings , and drug addled to the point of insanity , in the end he really feels unapologetic .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Having a character like this is refreshing , since we haven"t seen this level of criminality since Gordon Gekko .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Not only is Belfort uncaring ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: but he traverses in a world of richness and depravity that we couldn"t even handle .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Scorsese takes his time , and creates big , beautiful set pieces , that take a lot of time and explain very little in terms of plot .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: These scenes are amazingly intricate and are some of the most memorable moments of the film .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: The entire sequence when Belfort ( DiCaprio ) is on lemons and has to make it home from the country club , could have been trimmed ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: but because Scorsese let it go on and on we got to appreciate the level of helplessness Belfort was going through .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: We saw his immaturity , his guilt , and his horror at the state of his life ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: and that can"t be replicated in any one line of dialogue .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: The scene where they"re speaking about the contract with the dwarfs and how they should have been treated , could have been cut easily ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: but it shows how Belfort and his associates treated those they could buy , and led to one of the funniest moments in the film .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: This film is downright hilarious at many points , especially when dealing in character development .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Jonah Hill deserved that Best Supporting Oscar nomination , because he not only handles diverse moments of dramatic tension ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: but he"s laugh out loud hilarious .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Donnie Azoff could not have been played by a funnier person , or a better actor ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: and every time he"s on screen it"s another chance for us to see just how removed from reality these people really are .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: There"s also a level of opulent violence that shifts underneath the surface that we don"t always see ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: but we know it"s there .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: While movies like " Scarface " put the prospect of violence in the forefront of your mind , " Wolf " builds its tension over time , until characters erupt .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: While Belfort may not be violent towards his wife throughout most of the film , he is emotionally abusive

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: and their fights are temperamental .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: It makes that much more sense when things become physical .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: There were some excellent performances from many of the cast , especially DiCaprio in the lead role .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: While many of DiCaprio"s roles kind of blend together for me , this was a truly unique , unequivocal performance .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Belfort"s brazen love for business , and building himself up to the highest level possible , is his undoing time and time again .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: He can"t walk away , even when he"s offered an out , only because of his pride .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Even today Belfort makes his money easily , with a level of persuasion that can only be portrayed by DiCaprio .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Hill is enigmatic and perfectly crazed as Azoff , Margot Robbie is a delight in her role as Belfort"s second wife Naomi , Matthew McConaughey is just the right level of kooky misanthrope as Belfort"s mentor in the beginning , Rob Reiner is perfect as Mad Max Belfort , a man who is always angry and always influenced by his son"s schemes ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: and Kyle Chandler is a surprisingly entertaining choice for the FBI agent who takes Belfort down , commanding his time on screen with a very complex and layered performance .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: This isn"t exactly a love letter to the world of Wall Street , or even to the lives of the rich and famous .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: We as the audience don"t want to see Belfort succeed or fail , we just want to see what he does next .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Belfort"s life is so chaotic and crazed that he seems unreal in such a huge sense .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Between the legions of hookers , the drugs , the money , and the antics of his entire office , the film plays more like the exploits Caligula than the playboy world of a charlatan like Belfort .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: For many , they found no insight into the moral capacity of the character .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Without morality critics decided that this was a hollow perspective intent on showing indulgence .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: I disagree heartily , and would argue that this is much more a character study than anything .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: There"s solid humor to this film , there"s a decent level of character development ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: and for what it"s worth , there doesn"t need to be a moral .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Scorsese shows us that these men exist ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: and they are getting away with everything , to the point where they can brag about it .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: Scorsese doesn"t want us aligning ourselves with the likes of Belfort ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: and he certainly isn"t legitimizing the exploits of his company .

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: He set out to make a " ferocious " film ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: and he did just that , creating a black comedy that shows what modern day indulgences look like ,

title: The Wolf Eats Well
review: and how they are being employed by everyone and anyone who can get their hands on their version of the American Dream .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET is insanely hyper - kinetic , wall - to - wall with sex and drug - taking , and the most energetic Scorsese has been since CASINO and GOODFELLAS .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: While this doesn"t quite live up to those previous films , it is nevertheless quite entertaining .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: The story follows the rise and fall of Jordan Belfort , who ran a brokerage firm , Stratton Oakmont , in the late 80"s / early 90"s .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: Along the way , he makes a ton of money

review: and indulges his every whim , which was mostly a lot of drugs .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: A smaller part of the story is how he was taken down by the FBI ,

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: but the main draw is obviously Jordan .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: In his previous gangster / crime films , Scorsese provided the viewer with a window into how those criminal enterprises operate ,

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: and he does the same here with white collar crime .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: One thing which was extremely effective , yet detracts from the experience a little bit , was how Scorsese used cinematic technique and a frenetic editing style to convey the themes of excess , over - indulgence and greed .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: It makes logical sense that a film about a person like Jordan Belfort would be this stuffed , even if it does start to wear on the viewer after a while ( as it certainly did me ) .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: Fortunately , there were some quieter moments , and scenes where a voice of reason could be heard , even if it was ultimately ignored .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: However , there should be something said about the end result .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: Unlike previous characters who were reduced to shells of their former selves , Jordan Belfort gets off fairly lightly .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: Sure , he goes to prison ,

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: but it"s a cushy prison and he only has to serve a few years .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: Perhaps this is cynicism on Scorsese"s part ,

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: and maybe it"s emblematic of where our society has gone .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: Instead of the ultimately good - natured criminal who looks out for the interests of a family - like organization , we have greedy vultures who only look out for themselves , and by and large we let them take advantage of us in ways that are truly despicable .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: The film makes a point about not showing the victims of Jordan"s crimes ,

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: but I didn"t find this too disheartening .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: The movie is meant to revolve around Jordan and to give the viewer an experience which approaches what his life was like .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: Sure , parts of it are extremely funny ,

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: but underneath all of the humor lies a rather masochistic current .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: Excess will ruin you , and by the end of this you should feel disgusted at how people are treated ( especially the women ) and exhausted from the whirlwind ride you"ve just been taken on .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: Even though the film does become repetitive after a while , I wouldn"t have wanted to be taken on this journey with anyone but Scorsese .

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: It"s not quite a masterpiece , or even top - tier Scorsese ,

title: Somewhat of a thematic retread, but Scorsese fires on all cylinders
review: but it"s a film worth watching even if only once .

title: A romp through the yard

review: Insofar as raw entertainment , acting prowess , cinematography this movie was top tier .

review: However it just doesn"t have the heart to measure up to it"s predecessors .

title: It's hard not to see the more outlandish behaviour that so much of the film dedicates itself to exposing as existing in a vacuum

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: " The Wolf of Wall Street " is Martin Scorsese at his most unrestrained .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: For a filmmaker no stranger to controversy , ( and often condemned for his depictions of violence ) it"s really saying something that this is his most lurid picture to date .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: That may be too mild a statement .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: Leonardo DiCaprio is Jordan Belfort , a married , seemingly idyllic New York stockbroker who takes a job with an established Wall Street firm .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: By chance , he is noticed by his Boss Mark Hanna ( Matthew McConaughey , in a memorable minor appearance ) who takes him under his wing and advises him to adopt a steady lifestyle of sex and drugs in order to succeed .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: Not before long , " Black Monday " hits , leaving Jordan without a job and with little options .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: His wife pressures him into taking a job with a small Long Island firm who"s penny stock dealings are of the shady variety .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: His aggressive knack for the scam amount him a fortune , and it"s not long before he along with new found friend and all - around oddball Donnie ( Jonah Hill ) open their own firm " Stratton Oakmont , " ambitiously scamming their way to the top .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: This soon gets the attention of Forbes ( who label Jordan The Wolf of Wall Street )

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: and inevitably the FBI .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: " The Wolf of Wall Street " is completely outrageous , hilarious , perverse , vulgar , and brilliant .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: In it"s three hours of ( mostly ) depravity , it gets away with things that R - rated films usually don"t or wouldn"t even try .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: But this is no mere waltz in exploitative muck .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: There"s a method to this madness sure ,

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: but a point as well .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: It"s an exquisitely naughty satire ... A send up that is to corporate and systemic corruption what " Taxi Driver " is to suppressed rage in the face of a collapsing infrastructure .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: The dark comedy of Terence Winter"s script effectively cutting just as deep as the rebel yell of Paul Schrader"s opus .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: Belfort is essentially a scumbag who embodies a lot of what"s wrong with the western world ( as does the film itself ) ,

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: but this degenerate provides the perfect vessel for what is arguably Leonardo DiCaprio"s best performance .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: The guy"s a marvel to watch .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: We should hate him ,

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: but we never do and attentively watch his unbelievable story unfold for 180 minutes .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: That"s a credit to DiCaprio"s endlessly likable presence and under - appreciated range .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: He balances the comedy , the dramatics , the intensity ; commanding the screen in a way few could .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: Look to the already classic , as well as horrifyingly hilarious " Quaaludes " scene ( THE scene of 2013 ) for definitive proof of his skill .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: Jonah Hill ( surprisingly Oscar nominated for his role ) is really strong here as is the pitch- perfect cast in it"s entirely , including Margot Robbie , Jon Bernthal , Rob Reiner , Jon Favreau , Jean Dujardin , and most notably Kyle Chandler who"s federal agent Denham emerges as our moral compass through the sleaze .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: " The Wolf of Wall Street , " a remarkable directorial achievement , is above all else a masterpiece of pacing .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: This is a three - hour epic ,

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: but you"d never know as it flies by like a picture half it"s length .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: The film maintains a sense of urgency so that even extended scenes are played snappy and breeze by .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: The film spits so much quick fire information that a mere bathroom break would throw a viewer so out of the loop that catching back up would feel impossible .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: It"s marvelous to behold how Scorsese is able to stuff every frame with so much detail and never have it overwhelm or feel like graphic overkill .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: Like " Goodfellas " and " Casino " we are more than happy to soak all of this in .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: Despite the potentially off - putting motivations and actions of these characters , Scorsese captures glimpses of humanity while entertaining the hell out of us at the same time .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: Comparisons made to " Goodfellas " and " Casino " should not only be acknowledged but welcome .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: Those are two of Marty"s very best films ,

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: and in time I have an inkling that " The Wolf of Wall Street " will be held in similarly high regard .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: Now the hot button issue .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: Is " Wolf " a celebratory picture glorifying a culture of corporate thievery , rampant carnality , and hardcore drug use ? Some might feel this way ,

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: but they have either been seduced by the events portrayed or have refused to read between the line ... Missing the entire point in the process .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: That"s not the fault of the film or it"s makers ,

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: but select audiences that consume entertainment at face value alone .

title: The Best Picture of 2013
review: For it"s incendiary screenplay , wicked sense of humor , on point performances , outstanding editing , and typically stellar direction from the master , " The Wolf of Wall Street " is frankly a phenomenal film that can"t be ignored .

review: It"s the fastest three - hours in the history of cinema .

review: " The wolf of Wall Street " is the best picture of 2013 .

title: An Excellent And Hilarious Black Comedy-Drama. Martin Scorsese And Leonardo DiCaprio At Their Best.
review: The Wolf Of Wall Street is an excellent and hilarious Black Comedy - Drama that combines amazing direction , a terrific cast , a wonderful script and a great soundtrack making The Wolf Wall Street Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio at their best .

title: An Excellent And Hilarious Black Comedy-Drama. Martin Scorsese And Leonardo DiCaprio At Their Best.
review: Based on the book of the same name and set in New York City during the 1980s and 90s , The Wolf Of Wall Street tells the story of Jordan Belford(Leonardo DiCaprio ) , a Wall Street stockbroker who forms his own stock company and becomes more successful and living a life of money , drugs and excess .

title: An Excellent And Hilarious Black Comedy-Drama. Martin Scorsese And Leonardo DiCaprio At Their Best.
review: But as Jordan"s life goes on he discovers that the F. B. I. And other forms of law enforcement are on his back which leads to Jordan"s rise and fall .

title: An Excellent And Hilarious Black Comedy-Drama. Martin Scorsese And Leonardo DiCaprio At Their Best.
review: Martin Scorsese"s The Wolf Of Wall Street is a brilliant , funny and over the top 3 - hour black Comedy - Drama

title: An Excellent And Hilarious Black Comedy-Drama. Martin Scorsese And Leonardo DiCaprio At Their Best.
review: and is not only another Scorsese classic but another amazing collaboration between Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio , it"s a movie that is darkly humorous , truly demented and insane and very amoral and also tests your morality to the point where you can"t take your eyes off the screen even if you want to .

title: An Excellent And Hilarious Black Comedy-Drama. Martin Scorsese And Leonardo DiCaprio At Their Best.
review: The Wolf Of Wall Street works not only as it"s own film but also a terrific companion piece to Scorsese"s Mob / Gangster classics Goodfellas and Casino in which The Wolf Of Wall Street are very similar to in style and storyline but whereas Goodfellas and Casino were about the violent lifestyles of Gangsters then The Wolf Of Wall Street is about the crazy lives of stockbrokers .

title: An Excellent And Hilarious Black Comedy-Drama. Martin Scorsese And Leonardo DiCaprio At Their Best.
review: Now , this isn"t the first time that Scorsese has done a Comedy because years before he also did underrated films such as The King Of Comedy(1983)and After Hours(1985)but Scorsese goes even further with WOWS creating a movie that is energetic and satirical that you never know what"s going to happen next with the story or it"s characters

title: An Excellent And Hilarious Black Comedy-Drama. Martin Scorsese And Leonardo DiCaprio At Their Best.
review: and the Comedy is wild , funny and takes on a surrealistic tone that as viewer when you watch this film you will wonder did some of the stuff in the film actually happen .

title: An Excellent And Hilarious Black Comedy-Drama. Martin Scorsese And Leonardo DiCaprio At Their Best.
review: WOWS is a movie that will divide viewers and critics because of the characters actions and the many scenes of sex and drug use(which got the film an NC-17 rating before it was given an R - rating)some will feel Scorsese is glamorizing the lifestyle in the film .

title: An Excellent And Hilarious Black Comedy-Drama. Martin Scorsese And Leonardo DiCaprio At Their Best.

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: Martin Scorsese is a rare director .

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: When it comes to overall filmography - quality , the guy lacks any middle - ground .

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: His praise is either rightly deserved or incredibly overrated .

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: MEANSTREETS , TAXI DRIVER , RAGING BULL , THE KING OF COMEDY , THE LAST TEMPTATION , GOODFELLAS and CASINO , are just a few of his deservedly high - praised features ; while GANGS OF NEW YORK , THE DEPARTED and SHUTTER ISLAND are all incredibly overrated .

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: Notice how the rightly praised films are all pre-1996 , while all his overrated films are post-1996 .

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: So , where , you might ask , does that leave THE WOLF OF WALL STREET ? It appears Scorsese has climbed his way out of a slump to create a highly realistic portrayal of Wall Street corruption , with this tale revolving mainly around security - fraud .

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: The memoir of the same name by Jordan Belfort ( played by DiCaprio ) was a huge inspiration to Ben Younger for his 2000 debut film BOILER ROOM , which is an excellent film in its own right starring late-1990s up - and - comers ,

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: but what WOLF delivers that BOILER ROOM lacks is what I"m coining as " genre gumbo"—and if you do yourself a favor

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: and watch WOLF , you"ll know exactly what I"m talking about not to say that you shouldn"t do yourself a second favor

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: and also watch BOILER ROOM .

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: Hilarious , cruel and intense ; WOLF OF WALL STREET is an epic that is in full - speed from the very first shot ,

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: and ceases to slow down until the end credits .

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: Easily Scorsese"s best in almost 20 years ! However , CASINO has had the privilege of having 19 - years to grow on viewers ; who knows what WOLF"s replay value could be for all we know , it could be the best thing Scorsese has done since RAGING BULL .

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: Only time will tell where it ranks on the Scorsese - classics ( definitely higher than lower on the impressively long list ) ;

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: but one thing is for certain , there is no denying it is an immediate classic and possibly the best film of 2013 .

title: Easily Scorsese's best in almost 20 years!
review: * * * * ( out of four )

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: From Oscar and BAFTA nominated director Martin Scorsese ( Taxi Driver , GoodFellas , The Departed ) , I saw the trailer for this film , although it looked interesting I wondered if I would really watch it ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: but of course I was going to when awards season came around , this got nominated a good number .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: Based on the autobiography of the real man , Jordan Belfort ( Golden Globe winning , Oscar and BAFTA nominated Leonardo DiCaprio , also producing ) started working on Wall Street as a stockbroker , he was barely into the job

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and the firm fails following Black Monday , but his boss Mark Hanna ( Matthew McConaughey ) advised him when he makes the money to take advantage of it , adopting a lifestyle full of casual sex , cocaine and other drugs when successful .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: The stockbrokers job market is in a poor state

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and Jordan is unemployed , so he takes a job in a Long Island boiler room dealing in penny stocks , encouraged by his wife Teresa Petrillo ( Cristin Milioti ) , he earns himself a small fortune with his aggressive pitching style and a high commission rate ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and he meets and befriends small businessman Donnie Azoff ( Oscar nominated Jonah Hill ) who is keen to work for him and make money .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: Jordan and Donnie go into business together , recruiting a number of friends , many dealing marijuana to help facilitation , they create Stratton Oakmont , Inc. The name may be respectable

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: but all runs on a pump and dump scam with customers on the telephone , and eventually Forbes magazine interviews Jordan , dubbing him the " Wolf of Wall Street " ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: but this pres works to the company"s advantage as hundreds of ambitious young financiers want to work for them .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: What follows is a lavish lifestyle filled with parties , sex and drugs , with Jordan hooked on sex with prostitutes , and an addiction to cocaine and hypnotic drugs ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: but Stratton Oakmont is under the watch of the FBI , and Agent Patrick Denham ( Super 8"s Kyle Chandler ) is investigating , with the Securities and Exchange Commission involved as well , and meanwhile after a meeting at one of his parties , and an affair , Jordan gets a divorce

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and marries Naomi Lapaglia ( About Time"s Margot Robbie ) ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and months later they have daughter Skylar .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: Securing the IPO ( Initial public offering ) of Steve Madden Ltd. Jordan makes an instant $ 22 million , he sees corrupt banker Jean Jacques Saurel ( The Artist"s Jean Dujardin )

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and opens a Swiss bank account to hide the money , under the name of Naomi"s British Aunt Emma ( Joanna Lumley ) ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and he eventually smuggles the cash into Switzerland , but the schemes are almost exposed following Donnie having a public fight courier Brad Bodnick ( Jon Bernthal ) who is arrested .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: A string of bad news is happening , Donnie gives Jordan a powerful brand of Quaaludes to ease the stress ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: but they take large doses as their potency seems to have worn off with age , and at the point he is receiving calls from his private investigator Bo Dietl , he wants to avoid being tapped and being arrested ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and at the wrong moment the drugs finally kick in , debilitated and driving he is too late to stop Donnie using the phone to Saurel , they have a bad fight , Donnie almost chokes on food , but Jordan uses coke to counteract the drug effect and save his life .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: Jordan"s father Max Belfort ( Rob Reiner ) knows the shadow of law enforcement is hanging over Stratton Oakmont , he convinces his son to step down and escape legal charges ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: but when he does arrange a leaving party he changes his mind and refuses to back down , encouraging all his staff to keep doing what they are doing , of course the heart attack death of Emma mean trouble , so to avoid passport stamping Jordan and Donnie sail to Monaco and Switzerland , only to have the yacht capsize in a violent storm ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and in the chaos Jordan sees their rescue plane explode because of a seagull flying into the engine , he sees this as God telling him to sober up .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: Two years pass , and during the filming of an infomercial Jordan is arrested by Denham , Saurel told the FBI everything ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: and is arrested in Florida for an unrelated charge , and meanwhile following one last night of sex with his wife , Naomi wants a divorce , and Jordan violently angry gets high on hidden cocaine and attempts to take his daughter away to stop her getting custody ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: but he only ends up crashing .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: With evidence against him overwhelming , to lessen his sentence Jordan agrees to help the FBI , so he goes to work wearing a wire ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: but they catch him out finding a silent note he showed Donnie telling him not to incriminate himself , Stratton Oakmont is raided and shut down , and Jordan is sent to a minimum security prison for 36 months , in the end , following his release Jordan made an innocent living teaching sales technique in seminars .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
review: Also starring Jon Favreau as Manny Riskin , P. J. Byrne as Nicky " Rugrat " Koskoff , Spike Jonze as Dwayne , Christine Ebersole as Leah Belfort , Brian Sacca as Robbie " Pinhead " Feinberg , Henry Zebrowski as Alden " Sea Otter " Kupferberg and Ethan Suplee as Toby Welch .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street

review: and of course illegal activities that really happened , it really is an exhilarating and interesting must see crime drama based on a true story .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: There"s a lot to look forward to in " The Wolf of Wall Street " : The Wolf of Wall Street is a dramatic comedy starring Leonardo DiCaprio as Jordan Belfort , a stock broker who is trying to make a name for himself on Wall Street .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: The screenplay was adapted from the memoirs of the real Jordan Belfort ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: and therefore the movie functions like a biography that satires many aspects of his life and behaviors , including his perceptions about society and business culture on Wall Street in particular .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: The movie is about Belfort"s opportunities for success on Wall Street being stripped away early in his career , only to find himself working for a firm selling penny stocks , and turning the unsuccessful boutique firm into a wildly successful corporation named Stratton Oakmont Inc. To make matters even more challenging for Belfort , his professional ambitions are coupled with drug and sex addictions .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: While Belfort has an extraordinary business mind , he is also unreliable , womanizing , and almost always intoxicated .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: The traditional idea of the American dream is not a satisfactory idea for him .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: His parents were accountants , and he was raised in a middle class family .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: Through investments , Belfort made tens of millions of dollars in his early twenties .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: He very much desired to be a member of the upper class .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: Therefore , he constantly strives to make himself successful financially .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: While financial success is a noble pursuit , Belfort"s behavior is irresponsible and reckless .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: Cocaine , prescription pills , non - prescription pills , prostitutes and a never ending supply of alcohol are the behaviors successful people should have according to Belfort .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: These behaviors created addictions within a flawed central character .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: Audiences learn very quickly that Belfort is far from a perfect man .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: They also learn how skillful he is in marketing and communication .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: Forbes Magazine publishes an article on Belfort and Stratton Oakmont Inc. , calling him " The Wolf of Wall Street " .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: The magazine article pinpointed that Belfort achieved financial success by misleading investors in order to receive the highest possible profits .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: Belfort is painted as the inverse of the famous character Robin Hood , where he is responsible for stealing from the poor and giving to the rich .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: Belfort is later held responsible for these practices throughout the film .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: The Wolf of Wall Street reveals Belfort"s aspirations , obstacles and relationships .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: The movie depicts the chronology of Belfort"s personal and business life .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: DiCaprio"s performance will receive nominations from multiple award programs in 2014 for its depth , versatility and quality .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: It is probably the most socially relevant film in the box office right now ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street Movie Review
review: and it reveals a lot about business culture on Wall Street and one"s personal struggle for success .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: The Wolf of Wall Street Review Scorsese"s The Wolf of Wall Street is probably one of the most gruesome yet enjoyable movies ever screened ; film critic Matt Zoller Seitz even said it was " one of the most entertaining films ever made about loathsome men " ( Seitz ) .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: That is the perfect quote to introduce what should be the general consensus for this movie : it was disturbingly fantastic .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: This movie contained a myriad of inappropriate scenes including drug use of a long lost drug ( now banned by the United States government ) called " Quaaludes " .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: Aside from the main characters Jordan Belfort and his friend Donnie popping Quaaludes almost every other scene , viewers also see the use of cocaine , alcohol consumption , prostitution , and explicit language .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: The movie probably goes a maximum of five minutes without seeing any one of those activities occur , which is why I use the word " disturbingly " to modify how fantastic the movie was .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: However , many people just saw the gruesome activities in the movie

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: and could not look past them and see the main details of the film .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: A lot of people bought tickets to The Wolf of Wall Street expecting something completely different than what they got .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: When they viewed the movie , it seems all they saw was the inappropriate drug use , prostitution , explicit language , etc .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: Lou Lumenick of the New York Post wrote " If you"re going to invest three hours watching a movie about a convicted stock swindler , it needs to be a whole lot more compelling than Martin Scorsese"s handsome , sporadically amusing and admittedly never boring — but also bloated , redundant , vulgar , shapeless and pointless — Wolf of Wall Street " ( Lumenick ) .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: Lumenick seems to represent a large consensus of average reviewers who thought The Wolf of Wall Street was overblown and redundant at most parts .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: But what these viewers failed to see in this movie was the fact that it is NOT about Wall Street alone .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: It is actually an account of the life of Jordan Belfort , who even wrote a book which was the inspiration for this movie .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: Belfort"s book described his life of lavish partying and addiction to Quaaludes , which was the inspiration for the heavy use of them in this movie .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: It is unfortunate many people can not see that the plot of this movie is centered on the man Jordan Belfort

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: and that they expect to see a more detailed account of what it is like to be a broker on Wall Street .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: Maybe they need to start being more realistic and stop judging books by their covers because The Wolf of Wall Street is much more than a nearly three hour fun - fest of drugs , sex , and swindling money from people .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: It is an actual account of the life of Jordan Belfort , whom Leonardo DiCaprio depicted beautifully .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: His acting was exquisite , and the style he did it with was beautiful .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: He acted with an intensity and passion that any DiCaprio fan would expect .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: But going back to the original point : despite being packed with all the gruesome activity , the movie was overall fascinating and well worth the 179 - minute viewing .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: Yes , it is quite long ,

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: but it is so detailed that it is nearly impossible to get bored at any point during the movie .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: The movie gets so detailed at certain points that viewers are able to delve into Belfort"s initial thoughts when he meets his good friend Donnie Azoff .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: The fact that the movie included the thoughts on Jordan regarding Donnie"s teeth is kind of incredible because it is an extreme type of detail which no other director would be able to make work .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: Scorsese"s work in this movie was top notch , comparable to many of his other highly regarded films , like Taxi Driver and Gangs of New York .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: yet it received several Oscar nominations .

review: So for those critics who disagree with Scorsese adding all the use of prostitution in The Wolf of Wall Street , just look back to Taxi Driver .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: He made it work then , and he has made it work again .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: So despite many people being so opposed to the highly inappropriate aspects of The Wolf of Wall Street , it is pretty obvious that all anyone has to do is look past the title of the movie and set real expectation for this movie .

title: Wolf of Wall Street was gruesome yet fantastic
review: From there , this movie is nothing but fantastic .

review: The Wolf of Wall Street deserves nothing but praise for its accurate depiction of Jordan Belfort"s life ,

title: "The Wolf of Wall Street'
review: The film also features Jonah Hill , Margot Robbie , Matthew McConaughey , Kyle Chandler , Rob Reiner , Jon Bernthal , Jon Favreau , and Jean Dujardin .

title: An awesome satirical film, a masterpiece of its own

review: The film glorifies the excessive lifestyle it depicts ,

title: An awesome satirical film, a masterpiece of its own

title: Biting Satire of Eighties Greed
review: Following a similar thematic path to WALL STREET or ( for older filmgoers ) OTHER PEOPLE"S MONEY , THE WOLF OF WALL STREET tells the story of Jordan Belfort ( Leonardo DiCaprio ) , whose spectacular rise to financial power and subsequent fall offers an object lesson in Eighties greed and rapacity .

title: Biting Satire of Eighties Greed
review: In terms of plot , Terence Winter"s screenplay contains the usual clichés associated with movies of this type : the emphasis on conspicuous consumption , the wanton disregard of Belfort and his fellow - stockbrokers for the feelings of those around them ; the brazen belief that the world is their oyster .

title: Biting Satire of Eighties Greed
review: It is the kind of world in which Michael Douglas"s Gordon Gekko would not seem out of place .

title: Biting Satire of Eighties Greed
review: Visually speaking , Martin Scorsese"s film is a treat : the cinematography by Rodrigo Prieto is stunning , with a series of fast cuts emphasizing the frenzied existence of those whose sole raison d"etre is the desire to make money .

title: Biting Satire of Eighties Greed
review: On the other hand , THE WOLF OF WALL STREET is far too long ; there are too many moments where the characters exchange dialog without advancing the plot .

title: Biting Satire of Eighties Greed
review: It is a genre film , to be sure ,

title: Biting Satire of Eighties Greed
review: but one that could have benefited from a more rigorous directorial hand .

title: Overlong but reasonably entertaining movie with Leonardo DiCaprio's manic performance on the loose.
review: After going 360 - degree with the unexpected children"s fantasy , HUGO in 2011 , it"s good to see director Martin Scorsese has finally back to his familiar R - rated territory with THE WOLF OF WALL STREET .

title: Overlong but reasonably entertaining movie with Leonardo DiCaprio's manic performance on the loose.
review: Already a highly controversial movie upon its release last Christmas in the US due to its boundaries - pushing R rating ( for the depiction of sex , drugs and profanity ) , it"s no surprise that THE WOLF OF WALL STREET failed to pass our local censorship board to be shown in Malaysian cinemas .

title: What A Hell Of A Ride!
review: The Wolf of Wall Street is a film directed by Martin Scorsese ,

title: What A Hell Of A Ride!
review: and stars Leonardo DiCaprio , Jonah Hill , Margot Robbie and Kyle Chandler , and revolves around the life of a man named Jordan Belfort , a charismatic stockbroker who turns his normal , everyday life into one of incredible riches , drugs and beautiful women , whilst engaging in illegal activities .

title: What A Hell Of A Ride!
review: Martin Scorsese ... God dammit , he"s a bloody incredible director ! I forget about him for a while ,

title: What A Hell Of A Ride!
review: and then every couple of years , he pops up again with another fantastic film ! The Wolf of Wall Street is one of his finest , boasting a fun and charismatic cast , a wonderful screenplay by the fabulous Terence Winter and an elaborate , irresistible story about greed , corruption and a whole heap of money ! Scorsese"s direction , in my mind , is what makes this movie brilliant .

title: What A Hell Of A Ride!

review: The camera never seems to cease in movement , giving this movie a life about it ,

title: What A Hell Of A Ride!
review: and making you feel like the party , the fun , never stops at any point .

review: Scorsese also allows a lot of long shots , which really add to the film .

title: What A Hell Of A Ride!
review: He gives DiCaprio time to shine as Belfort , as the camera rolls for seemingly endless periods of time without a cut .

review: Again , with any other director , these touches to this film could have been compromised , could have made the whole picture into a disaster .

title: Instant Classic
review: " The Wolf of Wall Street " is sure to be considered a classic in certain circles .

title: Instant Classic
review: This film will be quoted for decades to come just as some of Scorsese"s finer work is today with aficionados proudly displaying the blue - ray on their bookshelves next to their copies of " Scarface " and " Goodfellas " .

title: Instant Classic
review: Much like " Scarface " from Scorsese"s friend and fellow Movie Brat director Brian De Palma , the film is an exploration of the darker side of the American Dream .

title: Instant Classic
review: Also like Scarface it follows the rise and fall of an identifiably American icon ,

title: Instant Classic
review: and contains at least as much drugs , decadence and debauchery if not the violence .

title: Instant Classic
review: Leonardo DiCaprio and Jonah Hill produce outstandingly sketched and often hilarious characters

title: Instant Classic
review: and there is an extraordinary cameo from Matthew McConaughey who does his best sleaze - ball yet as DiCaprio"s degenerate mentor .

title: Instant Classic
review: The film is identifiably Scorsese with his trademarks all over it including his beautiful use of tracking shots .

title: Instant Classic
review: There are parts of the film with narrative structures resembling those from his other work such as " Goodfellas "

title: Instant Classic
review: and you feel that Scorsese is doing so intentionally with a wink before turning the outcome on its ear .

title: Instant Classic
review: Sitting beside me in the cinema was a well dressed woman in her mid-50"s who was clearly uncomfortable and did not find the things that the audience and I were laughing at funny at all .

title: Instant Classic
review: Those expecting an explicit left - wing screed on the evils of capitalism and cronyism ( as the title suggests it might be ) will be disappointed .

title: Instant Classic
review: Also disappointed will be those seeking out a neatly bundled morality play where equity and justice are clear characters .

title: Instant Classic
review: The film contains a lot of sex and " boys behaving badly "

title: Instant Classic
review: and is not necessarily fun all the family can enjoy .

title: Instant Classic
review: If you like " Scarface " and you like Scorsese"s work this is absolutely a must see .

title: An Epic Comedic Masterpiece
review: I don"t necessarily think that Scorsese"s " Wolf of Wall Street " is the best film he"s ever made , in fact , I"m sure plenty of cinephiles would jump down my throat for even suggesting that " Wolf " is better than " Goodfellas " ,

title: An Epic Comedic Masterpiece
review: but as far as personal preference goes , this is my favorite Scorsese film .

title: An Epic Comedic Masterpiece
review: All of Scorsese"s movies are incredibly watchable ; it"s just easy to throw one of his films on and get swept up in the world he creates for you , be it 1870s high society New York ( " The Age of Innocence " ) , the modern day crime - ridden streets Boston ( " The Departed " ) , or a Parisian train station in the 1930s ( " Hugo " ) .

title: An Epic Comedic Masterpiece
review: No matter what kind of film he makes , Scorsese brings his masterful direction to these stories in a way that simply brings those worlds to life ,

title: An Epic Comedic Masterpiece
review: and this film , " The Wolf of Wall Street " , is perhaps his most insane offering to date ; the parties Jordan Belfort hosts are wilder than those attended by Marcello Rubini ( " 8 Â½ " ) , he consumes more drugs than Hunter S. Thompson ( " Fear and Loathing and Las Vegas " ) , and he gets into more debauchery than Loki the God of Mischief , and those reasons are exactly why I love it as much as I do .

title: An Epic Comedic Masterpiece
review: If there is a film that better demonstrates the allure and destructive powers of wealth , greed , and excess , I don"t know what it is .

review: but it"s also one of his most epic and brutally honest .

title: Occasionally interesting chronicle of Wall Street scam artist's life ends up as a poor man's 'Good Fellas'
review: Still , Belfort"s antics are mildly interesting , especially in the first half hour , where in a series of flashbacks , we see how he lost his stock broker job on his very first day on Wall Street due to the stock market crash of 1987 .
