title: Be prepared to laugh, cringe and maybe even possibly relate to Scorsese's best since Goodfellas.
review: The Wolf of Wall Street seems to be pulling at the puppeteering strings of all those morally sanctimonious individuals – forming a congealed and sticky mass , due to a coma inducing , amorphous , undelineated and homogeneous group of " journalistic film critics , quasi - popularish movie bloggers and tag - along - z - list - quaver - pundits who forever dwell in the subterranean stratus - es of dreadful hum - dinging commercial televised - end - of - the - year - countdown shows with their overly practised ; overtly and irritatingly imprudent sound bites .

title: Be prepared to laugh, cringe and maybe even possibly relate to Scorsese's best since Goodfellas.
review: Yet , one can not help assuming that these are no doubt some of the same people who have decried annually at the unfathomable way in which Scorsese has been contemptuously and consistently robbed of the gloriously coveted award – the gold statuette : known as the Oscar .

title: Be prepared to laugh, cringe and maybe even possibly relate to Scorsese's best since Goodfellas.
review: Let"s be honest , the debates are merely being conjured for debatings sake , creating a major surge of overspilled gumph

title: Be prepared to laugh, cringe and maybe even possibly relate to Scorsese's best since Goodfellas.
review: and clogging up the over - saturated movie blogosphere , with nauseating shock factor reviews as opposed to integrity driven reviews .

title: Be prepared to laugh, cringe and maybe even possibly relate to Scorsese's best since Goodfellas.
review: Thus , even if some reviews generate controversy due to subjective but well - meaning reviewers ( the late Roger Ebert springs to mind ) , they do so with good intentions , as opposed to the quirks of gaining some extra traffic flow .

title: Be prepared to laugh, cringe and maybe even possibly relate to Scorsese's best since Goodfellas.
review: A self - fulfilling prophecy if you like ; as in , the more some of the controversial issues get covered in the media , the more others compete to give a worsening opinion for the battle of the more detestable .

title: Be prepared to laugh, cringe and maybe even possibly relate to Scorsese's best since Goodfellas.
review: Thus , by mere proxy , these battles unfortunately become embedded within the lay person"s general chit chat that generates naively negative " word - of - mouth " .

title: Be prepared to laugh, cringe and maybe even possibly relate to Scorsese's best since Goodfellas.
review: Luckily , with its second weekend drop of an impressive 28 % at the North American box office , it seems some films are impervious to the cheap tactics of following the leader with intent to trip them up and do one better ( or worse ) .

title: Be prepared to laugh, cringe and maybe even possibly relate to Scorsese's best since Goodfellas.

review: The man made famous for glorifying the mob moves over to Wall Street — Martin Scorsese"s latest , " The Wolf of Wall Street , " based on the memoir of crooked stockbroker millionaire Jordan Belfort , is a tale of excess : money , drugs , profanity , nudity , sex — even ( pardon the cliché ) rock " n roll , given the soundtrack .

title: Another triumph for DiCaprio and Scorsese
review: Leonardo DiCaprio gives arguably the best performance of his career in this Wall Street/ Goodfellas hybrid which looks at the life and exploits of Jordan Belfort , founder of Wall Street chop shop Stratton Oakmont , exploring the depths of his drug induced sexual depravity .

title: Another triumph for DiCaprio and Scorsese
review: DiCaprio narrates the film , which takes reasonable and necessary liberties with Belfort"s book of the same name , taking us through his initiation into the world of stock broking through a memorable , insane , conversation with senior broker Mark Hanna ( Matthew McConaughey ) , the 1987 stock market crash and his discovery of penny stocks , which give a far greater return to the broker than " blue Chip " stocks .

title: Another triumph for DiCaprio and Scorsese
review: He meets Donnie Azoff ( Jonah Hill , deliberately painful ) ,

title: Another triumph for DiCaprio and Scorsese
review: and starts his own firm , making a small fortune

title: Another triumph for DiCaprio and Scorsese
review: and drawing the attention of the SEC and FBI , who send Patrick Denman ( Kyle Chandler , outstanding ) to investigate , It is in this investigation , starting around the same time that Belfort meets his second wife Naomi ( Margot Robbie in a breakout role ) that the film really hits its straps .

title: Another triumph for DiCaprio and Scorsese
review: The scene with DiCaprio and Chandler on his luxury yacht is one of the great moments in cinema this decade ,

title: Another triumph for DiCaprio and Scorsese
review: and the iconic moments flow thick and fast from there .

title: Another triumph for DiCaprio and Scorsese
review: DiCaprio"s speeches on the chop shop floor , a darkly funny overdose scene , and deeply satisfying moments of comeuppance ( even though Belfort gets off very lightly ) .

title: Another triumph for DiCaprio and Scorsese
review: Scorsese resists , and in fact openly works against , the temptation to glorify Belfort or make him the hero of the piece , showing the full depths of his depravity and amoral nature and allowing DiCaprio to create a pathetic creature , selfish , greedy and destructive with few redeeming features

title: Another triumph for DiCaprio and Scorsese
review: but managing to be so charismatic you can"t turn away .

review: It is DiCaprio"s performance that allows Chandler to shine playing Belfort"s opposite .

title: from a Christian perspection
review: Directed by the famous Martin Scorsese , this film bears several of the director"s trademarks ,

title: from a Christian perspection
review: but somehow manages to make every one of the beloved traits burdensome to viewers .

title: from a Christian perspection
review: For example , Scorsese is well - known for his use of slow motion to emphasize the many aspects and emotions of particular circumstances .

title: from a Christian perspection
review: In this film , slow motion seems to only draw out this overly - lengthy , repetitive film .

title: from a Christian perspection
review: Another instance of tediously detailed and slow filming tactics can be found during a scene in which the two lead characters , Jordan and Donny , fight each other while so high that they can not even stand .

title: from a Christian perspection
review: It would seem that Scorsese , who is generally understood to have no real interest in accumulating money , wants viewers to be repulsed by the effects of greed and follow - up depravity .

title: from a Christian perspection
review: From the first ten minutes of the film , however , this goal is accomplished .

title: from a Christian perspection
review: That the audience must continue to be disgusted for nearly three more hours by the same decadent debauchery is most certainly overkill .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: STAR RATING : * * * * * Saturday Night * * * * Friday Night * * * Friday Morning * * Sunday Night * Monday Morning Jordan Belfort ( Leonardo DiCaprio ) is a young man determined to get ahead and live the high life come what may ,

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: and so he travels to Wall Street , the financial epicenter of the world in the 1980"s to make his mark .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: Treated like an underdog on his first day , he"s lucky to have financier extrordinarie Mark Hanna ( Matthew McConaughey ) spot his potential and take him under his wing , teaching him the key to success lies not in mere stocks and shares , but in selling investor"s worthless or inaccurate pieces of paper that you"ve convinced them will net them loads .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: After losing his job in the Black Monday crash of 1987 , he takes Hanna"s advice and hooks up with former toy store worker and neighbour Donnie ( Jonah Hill )

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: and , after assembling a seemingly no hope bunch of co conspirators , they set up their own company and before long have reached the top and engage in a life of none stop debauchery , decadence and excessiveness beyond most people"s wildest dreams , until FBI Agent Patrick Denham ( Kyle Chandler ) and his team start to dig in to whether Belfort"s practices are legal .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: Eager as he is to convey yet another tale of a morally skewered individual and their inherent rise and fall , Martin Scorsese has nevertheless taken rather a gamble in these financially destructive times by bringing this real life tale of Jordan Belfort , the wheeler and dealer to end all wheeler and dealers , to the big screen .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: In an age where there are those struggling even to keep a roof over their heads , seeing someone who indulged in such mind blowing greed and extravagance may be a tough pill for many to swallow .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: But it"s testament to his style and delivery that , while it can never really be said we come to like Belfort , something about his self belief and arrogant determination and indeed the have - everything world he creates makes him such an immorally appealing fellow that we never get to hate him either .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: If the richest people in the world really are just one per cent ,

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: and this is how they live , then it really isn"t much of a mystery how everything is so unevenly divided .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: Now quite rightly regarded as one of the finest actors of our generation , in a career with many high points , this is the role in which DiCaprio will surely leave his highest cultural mark in the world of cinema .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: He injects a manic intensity and ferociousness to Belfort that at times is simply magnetic , mesmerizing as he thunders like a lion across the screen , as a man whose wild arrogance , immorality and desperate zest for life literally charge him like a battery .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: It"s the finest role of his I"ve ever seen , and it"s a shame it seems he"s missed out on his Oscar for it , all I can say is whoever beat him must still be living their part now .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: But special mention must also be given to co star Hill , who I"ve only known for making well known comedies ,

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: but he seems to have taken DiCaprio"s lead and attempted to be as full on and direct as him , to very nearly as great effect .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: As a double act , they set the screen on fire in a way you couldn"t imagine .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: Also one not to forget is McConaughey , in what can only be about a ten minute role , who fills that brief time marvelously , espousing on to DiCaprio the self believing mantra that will transform him in to a God like figure in the boardroom , with a cult like audience in front of him .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: Scorsese seems wrapped up in the style of Goodfellas , with DiCaprio doing voice over for most of the film and sounding almost exactly like Ray Liotta from that film ,

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: and acting much like him too , both playing real life men who refused to be constrained by a life of mundanity and were willing to use illegal , immoral means to rise above it , climbing high

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: but falling that much harder due to their own lack of self control and addiction to risk .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: He occasionally veers away and talking directly to the camera just for that extra dramatic impact .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: With the Black Monday crash of " 87 being such a big event at the start of the film , it"s a wonder no reference is made to Michael Douglas in Wall Street since that film came out that year .

title: An electrifying central performance drives along a Scorsese masterpiece
review: TWOWS is just a superb effort in it"s own right , driven along by DiCaprio"s best ever performance and a startling view of how the other half live that will blow your mind . * * * * *

title: The corrupted American dream
review: The Wolf of Wallstreet depicts the life of Jordan Belfort ( DiCaprio ) , a stockbroker who corrupts or is corrupted by , depending on your viewpoint , the financial Valhalla that was Wall Street in the 1990s .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: As a young , ambitious broker in a major company , his youthful enthusiasm quickly develops into ruthless ambition , fuelled by his boss , a short but powerful role by Matthew McConaughey .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: The first half of the movie portrays Jordan in this transformation .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: All the remnants from his ordinary middle - class life , including his car , house and down - to - earth girlfriend , are promptly shed

title: The corrupted American dream
review: and replaced by the Wall Street equivalent , including the stunningly beautiful but opportunistic Naomi ( Margot Robbie ) .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: Jordan"s life appears to be fantastic , with more money than he can spend , despite all his efforts to that end , a family man by day and a young god with drugs , alcohol and prostitutes by ... Well , also by day .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: However , he is unable to control his never - ending greed and his high - speed life starts to spin out of control , until the bubble bursts and his empire crumbles before his eyes .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: The Wolf of Wallstreet is a rollercoster ride , in many ways analogous to Belforts life .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: The extravagant three hours of running time fly by , taking the viewer from New York halfway across the world to Italy

title: The corrupted American dream
review: and back , showing us all the riches and all the pitfalls of his decadent life .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: The question has been asked whether it is morally acceptable to sponsor this criminal , which Belfort undoubtedly is , by viewing his movie en masse .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: This is nonsense from a juridical point of view , since Belfort was convicted for his crimes

title: The corrupted American dream
review: and served his time , and he is allowed to return to society like any other convict , but moreover , it is not what this movie should be judged on .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: This movie shows us the temptation of unlimited wealth .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: Jordan"s life attracts and deters , invokes admiration and disgust .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: And it is not just the crooked soul of a lone Wolf .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: Even once ordinary people like Donnie Azoff , played by the excelling Jonah Hill , contribute to Belforts disgraceful excesses .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: Jordan"s philosophy is most strikingly characterized by an early scene in which we see him driving his flashy red car .

review: The car was white however , says Jordan"s voice - over ,

title: The corrupted American dream
review: and hence it promptly shifts colour .

title: The corrupted American dream
review: You can shape life , like you can shape the car .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Question . What is this film about ? Is it about greed , like the film Wall Street ? Is it about exuberance , like The Great Gatsby ? Is it about money , like Margin Call ? Is it about white collar crime , like The Thomas Crown Affair ? The way I see it , " The Wolf of Wall Street " is about conscience .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Or , to be more precise , about the absence of conscience .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Jordan Belfort doesn"t have a conscience .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: He is a ruthless manipulator , who doesn"t seem to care about others .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: He has no decency , no moral compass , no respect for anybody .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: He would be the perfect villain in any film .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: But in " The Wolf of Wall Street " he is not the villain , but the hero .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: He is the guy you love to hate .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Everyone secretly admires a person like Jordan Belfort .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Who wouldn"t want to give the rest of the world the finger ,

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: and just do whatever you feel like doing ? In Belfort"s case , that means getting filthy rich , by all means necessary .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: The stock broker you work for goes bankrupt ? You start your own brokerage .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: You find a woman who is more sexy than the one you"re married to ? You file for divorce .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: The FBI is investigating you ? You bribe them - or at least try to .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: And in the mean time , you are enjoying a life full of drugs , drink , women , fast cars and easy money .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Even if you wouldn"t want a life like that , it"s fun to watch .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Despite all their talk about " not glorifying Belfort " , there is no doubt that Scorsese and DiCaprio are doing just that .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Take the scene in the Investor"s Center , where Belfort calls a client and talks him into an investment in worthless penny stocks .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: The brokers around him fall silent , stand around in admiration and congratulate him on a great deal .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Belfort is not shown as a despicable human being ,

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: but as a smooth operator .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Even after he gets arrested and locked up , Scorsese shows him as a winner , playing tennis on the prison grounds

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: and talking about how even there money can buy you anything .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Of course , there is nothing wrong with that .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Movies glorifying criminals are usually great .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: " Bonnie and Clyde " is a great film .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: So is " Pulp Fiction " .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: And so is " Scarface " .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: They make the audience suspend their normal ethics about right and wrong .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: When Bonnie and Clyde are killed , you feel sorry for them , although you know they deserve it .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: The glorification of Jordan Belfort makes for a great film .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Both Scorsese and DiCaprio are outstanding .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: The film contains so many great scenes , I don"t know where to start .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: The restaurant scene ( " Do you jerk off ? " ) has the potential to become classic .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: So does the Steve Madden speech ( " We should all suck your dick " ) .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Also great is the Tarantino - esque conversation when Belfort teaches his friends how to sell stock ( " I"ve never seen a Buddhist Amish " ) .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: But the absolute showstopper is Belfort crawling on all fours , wrecking his Ferrari

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: and saving the life of his overdosed business partner .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: DiCaprio"s performance is so captivating , you almost forget to pay attention to the cinematographic abundance in this film .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Already in the first few minutes , Scorsese shows how movie - making is done .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: We see a commercial , we switch to reality , the motion stops , the image changes , we hear the lead character talking to the audience , a car changes colour - all in one fluent succession .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: The film continues that way .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Scorsese lets Belfort break the fourth wall by talking directly into the camera , he shows dazzling tracking shots through the trading room ,

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: and he even lets people think aloud .

title: Captivating performance and cinematographic abundance
review: Add to that lots of sharp , funny dialogue , excellent fast editing and a great cast , and it"s clear that " The Wolf of Wall Street " is hard to beat as the best film of the year .

title: Cash, debauchery and the pursuit of narcissism
review: Like two of Martin Scorsese"s more popular films , " GoodFellas " and " Casino " , " Wolf " relies on a cynical narrator who comments dryly on interesting situations .

title: Cash, debauchery and the pursuit of narcissism
review: Like both movies , it has the protagonist working his way to the top for the first half of the movie - " Wolf " chronicles his beginnings by being advised by his boss ( a brief but hilarious Matthew McConaughey ) on his first day of work on the benefits of drugs and sex on the job ; selling penny stocks for thousands after said job didn"t turn out well ; opening a firm with his ragtag pals and new partner Donnie Azoff ( Jonah Hill ) ;

review: and dumping his caring first wife ( Cristin Miloti )

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: The Wolf of Wall Street is one of the most anticipated movies of the year , mainly because it features the famous director - actor duo of Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio , who have previously worked on many good movies , like Shutter Island and The Departed .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: This movie is based on Jordan Belfort"s biographical book of the same name ,

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: and Belfort himself helped DiCaprio prepare for the main role .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: It"s important to point out that , because it was independently financed , the movie features lots of nudity , drug abuse and over - the - top sex scenes , which might make the viewing uncomfortable for some .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: Jordan Belfort ( Leonardo DiCaprio ) starts his career at Wall Street

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: but is soon fired because of the stock market crash in 1987 ( known as Black Monday ) .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: He manages to get a job in an investment center and , being the most successful broker , he teaches his colleagues how to sell .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: Soon , realising his potential and finding a partner – Donnie Azoff ( Jonah Hill ) – he opens a brokerage firm , Stratton Oakmont , where he and his colleagues start selling penny stocks and frauding people – all the while making more money than they ever imagined ,

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: and spending it on drugs and prostitutes .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: DiCaprio plays the perfect antihero : Belfort is a liar , he cheats on his wife , he steals money from people , he is constantly drugged out of his mind and so on .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: Still , it"s very difficult to hate him ,

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: and I think most people actually envy him : who wouldn"t want to have so much money , you can throw $ 100 bills in the trash without blinking ? DiCaprio"s performance is wonderful ,

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: and I hope he"ll finally win the Oscar he deserves .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: The supporting actors find themselves somewhat in his shadow ,

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: but do a terrific work nonetheless – especially Jonah Hill , whose experience in comedies fits the dark humour of the movie perfectly .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: And because this movie is filled with humour , I had no problem with its length : you don"t even realise it"s 3 hours long because it"s so entertaining .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: Like I said , the movie features lots of drug abuse and sex scenes , which some people may consider pointless or whatever ,

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: but I feel it doesn"t make any sense ( and is also hypocritical ) to consider it bad just because of this – which is an attitude many people on the internet seem to have .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: Also , this movie does not promote immoral behaviour .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: It"s like saying slasher movies promote killing : it"s a ridiculous and ignorant way of bashing a movie when you have no solid arguments .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: Finally , if you go see this movie , you"re going to get sex , drugs , violence and lots of swearing , all of it wonderfully incorporated in a great biography .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: The Wolf of Wall Street is not for everyone ,

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: but it"s a great movie I recommend to everyone who isn"t easily scandalised .

title: Pass the Popcorn review
review: Rating : 8/10 Read more reviews at http://passpopcorn . Com/

review: In the end , the movie forces the viewer to confront the unsettling question of whether we all secretly want to be Jordan Belfort .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: Wall Street happens to be one of the financial districts in New York .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: It houses one of the largest stock exchanges called the New York Stock exchange along with other financial headquarters .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: You love the environment in there ; it is pretty assumed that you go on a money minting spree .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: Martin Scorsese"s " The Wolf of the Wall Street " simply puts the emphasis on the Wall Street atmosphere , portraying the real life character of Jordan Belfort ( played by Leonardo DiCaprio ) ; who was convicted of fraudulent crimes for exploiting the stock market .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: Craftily scripted by Terence Winter , based on the book called " Jordan Belfort " , Scorsese evinces the character of Jordan Belfort as an orgy youngster having an unstinted appetite for money ( earned legally or illegally doesn"t matter ) and heavily addicted to cocaine , alcohol and sex .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: On losing his job owing to stock market crash in 1987 , Belfort trains a group of good - for - nothing folks to sell some of the useless commodities to some rich high - profile traders .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: Establishing a new firm called " Stratton Oakmont " , Jordan Belfort creates a befitting milieu to flourish what it is right to be termed as a " moneymaking business " .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: Going along too well with the wind of incoming wealth , Belfort divorces his wife Teresa only to marry Naomi ; the only girl who can satisfy Belfort"s ever growing lust .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: Scorsese does focus on sizzling intimate moments between the couple .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: A life rife with drugs , booze , magnificent bungalows , sleek sport cars and libidinous prostitutes slowly comes to a halt when the FBI steps in with their investigation .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: As showcased in most of the Scorsese films , the entire hurly burly in the major part of the movie is interrupted with planning & effort by the police .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: Unlike films like " Taxi driver " , " Casino " & " Goodfellas " , " The Wolf of the Wall Street " is devoid of the ultimate theme of redemption .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: In spite of that , the film lends us rolling - on - the floor - laughing moments coupled with sheer display of acting to the point of caricature by Leonardo DiCaprio .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: The formula of opulence coupled with laughter & poignancy has worked quite well on the celluloid .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: Matthew McConaughey has a remarkable role as Mark Hanna ; the guy who titillates the spark of minting fast money which has ignited in Belfort"s mind .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: Even though having sizeable movie length , it never seems to dull the audience and keeps them in an uplifted mood throughout .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: The Wolf of the Wall Street is smart , adept and uproarious .

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: A shrewd script blended with high brilliance ; Martin Scorsese makes it laudable

title: Smart, Adept and Uproarious
review: and discernible among others .

title: beyond the obvious it's quite a ride
review: and decides to branch off on his own .

title: beyond the obvious it's quite a ride
review: His success comes at a price though ,

title: beyond the obvious it's quite a ride
review: and he quickly gets plunged into a reckless lifestyle where the money rolls in and the party never stops , even when the federal government gets wind of his underhanded dealings .

title: beyond the obvious it's quite a ride

title: beyond the obvious it's quite a ride
review: but despite how off - putting it is at times , it"s never dull , with crafty direction from Scorsese ( very similar to his work in Goodfellas ) , enough twists and turns in the story to keep things from becoming redundant , along with a great cast and knockout performances from DiCaprio , Hill , and Robbie .

title: Excess on '80 Wall Street

review: but he knows he wants to get to the top ... Then a market crash puts him out of work .

review: Instead of working at a prestigious Wall Street firm he ends up pushing penny stocks , basically junk , to people who can"t really afford the losses they will surely face .

review: It is profitable though and he quickly realises he can make a real fortune selling junk to rich people .

title: Debauchery and excess are both themes and qualities of this compelling three-hour bio-pic.
review: Debauchery and excess are not only key themes of this three - hour bio - pic but also inherent qualities of it , as it continuously skirts the line between sincerity and satire in order to honestly evaluate its unlikable yet engaging protagonist and the compelling situation within which he finds himself .

title: Debauchery and excess are both themes and qualities of this compelling three-hour bio-pic.
review: Though " The Wolf Of Wall Street ( 2013 ) " never does much to punish the people who perpetrate greedy acts of criminal grandeur , it also never flinches from the unglamorous sides such an immoral life undoubtedly produces

title: Debauchery and excess are both themes and qualities of this compelling three-hour bio-pic.
review: and , as such , allows the audience to decide whether or not they condone what they see ( though it"s pretty obvious they shouldn"t ) .

title: Debauchery and excess are both themes and qualities of this compelling three-hour bio-pic.
review: This leads to an eclectic and compelling mix of both breezy comedy and downbeat drama that , if nothing else , should at least keep you entertained . 7/10

title: "The world of investing can be a jungle."
review: It"s reached the point as I write this that actors like Dustin Hoffman and Kevin Spacey have been outed ,

title: "The world of investing can be a jungle."
review: and lo and behold , Leonardo DiCaprio has been exposed for having employees under contract to his production company sign off on non - disclosure agreements so they don"t reveal the type of language and behavior that occur during project development meetings .

title: "The world of investing can be a jungle."
review: No doubt many of those meetings wind up like the debauchery fests on display in this film .

title: "The world of investing can be a jungle."
review: Not only that , but when the elites of the movie entertainment industry rail against the greed and the selfishness of the one percent , and mount their pedestals for gay rights equality , the filmmakers here have no trouble castigating the poor schleps who have to work at McDonalds , and depict a gay orgy gone wrong at Jordan Belfort"s ( DiCaprio ) swinging pad .

review: The hypocrisy on display here is so self evident that it"s embarrassing .

review: Not to mention the ever self righteous Rob Reiner as Belfort"s old man , lecturing Jordan on the proper way to treat " his penis and her vagina " on the younger Belfort"s wedding day .

title: "The world of investing can be a jungle."
review: Nor did he have any trouble referring to natives of India as " ... Dots , not feathers " .

title: "The world of investing can be a jungle."
review: There , I knew there was something else ; liberals decrying racism go racist when it suits them just fine .

title: "The world of investing can be a jungle."
review: The fall back position is that it"s in the script , or they"re just actors or comedians doing a job .

title: "The world of investing can be a jungle."
review: Yeah , that"s principle on display alright .

title: complete synopsis
review: The movie is an American crime drama which is truly based on the life of Jordan Belfort under the brilliant direction of Martin Scorsese and with a splendid performance by DiCaprio .
Wall Street with all the sleaze , alcohol , partying , drugs and illegal trading is well - stated in this 2013 film .
Leonardo DiCaprio literally owned the part as the sleazy trader who takes a dormant company and brings it to the heights with memorable shenanigans .
The object is of course to make money and have mayhem along the way with all the sexual activities going on among the employees and everyone living the care - free high life without cause for alarm .
We know that at some point that all of this must end because after all , illegal trading is going on .
This is basically the story of how the lust for money may destroy people within its grasp .

review: The first thing I noticed was Scorcese"s homage to one of his own films , the titular " Goodfellas , " where the protagonist ( DiCaprio ) gives a personal voice - over tour of the shenanigans of his entire crew , which by extension , numbers in the hundreds , the sleazy underbelly of the young turks who , by their singular obsession for wealth at any cost , seem to clearly be having the time of their lives .

title: Greasy good.
review: But as always , Scorcese manages the delicate balancing act between hardcore violence and overt law breaking with the chemically - fueled ecstasy of a life steeped in greed unburdened by guilt .

title: Greasy good.
review: And that is perhaps the closest he comes in the entire film to offering some sort of deliverance from the orgy of excess that this movie depicts so graphically — that there is always a bill to be paid for this kind of lifestyle that can be as extreme as the perks .

review: But what is most troubling is just how many people out there seem ready , willing , and able to pick up the tab for this kind of thinly - veiled crime .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: With his latest film , The Wolf of Wall Street , Martin Scorsese has directed yet another modern classic .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: Like " The Aviator " before it , his latest collaboration with Leonardo DiCaprio is another exceptional character study of a successful playboy whose flaws bring his world crashing down around him .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: Based upon the autobiography of the protagonist , Jordan Belfort , the story charts the career of a fraudulent stock broker as he works his way up the ladder of Wall Street from lowly telephone operator to the head of his own company ,

title: Sell me this pen.
review: and the inevitable crash that follows .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: The film opens with Belfort breaking the fourth wall to directly introduce the viewer to his life at its peak .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: He presents us with everything he has achieved

title: Sell me this pen.
review: and - by frank admission of his vices - everything he stands to lose , before whisking us back to the start of his career .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: This sets the tone of the film perfectly from the outset : Belfort is the stock we are investing in : an unstable commodity who will fluctuate wildly because he is an obvious liability .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: Over the course of the film he continues this trend .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: And in sharing his truths with us and us alone , he makes us complicit - bringing us along for the ride whether we like it or not .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: So we become another one of his marks , sucked in by his charisma .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: The acting is first - rate .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: Even from those in the smallest parts like Belfort"s private investigator Bo Dietl , playing himself with a relaxed , unforced authenticity as he appears to improvise dialogue about security risks with DiCaprio .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: In fact , the seamless improvisation by much of the main cast is what makes this film so enjoyable to watch : McConnaughey"s thin - faced , wandering - eyed , semi- hippy financial guru whose brief appearance is so compelling that it predominates much of the film"s accompanying trailer ; the boardroom scenes where dwarf - tossing and excessive lunch bills are discussed ( to the enjoyable outrage of veteran improviser Rob Reiner ) ; Jonah Hill"s outstanding confrontation with Jon Bernthal in the parking lot when he reaches for every insult he can think of , and DiCaprio"s exquisite quaalude - riddled , epic 10 metre journey from the doors of his country club to his Lambourghini - which is about as good a visual metaphor as you"ll see in modern cinema for the argument that no amount of money can buy even a shred of dignity .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: It is DiCaprio"s subtly mesmerising central performance that anchors the debauched madness when events become borderline unreal .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: He goes from naive first - dayer , to bug- eyed , drug - addled , vein - popping chauvinist financial compere -

title: Sell me this pen.
review: and all the way back again , notably for a scene in which he suavely tip - toes his way through a verbal minefield to make a savvy proposal of bribery to a federal agent .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: This mastery is expertly cultivated by Scorsese ; an auteur who seems to have a preternatural ability to determine when his actors are in full flow , how to inspire their confidence and how best to capture them on film .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: He does this particularly well in a series of scenes beginning with Hill"s character ( Donnie )

title: Sell me this pen.
review: and Belfort each taking a particularly powerful type of quaalude .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: Believing them to be duds , they each take a few more - despite having been told by the supplier to take only one .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: The dialogue hints that this course of action is a bad idea ,

title: Sell me this pen.
review: but the audience is distracted from this notion by a sobering phone call to Belfort that draws him to his country club .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: Here , Scorsese slots in an establishing scene of Belfort making the journey , getting out of his car and striding into the building - which seems almost superfluous .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: Belfort uses a payphone and conducts a tense conversation , absorbing the viewer entirely .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: Gradually , Belfort starts slurring his words .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: It suddenly becomes apparent that the quaaludes have kicked in .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: Then the aforementioned return journey to the car occurs

title: Sell me this pen.
review: and the task of navigating the steps that previously appeared to be so simple is given a comical , Herculean level of difficulty when juxtaposed with the apparently - unnecessary establishing scene from earlier .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: It"s this kind of complete attention to detail that makes Scorsese"s films a joy to watch .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: Another example of this occurs shortly after ; when Belfort arrives home to warn Donny that he should not be using the house phone because it is tapped .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: But , due to both his and Donny"s intoxication , Belfort can not make this concept clear to Donny , who is in the process of trying to conduct a call ,

title: Sell me this pen.
review: but failing for obvious reasons .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: So the exchange is essentially just the primordial bellowing of cavemen ,

title: Sell me this pen.
review: and the most incomprehensible business meeting in cinema history .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: It is also satisfyingly ironic - given that anyone listening in to the phone call would be unable to glean any information whatsoever from a conversation conducted in that state .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: At one point Donny begins to choke and Belfort leaps on top him .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: Then Belfort pauses for a flickering moment , as if he is considering leaving him to die - it would solve his problems if Donny has incriminated him in any way .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: But he continues and begins performing CPR .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: There is no allusion to this in the dialogue or narration ,

title: Sell me this pen.
review: and whether or not this was intentionally scripted or improvised by Scorsese or DiCaprio does not really matter .

title: Sell me this pen.
review: What matters is that it is so creative ,

title: Sell me this pen.
review: and shows such an excellent collaborative rapport between a director and his actors .

title: What a Movie!
review: Martin Scorsese"s " The Wolf of Wall Street " is abashed

title: What a Movie!
review: and shameless , exciting and exhausting , disgusting and illuminating ; it"s one of the most entertaining films ever made about loathsome men .

title: What a Movie!
review: Its star Leonardo DiCapriohas compared it to the story of the Roman emperor Caligula ,

title: What a Movie!
review: and he"s not far off the mark .

title: What a Movie!
review: Adapted by Terence Winter from the memoir by stockbroker Jordan Belfort , who oozed his way into a fortune in the 1980s and " 90s , this is an excessive film about excess ,

title: What a Movie!
review: and a movie about appetites whose own appetite for compulsive pleasures seems bottomless .

title: What a Movie!
review: It runs three hours , and was reportedly cut down from four by Scorsese"s regular editorThelma Schoonmaker .

title: What a Movie!
review: It"s a testament to Scorsese and Winter and their collaborators that one could imagine watching these cackling swine for five hours , or ten , while still finding them fascinating ,

title: What a Movie!
review: and our own fascination with them disturbing .

title: What a Movie!
review: This is a reptilian brain movie .

title: What a Movie!
review: Every frame has scales .

title: What a Movie!
review: The middle - class , Queens - raised Belfort tried

title: What a Movie!
review: and failed to establish himself on Wall Street in a more traditional way — we see his tutelage in the late " 80s at a blue chip firm , under the wing of a grinning sleazeball played byMatthew McConaughey —

title: What a Movie!
review: but got laid off in the market crash of 1987 .

title: What a Movie!
review: He reinvented himself on Long Island by taking over a penny stock boiler room and giving it an old money name , Stratton Oakmont , to gain the confidence of middle- and working - class investors .

title: What a Movie!
review: Per Wikipedia , at its peak , " the firm employed over 1000 stock brokers

title: What a Movie!
review: and was involved in stock issues totaling more than $ 1 billion , including an equity raising for footwear company Steve Madden Ltd. " Belfort and his company specialized in " pump and dump " operations : artificially blowing up the value of a nearly worthless stock , then selling it at a big profit , after which point the value drops

title: What a Movie!
review: and the investors lose their money .

title: What a Movie!
review: Belfort was indicted in 1998 for money laundering and securities fraud , spent nearly two years in federal prison and was ordered to pay back $ 110 million to investors he"d deceived .

title: What a Movie!
review: You can tell how much Belfort cares about his people by the way his narration segues from an anecdote about a broker who fell into a spiral of misery and shame : " He got depressed and killed himself three years later , " Belfort says over a photo of a corpse in a bathtub trailing blood from slit wrists .

title: What a Movie!
review: Then , without missing a beat , he says , " Anyway ... " The brokers classify prostitutes by cost and attractiveness , referring to them as " blue chips , " NASDAQs " and " pink sheets " ( or " skanks " ) ; they"re warm - blooded receptacles to be screwed

title: What a Movie!
review: and sent on their way , much like the firm"s clients , including shoe mogul Steve Madden , whose deal Belfort describes as an oral rape .

title: What a Movie!
review: The directorial high point is a Belfort - Azoff Quaalude binge that spirals into comic madness , with Azoff blubbering and freaking out and stuffing his face and collapsing ,

title: What a Movie!
review: and Belfort suffering paralysis during a panicked phone call about his money and then crawling towards his car like a nearly - roadkilled animal , one agonizing inch at a time .

title: What a Movie!
review: But the film"s vision goes beyond cultural anthropology and antihero worship .

title: What a Movie!
review: When people ask me what the film is about , I tell them that like a good many films by Scorsese — who overcame a cocaine problem in the early " 80s — at its root , it"s about addiction : a disease or condition that seizes hold of one"s emotions and imagination , and makes it hard to picture any life

title: What a Movie!
review: but the one you"re already in .

title: What a Movie!
review: Many people get a contact high from following the exploits of entrepreneurs , financiers , bankers , CEO and the like ,

title: What a Movie!
review: and when such men ( they"re nearly always men ) get busted for skirting or breaking laws , they root for them as if they were disreputable folk heroes , gangsters with fountain pens instead of guns — guys who , for all their selfishness and cruelty , are above the petty rules that constrict the rest of us .

title: What a Movie!
review: Such men are addicts , egged on by a cheering section of little guys who fantasize of being big .

title: What a Movie!
review: We enable them by reveling in their exploits or not paying close enough attention to their misdeeds , much less demanding reform of the laws they bend or ignore — laws that might have teeth if we hadn"t allowed guys like Belfort ( and his far more powerful role models ) to legally bribe the United States legislative branch via the nonsensical " system " of campaign financing .

title: What a Movie!
review: After a certain number of decades , we should ask if the nonstop enabling of addicts like Belfort doesn"t mean that , in some sense , their enablers are addicted , too — that they ( we ) are part of a perpetual - motion wheel that just keeps turning and turning .

title: What a Movie!
review: In the end " Wolf " is not so much about one addict as it is about America"s addiction to capitalist excess and the " He who dies with the most toys wins " mindset , which has proved as durable as the image of the snarling gangster taking what he likes when he feels like taking it .

title: What a Movie!
review: There will be a few points during " Wolf " when you think , " These people are revolting , why am I tolerating this , much less getting a vicarious thrill from it ? " At those moments , think about what the " it " refers to .

title: What a Movie!
review: It"s not just these characters , and this setting , and this particular story .

title: What a Movie!
review: It"s the world we live in .

title: What a Movie!
review: Men like Belfort represent us , even as they"re robbing us blind .

title: What a Movie!
review: They"re America , and on some level we must be OK with them representing America , otherwise we would have seen reforms in the late " 80s or " 90s or " 00s that made it harder for men like Belfort to amass a fortune , or that at least quickly detected and harshly punished their sins .

title: What a Movie!
review: Belfort was never punished on a level befitting the magnitude of pain he inflicted .

title: What a Movie!
review: According to federal prosecutors , he failed to abide by the terms of his 2003 restitution agreement .

title: What a Movie!
review: He"s a motivational speaker now , and if you read interviews with him , or his memoir , it"s obvious that he"s not really sorry about anything but getting caught .

title: What a Movie!
review: We laugh at the movie ,

title: What a Movie!
review: but guys like Belfort will never stop laughing at us .

title: One long, vulgar, celebration of Macho Hucksterism
review: In short , it was just one long , profane , loud , and ludicrous propaganda piece for macho American hucksterism , a long cocaine , sexed - up all - night party prepared for nerds in ties dressed up to act like slick stock salesmen .

title: One long, vulgar, celebration of Macho Hucksterism

review: From watching Nancy Meyers movies , I"ve learned that how they consume is evidence of rich people"s inner state .

title: Animal House
review: Money multiplies choices , and enough gives you the chance to do whatever you want .

title: Animal House
review: So the question becomes – what do you want ? For Jordan Belfort and the ( mostly ) guys he recruits , the answer is life as a permanent beer commercial .

title: Animal House
review: All they can think of to do with the money is to buy sex , to buy drugs ,

title: Animal House
review: and to buy stuff that shows everyone else you can afford to buy it .

title: Animal House
review: If you"re a 23 year old lower middle class young man , as Belfort was at the beginning of the movie , the prospect may well be irresistible .

title: Animal House
review: For someone else , maybe not so much .

title: Animal House
review: I found their behavior to be grotesquely funny and Belfort , his crew and his trophy wife to be objects of disdain – the cast of Jersey Shore on steroids , who have no idea what to do with what they have , and who can not communicate without bluster and obscenity .

title: Animal House
review: These are people who obscurely sense that they are looked down on by their betters , who are enraged by that fact , and who gleefully act out their rage by theft and by flash consumption .

title: Animal House
review: There"s one scene that makes the rage clear .

title: Animal House
review: Belfort invites the FBI agent pursuing him down to his yacht at the World Financial Center marina .

title: Animal House
review: First he offers food , then drink , then financial assistance .

title: Animal House
review: When the FBI man quietly calls him on it , Belfort drops his cool Master of the Universe act , tells the FBI to get the f * off his boat , and ends by tossing $ 100 bills at him to show how rich he is .

title: Animal House
review: Belfort can feel the agent looking at him like pond scum ,

title: Animal House
review: and he can"t stand it .

title: Animal House
review: We see almost nothing of how Belfort and crew make the money .

title: Animal House
review: Speaking through the fourth wall , Belfort , which is to say Scorsese , repeatedly tells the audience that we don"t care about how it"s done , or what it means ,

title: Animal House
review: and only want to see how it gets spent .

title: Animal House
review: What we are shown is the con man"s contempt for the mark as someone just as greedy as he is but much , much stupider .

title: Animal House
review: As far as Belfort is concerned , the guy on the other end of the phone deserves to be swindled because he thinks of the stock market as a magic genie that will make him rich without effort or understanding ,

title: Animal House
review: and because he is too stupid to know what he doesn"t know .

title: Animal House
review: Belfort is more disconcerting than Henry Hill or Frank Costello because he"s a lot closer to us .

title: Animal House
review: These other Scorsese protagonists are blue collar thugs who make their money through physical violence .

title: Animal House
review: Belfort starts out middle class , and he makes his money through a fraudulent variant on what is otherwise legitimate activity .

title: Animal House
review: It"s a lot easier to imagine ourselves , or our kids , doing what he does , which makes the respectable upper middle class viewer uneasy .

title: Animal House
review: He"s also more disconcerting than Irving Rosenfeld because he doesn"t know his place .

title: Animal House
review: Rosenfeld believes in the small time con as both safe and sufficient .

title: Animal House
review: Belfort wants to be somebody .

title: Animal House
review: He"s moving up the financial food chain from pump

title: Animal House
review: and dump to underwriting IPOs , and he wants his Long Island boiler room with the fake WASP name to be recognized as a real member of the club .

title: Animal House
review: He"s also desperate for adulation – he walks away from a deal with the SEC because he can"t stand a future without the adoration of his crew .

title: Animal House
review: But he never learns how to wear the mask of respectability , as Madoff did .

title: Animal House
review: He deliberately refuses to learn because he thinks enough money will force the establishment to accept him on his own terms , without needing the veneer of respectable manners .

title: Animal House
review: He is white trash rich and proud of his trashiness .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: Director Martin Scorsese"s ongoing collaboration with actor Leonardo DiCaprio has yielded highly entertaining , prestigious films ( The Departed , The Aviator ) .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: Their latest venture is the true , astonishing tale of Wall Street crook Jordan Belfort whose appetites for money , sex and drugs are a detailed observation on greed and temptation .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: An eager , young executive , Jordan Belfort ( Leonardo DiCaprio ) , experiences the Wall Street disaster of 1987 which wipes out investors and costs him a job .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: Anxious to bounce back , he discovers the art of selling unregulated penny stocks

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: and starts his own brokerage .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: Soon he is making a lot of money often at the expense of low income earners but also wealthy clients ,

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: and with the help of some cronies including new follower , Donnie Azoff ( Jonah Hill ) , begins to expand exponentially into a major force in the financial world .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: The emotional stress and pressure heighten his need for women , sex , drugs and then drugs upon drugs .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: As his excessive lifestyle spirals out of control , the FBI and Securities and Exchange Commission begin investigating his company"s illegal activities that signals the beginning of the end .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: DiCaprio ( Inception ) gives his all as the out - of - control executive whose wealth is surpassed only by his defiance and greed .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: It is interesting to contrast his younger , innocent broker with his later , drug addicted shark .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: With maniacal fervor , he inspires and rallies a company"s corporate culture .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: You are mesmerized by his bold , flamboyant salesman

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: and yet , you look for any semblance of redeeming qualities .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: In a sense , Jordan is a metaphor for our corporate society"s love of money and its ultimate corruption .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: Hill ( Moneyball ) really shows a good range as Belfort"s second in command .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: Can this be the same Jonah Hill who had a supporting role in Knocked Up ? Matthew McConaughey has a memorable supporting role as a mentor to Belfort ,

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: and their scene together at a rooftop restaurant where McConaughey shows a ritual of self motivation is a hoot .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: Margot Robbie is well cast as the beautiful woman who captures Jordan"s heart and more .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: Rob Reiner has an amusing supporting role as Jordan"s dad who sees the company as a sinking ship .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: In fact two other directors , Jon Favreau and Spike Jonze , have bit parts or cameos .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: Playing an FBI agent , Kyle Chandler , who has become the go - to actor for government types , is a good foil in his scenes with Jordan aboard a yacht .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: There are some memorable vignettes such as the outrageous attempts to smuggle millions in cash to Europe , the crazy office parties , and an especially hilariously pathetic attempt by Jordan to drive home at the same moment he has a very bad drug reaction .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: When the justice system corners him , Jordan faces a decision not unlike the protagonist in Prince of the City .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: You know how this is going to go down ,

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: and when it does , it is an astonishing reversal of fortune .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: At three hours , it is constantly engaging

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: and well paced from start to finish courtesy of veteran editor Thelma Schoonmaker .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: The sweeping camera shots and rapid cuts show Scorsese at the top of his craft .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: He tells much of the film through DiCaprio as narrator and voice - over .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: In fact much of this film will remind you of the style and structure of his Good Fellas and Casino ,

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: and the ending recalls another Scorsese classic , The King of Comedy .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: Make no mistake , despite excellent performances and a strong narrative , this film has scenes that are bordering on NC17 ; some scenes are so over the top in suggestiveness and explicitness that it would be hard to believe if it wasn"t true .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: The film"s depictions may lead some to question the filmmakers " intent ,

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: but Scorsese , without passing judgment , wanted to honestly show greed and power at its worst in the boardroom and the bedroom .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: Consider The Wolf of Wall Street as a supremely effective , cautionary tale of abuse of wealth at a time when such behavior flourished unchecked .

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: You might not like the passengers on this flight ,

title: The Temptations of THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
review: but it is a fascinating ride .

title: Going all out
review: The narrative opens in a somewhat familiar manner , the protagonist introducing himself via VO in a " present " mode then flashes back to how he started .

title: Going all out
review: The substance ( no pun intended ) of this introduction however can be characterized as pulling all the plugs , going all out , with obscene ( in more ways than one ) riches , marathon sex and drug , drugs , drugs .

title: Going all out
review: Then , the flashback shows Jordan Belfort"s ( Leonardo DiCaprio ) entry into a prestigious Wall Street broker firm at the lowest rung , received by the a most obnoxious character who for a second looks like the boss

title: Going all out
review: but is really just a most obnoxious senior co - worker .

title: Going all out
review: The boyish , completely disarming reception of the assortment of verbal insults tells you right away that Belfort is going places .

title: Going all out
review: The real boss turns out to be a congenial mentor played by Matthew McConaughey , a sales zealot .

title: Going all out
review: This is a cameo performance that is certain to win an Oscar , if there were a category for cameo performances .

title: Going all out
review: But don"t feel sorry for him , at least not until March 2 , and ONLY in the unlikely event that he does not win this year"s Best Actor ( defeating , ironically , DiCaprio ) .

title: Going all out
review: Moving briskly , the narrative continues to the first day after Belfort"s rapid acquisition of a broker"s license which turns out to be Black Monday .

title: Going all out
review: Darwin"s theory has never been so convincingly and conclusively demonstrated when Belfort joins a Mickey Mouse brokerage firm

title: Going all out
review: and loses no time at all to turn disaster into opportunity , using his superb selling skills to earn lucrative income by peddling penny stock .

title: Going all out
review: To his co - workers , it is an eye - opening demonstration of the magic of how a telephone and a voice , when used expertly , becomes the ticket to riches unimaginable .

title: Going all out
review: Note that this is completely unethical loading trusting clients with garbage stocks .

title: Going all out
review: Note also , however , that this is absolutely legal .

title: Going all out
review: The illegal stuff comes later , his final undoing .

title: Going all out
review: The three - hour roller coaster ride with Belfort from rags to riches

title: Going all out
review: and then downfall does not feel long , thanks to Martin Scorsese"s jubilant energy from beginning to end , at times oozing , at other times bursting .

title: Going all out
review: Matching him scene by scene is DiCaprio"s brilliant delivery .

title: Going all out
review: Due credit must also be given to a huge supporting cast , too many to be mentioned one - by - one , with the exception of Jonah Hill who has received an Oscar nomination playing Belfort"s loyal sidekick .

title: Going all out
review: The other 3 nominations completing a total of 5 are Best Picture , Best Directing and Best Screenplay ( adapted ) .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Jordan Belfort ( Leonardo DiCaprio ) is a master manipulator .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Trained to be a Wall Street stockbroker , Belfort"s life hits a small inconvenience when he is let go after the market collapses , forcing him to take a job at a penny stocks firm .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: That"s when he gets an idea , if stockbrokers get 50 % commission based on lousy penny stocks , why not sell them as if they were the greatest thing since 401ks .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: He starts his own firm , hires his own crew of borderline criminals and kicks the party into high gear .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Based on a largely true story about a scurrilous financial figure nicknamed " The Wolf of Wall Street " , Martin Scorsese"s newest feature largely succeeds in lampooning the financial markets of the eighties andwell the ones we still have today .. In fact the sheer lunacy of stock trading and market manipulation is summed up elegantly by Matthew McConaughey"s character at the beginning of the film , " It"s wazy it"s woozie , its fairydust .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: " The name of the game is to put the client"s real cash into your pocket , while leaving them with imaginary money tied up in the stock market . Right ? Right .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: So just two and a half hours to go .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: After the principle theme is introduced , the rest of the film consists of Gordon Gekko Jr.

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: And his conspirators making a name for themselves .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: That name is unbridled excess which actually leads to some inspiring moments .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Between Leonardo DiCaprio and Jonah Hill"s characters , the two do more drugs than a hippie crack den culminating in an overly slapstick moment involving a completely out of it DiCaprio driving a Lamborghini .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: There are constant parties , cheerleading , marching band playing and tons and tons of sex all throughout ; it"s all quite mesmerizing .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: It"s also quite numbing after a while when the audience comes to the realization that none of this is leading to anything .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Scene after scene of debauchery spliced with sardonic undertones and cheeky narration and soliloquies does not a good movie make .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: The fact that Wolf of Wall Street ( 2013 ) has been getting polarizing reviews can be seen as a testament to Martin Scorsese"s waning capabilities as a director .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Yet I wouldn"t count out the old master just yet .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Perhaps Wolf of Wall Street was meant to be polarizing .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: There is not a single redeemable character with maybe the exception of Belfort"s wife Naomi ( Margot Robbie )

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: and that is done on purpose .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: We as the audience are not meant to find Belfort"s antics amusing or heroic , though he considers himself a twist Robin Hood .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: We"re meant to be appalled by the character and disappointed when he gets his inevitable slap on the wrist .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Belfort is Gordon Gekko done right ; the master of a universe we don"t want to live in .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Scorsese"s condemnation of the Wall Street stockbrokers are in may ways harsher than Henry Hill of Goodfellas ( 1990 ) or Jake LaMotta in Raging Bull ( 1980 ) .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Belfort"s i d gets him into a heap of emotional and personal turmoil

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: yet the true tragedy is he"s left without catharsis or redemption unlike Ray Liotta who keeps his family or Robert De Niro who enjoys a crowded auditorium after the credits roll .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: There is no pat on the back or promise of reemergence .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Belfort is forced to live in modesty and obscurity .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: But Belfort did have his supporters among the audience that I saw the film with .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: At one point in the film Kyle Chandler"s straight edge FBI agent in so many words tells Belfort he"s going down .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: One audience member found it appropriate to blow a raspberry while the others including myself looked his was with scorn .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Thinking about it , I realized that audience member was actually rooting for Belfort and the board members of Stratton Oakmont .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Did he choose to ignore the inherent evil in what Leo DiCaprio was doing ? Or was he seduced by his wily charms and excessive lifestyle ? While being bombastic and lurid , The Wolf of Wall Street , like all good art , lets you decide for yourself if all the bacchanals and drugs were worth it .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: In one truly masterful coda , Belfort"s comeuppance , Stratton Oakmont"s dismantling and Kyle Chandler"s train ride home are accompanied by a cover of Mrs. Robinson by The Lemonheads .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: Each tableau conjures images of The Graduate"s ( 1967 ) final repose of Dustin Hoffman and Katharine Ross sitting in the back of a bus with the look of " what now " on their face .

title: Polemic Yet Still Pure Scorsese
review: It"s a good way to end a movie like The Wolf of Wall Street , I only wish it ended sooner . Http://www . Theyservepopcorninhell . Blogspot . Com
