title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: 1987 bought us Oliver Stone"s Wall Street ,

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: and in turn inspired thousands in wanting to become the next Gordon Gecko .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: Michael Douglas " Oscar - winning portrayal of the film"s villainous antagonist was brutal but honest ,

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: and the motto " Greed Is Good " was reflective of a decade of the " quick - buck " culture .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: That being said , it is easy to see why Jordan Belfort , the man who"s memoir has inspired The Wolf Of Wall Street , became so heavily embroiled in the world of stock brokerage , and eventually financial crime .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: The Wolf Of Wall Street tracks the life of Jordan Belfort , an ambitious young salesman whose ambitions seem to far outweigh practicality and realism , in what is quite literally a twisted rags to riches tale of excess and corpulence .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: Somewhat ironically we meet a fresh faced Belfort ( Leonardo DiCaprio ) in the same year as the release of Stone"s picture , setting up the as vulnerable and naive yet driven and determined to succeed and provide for his family .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: Throughout the course of the film we follow Belfort"s evolution from " lower than pond scum"(as described by the first Wall Street stockbroker we are introduced to ) to President and co - founder of Stratton Oakmont .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: A combination of bad choices and bad luck ( in addition to what may be described as karma ) however soon begin to signal Belfort"s life unraveling

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: and the metaphorical waves literally begin to consume him .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: The character of Jordan Belfort is fascinating ,

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: and it is near - on impossible not to feel some semblance of pity and sympathy during the harder times which are endured .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: While demonstrating chauvinistic , selfish and sexist traits at times , DiCaprio maintains a sense of charisma

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: and appeal which make Belfort relatable even when committing his most debaucherous acts .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: It is easy to see why parallels to " Wall Street " have been drawn .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: Covering almost identical subject matter from a near identical time frame , even the character of Gordon Gecko is alluded to during a particular scene , demonstrating a clear awareness of the context and influences that evidently shaped Belfort into becoming the titular " Wolf " .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: The parallels to Stone"s 1987 picture are evident throughout , however we see far more semblance and similarity with Scorcese"s previous work such as Goodfellas than of Stone"s fictitious tale of Bud Fox and Gordon Gecko , in particular with regards to the first person narrative and non- linear story arc .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: Jonah Hill and Margot Robbie provide exemplary supporting performances as best friend Donnie and ( 2nd ) wife Naomi respectively ,

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: but neither can take away from the mind - bending show DiCaprio gives as the titular " Wolf " spanning emotions from incredulous anger , to slapstick physicality and drug - addled stupor .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: While admittedly overlong , there is argument to suggest the hefty three- hour run time is justified and reflective of the characters need for excess and corpulence - I don"t particularly buy that argument as the film does feel baggy at times , however given the fantastical nature of Belfort"s story it is understandable that Scorcese would want to include as much as humanly possible for such an ambitious biopic .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: Other than length , my only other reservation with the film was believability .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: Based on the aforementioned memoir , some scenes show a level of self - referrentiality and awareness of the fact that the story is told form Belfort"s first person perspective .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: Where the contrast is not actively shown on screen however , it does sometimes become difficult to sift fact from Belfort"s clearly wild and unwavering imagination .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: Critics of The Wolf Of Wall Street have lambasted it as indulgent and over - aught ,

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: and it is clear to see why this is the case .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: After all , Scorcese does not attempt to depict the victim"s of Belfort"s immoral and illegal activity

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: and therefore provides no perspective by which to judge his questionable actions .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: Without contextualizing Belfort in this way , it is easy to see why some have felt a lack of engagement and/or empathy with / for the films anti- heroic protagonist , however I would argue that one does not need to agree with or even necessarily like any given character in order to engage with , feel empathy for and/or learn from .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: I would recommend this movie to any Scorcese fan or in fact anyone who enjoys black comedy and is not averse to the ( not - so ) occasional bout of sweariness , sex and illegal substances .

title: A Wolf In Sheep's Clothing
review: If for nothing else though , see this film for Leonardo DiCaprio giving the performance of a lifetime .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: Sometime I wonder if an author , writer , or director , can continue to produce quality material long after they have produced their masterpieces ,

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: and what this movie tells me is that Martin Scorsese still has it .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: I have always admired the films that have come out of the mind of Scorsese ,

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: and this film is no exception .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: What surprised me though is that there were actually quite a few laugh out loud moments in this film , which is a first for me when it comes to Scorsese , because most of the films that I have seen of his tend to be deadly serious .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: While this film is itself serious , there is quite a lot of light hearted moments ,

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: and I must say that DiCaprio has certainly come a long way since the days of his want to puke teenage characters .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: However , if you do take a look at most of the films that DiCaprio has been in it is quite clear that he is interested in taking the decent rolls in the decent films .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: This is the story of Jordan Belfort , a kid that pretty much took Wall Street by storm ,

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: and it exposes the true nature of the greed that dominates the financial industry .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: I read an article in the Australian Financial Review where a number of stock brokers were incredibly offended at this movie because they thought that what it did was really stain the name of their profession ( as if their profession wasn"t stained anyway ) .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: However , what I suspect is that what Scorsese has done is lifted the veil on the industry to expose it ,

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: and the industry has reacted in the way that would be expected .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: I am not surprised that the industry is full of sex and drugs , that is what happens when you end up making more money than you know what to do with ,

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: but also what happens in a lot of cases is that when you fly high , you crash hard .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: While the brokers may be crying foul and unfair , we must remember that a lot of this cowboy money making attitude was occurring even in 2007 before the global financial crisis .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: However , what is clear is that the people who end up being busted and convicted , end up being little more than scape goats .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: The real crooks are the ones that sit in the board rooms running companies that are exploiting the resources of the Earth and polluting the land in which we live , while living comfortably in their gated communities .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: Much of what went on here was still going on in 2007 .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: In Australia we enacted laws in response to pretty much ban commissions for selling stock because what that would do would interfere with the ability of the broker to be looking out for the best interests of their clients .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: It is clear , and we are told from the beginning , that the job of the broker is not to make money for their clients ,

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: but to make money for themselves .

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: In fact , as is also clear , the big money is in the so called penny stocks , the stocks that are too low to be listed on the major indices , and as such find it very hard to raise capital from investors , so they offer brokers large commissions to brokers to flog it off to unsuspecting investors ,

title: Scorsese Still has his touch
review: but the reason that they are so low is because they are high risk stocks that are more likely than not to not actually pay off .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: Very rarely does a film weave in AND out of Best Picture of * insert year * territory ,

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: but Wolf of Wall Street manages just that .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: Accomplishing exactly what No Country For Old Men did years ago , this film was the greatest work of cinema in the calendar year----until the final act .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: That cursed final act that ultimately prevented this from becoming the Wall Street version of Goodfellas and Scorsese"s best movie since The Departed .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: The first two acts was a man"s man"s man"s man"s film .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: It was ballsy , it was gutsy , it was directly in your face , out of control ,

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: and so full of testosterone you become unsure if you can handle it all .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: It threw you right into the world of Wall Street where there were no signs of softness and Martin Scorsese directs this with a certain rampant speed and attitude that made it all the grittier and edgier .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: The language , sex , immorality , and take - no - prisoners approach to life within the broker industry was in full display

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: and even though it got jarring , it was still breathtakingly entertaining to watch .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: The script held nothing back , and neither did the editing , directing , and especially the acting .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: Leonardo DiCaprio gives one of the best performances of his career ,

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: and gives it an energy and furor that would make 90s Jim Carrey impressed .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: He threw everything he had in this role , as it required a stamina that very few actors can successfully manage .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: Even Daniel - Day Lewis couldn"t provide a taste of the mayhem that DiCaprio provided .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: The rest of the cast excluding Jonah Hill ( Who really , really bogged the movie down a bit ) were also superb , especially Matthew McConaughey in a role that was far too short .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: The soundtrack was blazing and skipping around like an indecisive teenager using an IPod shuffle , the amount of detail was staggering , and there wasn"t a single dull moment .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: Although our lead character was a terrible human being , you couldn"t help

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: but be mesmerized and slightly jealous at all his success , while also be enthralled at the cutthroat business he was engaged in .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: And then came the final act .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: This movie already had a heavy Goodfellas vibe from the getgo , bringing with it a predictable aura that brought the movie twisting towards a downward spiral that never recovered .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: If the first half felt like an adrenaline shot to the chest , then the latter half felt like a full bottle of sleeping bills taken simultaneously .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: With the shift in tone and pace , all the setbacks from earlier were suddenly being put out in full display .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: The editing suddenly looked weaker , the script suddenly lost focus ,

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: and the movie got repetitive , really fast .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: There was a great sequence of physical comedy from DiCaprio that forgave all the issues temporarily ,

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: but it was immediately followed by multiple failed chances to finish the movie in a strong note .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: Easily 35 - 40 minutes could have been cut , limiting the movie"s predictable final act .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: But before you know it you are watching the slow descent into despair that muddles heavily after the animated testosterone - laden personality of the first half .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: Scorsese should know better , instead of coming off like a gambler who doesn"t know when to quit while he is ahead

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: and ending the evening dead even .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: Wolf of Wall Street is wildly entertaining ,

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: but being half a spectacular movie shouldn"t earn you Best Picture , no matter how good the opening half is .

title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: But Best Actor however .. Is definitely , definitely here .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: This is a great film – a class act .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: However , the " blogomentary " about whether Jordan Belfort was a scumbag or not or whether this film glorifies his real - life escapades is missing the point .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: Scorcese"s and DiCaprio"s achievement with this epic , monumentally amoral cinematic portrayal of American decadence , degeneracy and depravity is immense and - oddly or not - immensely satisfying .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: It is a film after all ; first and foremost it should be viewed in this light , albeit one that is truly deserving of an Oscar for Marty and for Leo ( and I would argue , for the screenplay and possibly a few other categories to boot , ( e. G. Production design , cinematography ) .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: And if we think Belfort is a " scumbag lowlife " who just happened to live the high life at the expense of others , it"s scary to think that there are not only plenty more " Belforts " out there like him ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: but that they are - individually - even bigger " scumbag lowlifes " than him .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: And collectively ? Well , let"s not even go there shall we ? In the end , Belfort was a bit player , a bottom feeder in the Great Ponzi Scheme that is Wall Street .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: At least he got to pay a penalty ( of sorts , anyways ) .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: Which is much more than we can say about the bigger , much more amoral " scumbags " that brought the financial system of the world to the brink , and most of whom ( Bernanke , Summers , Geithner anyone ? ) were called in by firstly Bush Two –

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: and his Judas - goat successor , Obama – to " fix " the system after it went pear shaped .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: To paraphrase one of the characters in The Wire when questioned why players kept allowing the character " Snotboogie " in the neighbourhood crap - game despite his penchant for skimming the booty and scamming the other players - he replied , " that"s America , man ! "

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: And without a radical revolution in the way America " manages " its wholly dysfunctional financial system just for starters - not to mention a complete overhaul of the anomalous values and warped ideals underpinning the much touted " American Dream " that seem to inhibit anything remotely resembling institutional reform – the " Belforts " will just keep on a - coming .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: Without that aforementioned reform , it will be like playing " Whack - a - Mole " ! For every " chancer " like Jordan Belfort , there are a 10 , 000 + suckers , marks and mugs out there inhabiting the American Dreamscape who will readily buy into someone else"s get rich quick scheme / scam because they are unable to resist the siren call that soundtracks that Dreamscape " .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: If we allow it to do so , Scorsese"s achievement lets us reflect on that unnerving , disturbing reality ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: and maybe , just maybe , give some of us pause about where we are going and what we are prepared to do to get there .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: In simple terms , this is one of the best films I"ve seen in years - as acidic social commentary and darkly , pitch - black satire alone it works a treat , and then some .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: After much of the dross we get inundated with that passes for quality storytelling / filmmaking , to some degree it has restored my faith in the ability of the movie business to actually make films that mean something and are relevant to the modern world .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: Indeed , WOWS is one of modern cinema"s greatest amorality tales , although I"m not sure that was what Scorsese intended .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: As for entertainment , well I for one was royally entertained .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: For those who do view it and feel the same way and yet might be worried by that , then maybe you should view it as a " guilty pleasure " . It works for me .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: For that matter I didn"t realize Scorcese had such a flair for comedy .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: I was pissing myself at some of the scenes .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street - "That's America man!"
review: For further deliberations on the American Dream not too far removed from Belfort and his cohort - and other amorality tales from the Land of the Doodle Dandies - go here . Http://poxamerikana . Wordpress .

review: but this time taking place in the worlds most notorious financial district , Wall Street .

title: A crazy, satirical account of over indulgence.

title: A crazy, satirical account of over indulgence.
review: This is the life of Wall Street trader and big time swindler Jordan Belfort ( Leonardo Di Caprio ) .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: You might be inclined to ask yourself , " a three - hour movie about money , how can that be the least bit interesting ? " Don"t worry , for Martin Scorsese"s grand " dramedy " The Wolf of Wall Street is not a movie about money .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: The lead character himself directly acknowledges this fear early on by stating that " we wouldn"t be interested in all that stuff " , afterwards largely avoiding the subject altogether .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: So don"t go in expecting any dreary financial number crunching , since it"s really all about what money does with people .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: People , inherently flawed , get progressively flawed – read : effed up – as their income increases astronomically .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Meanwhile , every sense of ethics , responsibility or even plain decency goes right out the window .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Scorsese"s case in point : Jordan Belfort .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Belfort , a superb piece of acting by Leonardo DiCaprio , starts out as many a regular Joe from the middle class : screwed over by a financial crash

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: and reduced to unemployment , unable to provide for his wife .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: All the more disappointing for him as he had just found a job at a large Wall Street firm , where his boss ( an impeccably loathsome Matthew McConaughey ) saw his potential and advised him not to abstain of sex and drugs while on this job .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Thanks to Belfort"s talent for aggressive sales pitching , he quickly recuperates selling worthless stock at a fifty percent commission rate ,

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: and before long he returns to Wall Street triumphantly with a loyal band of peculiar misfits in his wake ( including Jonah Hill on steroids ) , all of whom have their specific place in his grand scheme of taking money from the ignorant masses that hope to make a quick buck .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: The only one making easy money are Jordan and his friends though ,

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: and before long they become increasingly desensitized to the plight of their clients in favor of their own ruthless acquisition of wealth .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: " The Wolf of Wall Street " is born ,

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: and despite Jordan"s all too human persona , such a term fits him perfectly , as this alpha male and his pack of wild dogs scour the land preying on the weak and gullible to feast upon their cash in a financial frenzy .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: One that seemingly knows no bounds , as Belfort continues his practices for years without sanctions , despite ongoing FBI scrutiny .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Nevertheless , Belfort needs no help in bringing him down , as he does a fine job at that on his own .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: In many ways The Wolf of Wall Street is a fairly typical story of a man gaining the world but losing his soul in the process , as he is unable to keep his base instincts in check .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Arguably , it"s not the plot that makes the movie stand out , it"s the way Scorsese tells it to his audience .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Walking a fine line between comedy and drama that finds both in perfect balance throughout the whole , The Wolf of Wall Street proves infectiously hilarious at one moment

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: and effectively poignant the next .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: As Jordan"s novel lifestyle as a millionaire progressively takes its toll , his personal life spirals ever more out of control emotionally and physically as his constant drive for more and more dominates his every move .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Fondly remembering his former boss " advice , Belfort sets out on a course of rampant sex and drugs without worrying about any consequences , as money will no doubt solve any obstacles in his path .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Small wonder his wife soon leaves him as she finds him snogging a super model .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Marrying said model doesn"t increase the happiness in his family life , children notwithstanding .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Abusing every conceivable illicit substance imaginable also doesn"t work in his favor .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Despite the many yachts , limousines , prostitutes and drugs , Scorsese makes it amply clear that this is not a life to be envied as Belfort"s once decent personality is replaced by a greedy , amoral and self - annihilating character that can only get the better of him , sooner if not later .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Having become a veritable slave of money , Belfort remains miserable ,

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: and we wouldn"t have it any other way , as his road to a personal hell is paved with one outrageously funny messed up situation after another .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Aside from DiCaprio"s top performance , Scorsese gets the very best out of his cast and crew in conveying this tale of human deterioration at the hands of boundless greed , which often borders on the unbelievable .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Exploding planes , savage storms at sea , goldfish eating , dwarf tossing and the generally lavish parties of debauchery at the office heralding the weekend are among the many elements of The Wolf of Wall Street that are so absurd , they can only be true .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: In terms of comedy , nothing beats the delayed kicking - in of exceptionally rare drugs that causes a most unwelcome physical reaction at an hour of crisis at which the need to get home fast results in one of the most humorous car scenes ever on the big screen .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Despite all the controversy , the many scenes of nudity and excessive swearing feel rightfully placed ,

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: and credit must be given to both the director and his brave cast to stick with such daring material instead of catering to a general sense of good public taste , something Belfort severely lacked .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: The fast paced , witty dialogue written by Terence Winter proves to be in excellent hands of the assembled cast of seasoned actors , including the likes of Jean Dujardin , Rob Reiner , Jon Favreau , Kyle Chandler and Joanna Lumley .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: Stylistically there"s little to comment against the picture as the ingenious editing , wonderful cinematography and delightful score , featuring many a successful callback to the period in question , are found to be in perfect sync to make for a superior cinematic experience .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: But The Wolf of Wall Street at its heart remains another intimate collaboration between the grandmaster Scorsese and his personal muse DiCaprio , their fifth and finest thus far .

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: The duo makes damn sure you care enough about Belfort to run along with him for three hours ,

title: Scorsese and DiCaprio's finest collaboration thus far
review: but never are you really allowed to sympathize with him , given his deplorable nature .

title: Just shy of vintage Scorsese.
review: It"s rare to see an R18 + motion picture get a cinematic release these days , what with it not being financially ripe and such stuff , so it"s fantastic that Martin Scorsese"s tale of debauchery and greed didn"t get shunned by the mainstream cinemas .

title: Just shy of vintage Scorsese.
review: After the family - friendly ( and superb ) Hugo , Scorsese has returned to his fascination of crime with this recount of stockbroker Jordan Belfort"s financial rise through illegal trading and how he threw his millions away on drugs , parties and , well , whatever the hell he liked .

title: Just shy of vintage Scorsese.
review: It"s a crazy ride , and the master director digs deep into his bag of tricks – trippy zooms , unbroken takes , toying with aspect ratios and camera lenses – to keep the pace rollicking and pulse thumping .

title: Just shy of vintage Scorsese.
review: Arguably the highlight among all of the course language , nudity , sexual activity , drug use and all round obscene behaviour is the central performance from Leonardo DiCaprio .

title: Just shy of vintage Scorsese.
review: This is Leo at his most daring and intense ; his Belfort is a slimy , selfish , egocentric douchebag who is eminently watchable and somehow , against all odds , even manages to retain a slither of our sympathy .

title: Just shy of vintage Scorsese.
review: Wolf is not quite vintage Scorsese , however , even at 71 years old , the man with classics like Taxi Driver , Raging Bull , Goodfellas and The Departed on his C. V. Proves he is still at the forefront of filmmaking in Hollywood .

title: The Academy will be 'crying Wolf'!
review: We first meet Jordan as an innocent 22 year old , a fish out of water in the overwhelming world of the New York stock market , trying to make a name for himself .

title: The Academy will be 'crying Wolf'!
review: Over the course of the early 1990s we retrace the Wolf"s steps as he transforms from a humble family man to a ruthless , domineering drug addict raking in $ 49 m a year and gallivanting with legions of gorgeous women .

title: The Academy will be 'crying Wolf'!
review: However , the fabric of Belfort"s success soon begins to unravel as he is pursued by the authorities , becomes consumed by addiction and greed , and is alienated by those closest to him .

title: The Academy will be 'crying Wolf'!
review: The way the character self - destructs is captured brilliantly by DiCaprio , he appeals to our empathetic side playing a broken man who couldn"t quit while he was ahead .

title: The Academy will be 'crying Wolf'!
review: DiCaprio brings raw energy to a role that demands it .

title: The Academy will be 'crying Wolf'!
review: He exudes charisma and seamlessly slips into Belfort"s " Wolf " persona conveying his dizzying highs and tormenting lows through his god - given acting talent .

title: The Academy will be 'crying Wolf'!
review: If he is overlooked by the Academy this year , cries of " fix " and " conspiracy " could very well ring throughout the auditorium .

title: The Academy will be 'crying Wolf'!
review: DiCaprio"s job is certainly made a hell of lot easier by the truly delicious cast Scorsese has assembled around him .

title: The Academy will be 'crying Wolf'!
review: Also tipped for Oscar success ( Best Supporting Actor ) is Jonah Hill , playing Belfort"s neurotic business partner Donnie Azoff .

title: The Academy will be 'crying Wolf'!
review: It was recently revealed that Hill took the SAG"s minimum pay of $ 60 , 000 for this role , simply because he was desperate to work with Scorsese , one of his heroes .

title: The Academy will be 'crying Wolf'!

review: and distancing himself from his " gross - out " comedy roots .

title: The Academy will be 'crying Wolf'!

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: It comes as no surprise , of course , that Martin Scorsese has found a new muse .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: After his career - defining work with Robert De Niro over three decades , Scorsese has turned his camera on Leonardo DiCaprio , with whom he"s now made five movies in the space of about ten years .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: That"s a pretty impressive number , and a statistically unlikely good set of films to boot .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: The Wolf Of Wall Street is easily the finest of the lot : a high - wire , high - octane corporate comedy that"s as entertaining as it is excoriating - a delicious blast of hellfire distilled into the year"s most outrageous biopic .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: Based on a true story , Jordan Belfort ( DiCaprio ) is a clean - cut kid who starts working in one of Wall Street"s top stockbroking firms in 1987 .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: His boss Mark ( Matthew McConaughey ) is a vision of Jordan"s future : a man corrupted inside and out , marching to his own odd tribal chant , hopelessly hooked on drugs , alcohol , women and money .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: When Black Monday forces Jordan to take a job selling penny stocks to the gullible lower class , he picks up a few more tricks of the trade .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: He resolves to set up his own company that will earn him and his buddies untold sums of money .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: Soon , he is the talk of the financial sector ,

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: and his profligate ways earn him the scrutiny of the federal authorities .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: Many have cried foul over the moral bankruptcy that purportedly riddles Scorsese"s film .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: Detractors have argued that The Wolf Of Wall Street seems to be celebrating Jordan"s way of life and the varied excesses in which he indulges and soon comes to take for granted .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: Certainly , having it all strung together - constant drug - taking , casual sex , unchecked profanity , dwarf - flinging competitions - can indeed be too much for viewers of a more sensitive or conservative disposition .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: But there is no glorification of Jordan"s lifestyle in The Wolf Of Wall Street .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: It"s placed front and centre , and then mined for a constant stream of bitter , brilliant black comedy .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: We are not meant to sympathise with Jordan , though we can certainly be charmed by him as many of the people he encounters invariably are .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: Even while we are kept endlessly amused by his increasingly desperate attempts to stay rich and privileged , there is never a point when we"re asked to emulate or respect this man .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.
review: In fact , it becomes clearer as the film goes on that we"re not laughing with him - we"re laughing at him , as he sinks into a murky swamp almost entirely of his own making .

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.

title: A brilliant character study that doubles as razor-sharp social commentary.

review: Set in the 1980s , The Wolf of Wall Street tells the true story of Jordan Belfort ( Leonardo DiCaprio ) ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street: The Leader of the Pack
review: and his desire to be rich instantly .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street: The Leader of the Pack
review: Growing up in poverty , Belfort"s only dream was to be rich ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street: The Leader of the Pack
review: and what better way to do that than in stocks ? At the young age of 23 , Belfort and his wife , Theresa ( Cristin Milioti ) , head to New York so Belfort could learn the ways of Wall Street .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street: The Leader of the Pack
review: Being taught by stock tycoon Mark Hanna ( Matthew McConaughey ) , Belfort quickly transforms from a mild mannered hometown boy to a drug addicted , adultering wolf , that is , of course , the stocks crash , Hanna"s brokerage firm closes , and Belfort is out of a job .

review: and sees no put - together businessmen in thousand dollar suits ,

title: The Wolf of Wall Street: The Leader of the Pack
review: but he instead sees large , sweaty guys in collared shirts and sweatpants .

title: The Wolf of Wall Street: The Leader of the Pack
review: Belfort"s hopes rise once again as soon as the firm"s owner tells him that the commission on the stocks sold , penny stocks worth six cents a share , is 50 % , which means that if Belfort sold $ 10 , 000 worth of shares , he gets $ 5 , 000 straight into is pocket .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Needless to say , but Martin Scorsese is one of the best living directors , and has kept the consistency .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: He has brought us classics such as Taxi Driver and Raging Bull to Goodfellas , Gangs of New York , and my favorite , The Departed .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: But now Mr. Scorsese has brought us another great film that is a must see for all Scorsese fans , The Wolf of Wall Street .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: With this film , Scorsese is collaborating with star Leonardo DiCaprio for the fifth time .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Here , DiCaprio stars as Jordan Belfort , a Wall Street stock broker who never knew when to say quit .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: The film begins with him starting out at a Wall Street firm manning phones .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Shortly after beginning work , his boss Mark Hanna ( Matthew McConaughey ) takes him out for lunch

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: and coaches him on how to survive on Wall Street by recommending to Jordan to take up his lifestyle of drugs and prostitutes .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: After a the firm goes out of business , Jordan"s wife Teresa ( Christin Milioti ) finds a job in the want ads that will fit him .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: His new boss Dwayne ( Spike Jonze ) gives him new information about the stocks his place sells and offers an unusual reward if he sells ten thousand dollars worth of stock .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Jordan"s selling strategy hugely impresses all of his coworkers

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: and earns him a fortune .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: At a diner , Jordan meets Donnie Azoff ( Jonah Hill ) , a salesman who coincidentally is a neighbor of Jordan"s who wants in on his business .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Shortly after , they have their own firm

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: and recruit some of Jordan"s old coworkers to join in .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Standing out among them is Jordan"s friend Brad ( Jon Bernthal ) , who also deals drugs .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: However , the firm has become wild and crazy , which causes Jordan to hire his dad Max ( Rob Reiner ) to handle the finances .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Jordan also throws many wild and crazy parties involving drugs and sex .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: At one of his parties , Jordan meets Naomi ( Margot Robbie ) ,

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: and they hit it off leading to a divorce from Teresa and a new marriage to Naomi .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Jordan"s actions lead to an investigation of him and his firm Stratton Oakmont by FBI agent Patrick Denham ( Kyle Chandler ) .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: In the three hour run time Martin Scorsese has put on this film , he gives his audience a wild and crazy ride through the life of Jordan Belfort .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: As a storyteller , Scorsese doesn"t hold anything back .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: He is not afraid to show us the sex these characters have or have us witness these people doing drugs .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: I do think that some parts of the film could have been trimmed down ,

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: but Scorsese keeps everything in that is important to Jordan"s story .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: The times does fly by quickly .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Terence Winter wrote the script and does a great job of making the story run smoothly .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Winter does a great job at writing out the dialogue for each of the characters ,

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: but the cast also does excellent at bringing Winter"s script to life .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Leonardo DiCaprio continues to show why he keeps starring in Scorsese"s films ,

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: and shows a lot of greatness here as Jordan Belfort .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: With this role , DiCaprio brings confidence , craziness , determination , and a lot more .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: DiCaprio fleshes out this character and makes him into somebody who is living his dream ,

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: but doesn"t know when to say quit .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: The rest of the cast is great too .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: I truly enjoyed Margot Robbie as Jordan"s second wife Naomi .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: She takes this role of the wife

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: and makes her into a strong and attractive who knows how to stand up to her husband .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Rob Reiner is great as Jordan"s dad Max who is there for his son and goes nuts at times but can turn the craziness off at the right time .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Jon Bernthal is also great as Jordan"s drug dealing friend Brad .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Jonah Hill is good as Jordan"s right hand man Donnie Azoff , but excessively over the top .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: The standout of the supporting cast is Kyle Chandler as FBI agent Patrick Denham .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Chandler is excellent as the agent who was assigned to the case .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: With his scenes , Chandler makes some great acting choices with his eyes that indicate Denham"s intelligence .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Like all of Scorsese"s films , there are some great things that stand out technically too .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: The cinematography by Rodrigo Prieto is nice with the lighting in each scene .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: Thelma Schoonmaker , who has been editing Scorsese"s films since Raging Bull , does a lot of great work with making each scene dramatic or exciting and putting the whole thing together .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: While I highly enjoyed The Wolf of Wall Street , I must say that this is not for everyone .

title: For Martin Scorsese Fans
review: I recommend this for Martin Scorsese fans and those who enjoy great acting .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: Now when Oliver Stone"s Wall Street premiered in 1987 , the character Gordon Gekko ushered in the physical manifestation of greed in American consumerism .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: Gekko would dismantle and profit from a company , simply because it could be destroyed .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: Now Jordon"s Belford"s novel " The Wolf of Wall Street " , follows a similar direction , less having to do with the business aspect of his illegal dealings ,

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: and more to do with who he was .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: In Martin Scorsese"s latest project , Leonardo Dicaprio delivers the Gordon Gekko of the 21st century , technically the 20th ,

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: but really who cares in that respect .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: The rage and ecstatic enthusiasm Dicaprio has always brought forth in his characters has once more proved remarkable in this recent collaboration with Scorsese .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: As Belford Dicaprio captures a charisma that is both fascinating and addictive in this character study of a film , as it is made clear from the constant voice - over narrations made by him that all he wants is money ,

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: and as the story progresses , mostly through the characters , Belford"s quest for power is shown with so very little restraint that you think maybe Scorsese bribed a few Studio execs to get this movie made .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: Starting out with a simple marriage ,

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: and eventually moving up into the big leagues , Jordon Belford began his climb to the top when he founded Stratton Oakmont , a boiler room which marketed penny stocks .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: It didn"t take very long for Belford to see the weaknesses in such a small and minuscule business , giving him one chance after another to profit off the gullibility of simple minded people with fraudulent sales stocks .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: In time , Jordan formed a cheeky but wise team of swindlers with enough gull and enthusiasm , though not much brains at first , to reach higher and higher levels of monetary gain .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: His right hand man was Donnie Azoff ( Hill ) , a businessman just as mad , and just as self - destructive as Jordan Bell , and most of this praise goes to the stellar and energetic performance Jonah Hill delivers as he once more breaks from the conventional comedian role into more zany and out of the box characters , following his Oscar nom in 2011 for Moneyball .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: Aside from this film being a satire and black comedy , it really is not meant to be funny , according to Martin Scorsese ,

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: and that comes from his initial desire to show the darkest aspects of humanity within his characters .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: In a way , The Wolf of Wall Street shares so much similarity with Scorsese"s 1990 film Good Fellas that as Belford from time again takes us through the story , breaking the fourth wall to add a little humor , it becomes very clear by the confidence , the profanity , and the smug arrogance is the spirit a confident Ray Liaotta had shown in one his role as Henry Hill , who in a way shares so much with Dicaprio"s Jordan Belford that eventually it becomes clear what the story is about .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: And that is the characters and the examination Scorsese takes in portraying this darkly comedic Greek Tragedy .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: One of the most fascinating aspects that is prevalent within this film is the total lack of restraint it has when giving a gritty and in your face style kind of humor , sadness , and drama to that matter .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: There rarely goes a scene without Belford popping Quaaludes , or stepping into an orgy where the scene is cynically narrated by his remarkable honesty , and even when any modesty does come from this connoisseur , it is solely for the means of his self - centered agenda of greed and buffoonery .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: The wolf of Wall Street says a lot about not just American culture , and its many flaws ,

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: but it really speaks about much deep - seeded questions regarding the dark nature within human beings .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: It questions the notion of greed ,

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: and it presents it in the manner in which it remains unsolved .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: In a Hollywood Reporter interview , promoting the film , Leo Dicaprio elaborated on the nature of greed ,

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: and although it is essential to our own survival , it still begs the question as to whether it can be conquered .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: It has been a part of the survival of not just our species ,

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: but really any living organism that thrives .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: Martin Scorsese in the same interview weighed in on the matter , believing that we as human beings are still far from ever solving that predicament within our biological construct , while also acknowledging that each of us individually have qualities within us that are detestable to even the most lenient of moral standards .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: Now although this notion of greed seems almost impossible for any species to conquer , especially one like ours which is self - conscious , it certainly is a unique question regarding both the positive and negative aspects of it .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: In Wall Street Gordon Gekko says , " Greed , for a lack of a better word is good " , explaining the capabilities it holds when implemented .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: If one could really sum up the notion of greed is really that it is a double edged sword .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: It remains essential to our survival on any kind of level , be it social or physical .

title: My name is Jordan Belford.
review: On the other hand , it can corrupt us to the point where the very satisfaction we get from it has lost all meaning that it becomes numb within its indulgence , thus making as empty and without purpose .
